text: Pours brown, amber and translucent with a fizzy white and tan head, slightly lingering, with a hint of hazelnut and malt on the nose. Tastes mellow, nutty and of malt and hazelnut. There is a hint of sweetness with a light to medium body and slightly more than minimal carbonation. Easy to drink.
some alcohol chocolate liqueur and a bit of nut. foamy and in comes some scorched Earthy Yakima hop with western malt, they pair so well together.

Pours translucent dark brown, fizzy, with a medium off-white head and some sticky lacing. Very rich aroma of hazelnuts and bread. Tastes quite sweet with strong of roasted malts, hazelnut, bread, caramel, and mild hops. Very smooth and creamy, sticky feel, average carbonation, long finish, lingering hazelnuts. 
Overall an excellent brown ale, very nutty and tasty, surely one of the best in its style!
12 oz. bottle nutty, with a hint of chocolate in the aroma, very dark. really late, as your about to take another sip this slight coffee taste appears

Bottle 0.33
Восхит Орехи!! Много орехов! Очень классно.
Zapach słodu, trochę mdły. Orzech laskowy skryty gdzieś w tej mdłości. W smaku wodniste, słodkie, jakby lekko maślane. Puste i mdłe.
Bottle shared at work. Chestnut brown coulour brown head. Nose is intense nuts. Waay to intense. Taste is mogyoros reggelizopehely. Watery mouthfeel.

Draft, drunk while talking with John. Brown colour with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted hazelnut, malt, roasted chocolate. Mainly sweet with flavour of roasted hazelnut, roasted chocolate, light malt, slight hoppy. Light bitter aftertaste that goes well with the sweet taste. Quite thick and flavourfull. Warming alcohol feeling in the throat. Heaby and full beer. Really good.
0,355 l. Bottle. Brown color with beige head. Hazelnut aroma. Hazelnut, fruit, sweet, watery and chocolate taste.

Kaatuu lasiin kastanjanruskeana. Tuoksussa karamellisuutta ja pähkinää. Aavistus myös luumua. Maussa ei niinkään enää pähkinää, vaan hiilihapotus tuo hieman raikkautta. Loppumaku on greippimäinen. Helposti juotava brown ale, jossa pähkinä ei kuitenkaan ole pääosassa.

Copenhagen 18/5 2017. 35,5 cl bottle from Skjold Burne. Semi-Bald guy saluting with a Hazelnut Brown Nectar I assume. Pours light brown with bubbly off-white head. Settles as free floating patches of foam. No Lacing. Aroma is intense and rather sweet. Nuts, brown sugar and friede fruit. Soft carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is sweet. Followed by very light bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet and nutty. I preferencer my brown ale slightly more beer - but it is a very decent specimen.
Dark brown/cider color; Medium body; Aroma of malt, hazelnuts, & spice; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, nice hazelnuts, chocolate, and some light hops; Good one.

Nose of syrupy caramel.
No bubbles/foam. Light attack charged with hazelnuts and toffee. Light body, a bit creamy. Very light finish, no bitterness.

Flavor is a bit too artificial and body a bit light for this kind of flavor to stay.
355ml bottle. Clear brown with a small off-white head. Caramel, hazelnut and roasted malts. Good but not remarkable.
Bottle. Great balanced brown ale with taste of hazelnuts. Good drinkability
Low carbonation. Great Brown Color. Aroma of hazelnut is Awesome (almost muesli like). Fine ale/

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 Bomber from Liquor Barn in North Burnaby. A dark brown ale with generous tan head and a nutty hazelnut nose. This is confirmed on tasting. Sweet and creamy hazelnut goodness. Low bitterness as expected. Lovely! 4

Murky brown in the glass, beige head. Aroma of intense hazelnut, hazelnut cream, slight toast in the background. Taste is sweetish, low carbonation; flavors of intense hazelnut, hazelnut cream, really taste thanks to natural hazelnut flavor used in the brewing process. Besides that, slight toffee, very slight note of roasted malt, and a touch of caramel. Medium to low body, watery texture, average to high carbonation.

Very intense aroma of hazelnut. Just like nutty coctail or something about that. Earthy background, but as I said dominated by hazelnut with bready roastiness. Dark ruby in the glass with minimal head. Taste is dry with notes of hazelnut pudding. Very creamy with bready roastiness and hints of nectar or nutty syrup. Minimal hoppy finish, but beer is dominated by hazelnut. Very good, but carbonation was too high. Maniacs of nuts - prepare yourselves.
bottle. hazelnut aroma is nice, but body is weak and not well carbonated. feel is watery a bit.

Pours brown pour with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is roasted malt, hazelnut, caramel. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Nutty finish.
Very interesting beer. There is a subtle hazelnut flavor that come through on a nice background of malt with just enough hops to not make this obnoxiously sweet.
Dark clear brown, nice roasted hazelnut, smooth finish. March madness 2017
Light sweet beer with hazelnut beard taste, that is like nutty butter made in to a beer

Ambrée foncée, aux reflets bruns rougeâtres, ensemble doux, un peu huileux, notes noix et chocolat mêlé de fruits rouges légers, légère acidité. Pas vraiment mauvais mais pas mon truc. Bouteille 35.5cl, achetée chez Monoprix, Paris, France, bue le 16/03/2017.

12oz bottle. Amber brown color with an off white head. Slight nut and malt aroma but not much. Strong hazelnut flavour with a slight malt finish. Nut flavour lingers. Medium body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl bottle purchased @ Monoprix. Notes de fruits à coque et légère amertume.

33cl bottle. dark brown with light tan head, short lasting. Flavour is nutty and brown sugar notes. Taste dominated by nuts but less intensive than expected also caramel notes. Medium to low body, soft carbonation

35,5 cl bottle. Dark red/brown color with not much of a beige head. Aroma is pure hazelnut, especially when stirred. Also malt and peanut butter, some toffee, a little citrus in there. Taste is along the same lines, but with more citrus and the hazelnut comes in very strongly at the finish. Not the biggest fan of hazelnut, but that part works pretty alright here anyway. A bit too much of a brown ale/IPA hybrid though, Id prefer more body, even more malt and less hops (even though its not bitter at all). Beyond that, its a solid brew, pretty high drinkability especially if youre into hazelnut.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2017 This was a pretty good surprise. I chose this one without knowing what to expect and I wasn?t disappointed. I usually tend to drink stronger beers, but its rather low alcohol level should not keep you away from this one as it is one of the most pleasant and tasty beer I had. Very sweet, close to no head and almost oily in mouth, and a delightful, quite present, nutty aroma. Not a beer you?d choose to get a refreshing drink, but goes perfectly with a good meal or a quiet moment. Damn cool! APPROVED BY TAVERNY?S BLACK METAL CREW!

Better than it scores, hitting just the hazelnut notes you want without growing cloy or gimmicky. Huge nutty malt notes, with hints of Toblerone and a mild Brit bitterness, leading to a yeasty, semisweet fade. Tasty but ugly, and the texture is pretty slack.
Bottle (355 ml) @ Full Moon Brew Work, Phuket, Thailand 20170222. Roasted malty and nutty, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is roasted and nutty.
Overall crazy hazelnut or even Nutella flavour. Very pleasant and one of its kind.

650 mL bottle served in a shaker- cant believe I havent had this one... poured a darkened brown color with maroon tint when held to a light source, razor thin white ring about the vessel for a head with very minimal lacing, aroma of caramel, various nuts, and a touch of honey. Hits the mouth with a light medium body, malt is in place as expected, middle has some sweetness and heft to it, finish has an oddly drying but pleasurable experience. A bit all over the map, but good.

Appearance: clear amber-brown with one fat finger of dense beige head, good retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: hazelnut, peanut, caramel. (8/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, moderate bitter. (7/10) Palate: medium body tending lightly watery, moderate carbonation, slightly sticky medium duration finish. (3/5)

Having just recently tried their Hazelutely Choctabulous, I thought Id go back and re-review its 60% component, since the last time I tried it was more than three years ago, when frankly I didnt have the first clue what I was doing. And, not surprisingly, my score from back then was excessively high. Upon sober re-review, I conclude that this is slightly one-dimensional (all nut, all the time), slightly too sweet, and prone to a slight tendency to thinness in the finish. I can see how the addition of the Chocolate Stout (which I will be trying next) remediates those issues to make the Hazelutely Choctabulous as enjoyable as it is. (14/20)
12oz Bottle pours amber brown. Thin head. Aroma is sweet malts and nuts Flavor follows suit
The hazy Nutcracker. Malty Goodman with a lot of Brown Spirit. Metallisch, clear und angeroggt. Für zwischendurch..Nectar passt....the oily one ;). 0,1/1 Bon. BRAUKUNST LIVE 2017.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a light beige foam. Aroma is hazelnut, strong toasted malts, caramel, chocolate. Light body, a bit thin but never losing its game, still kicking on that light nutty sweetness. Soft carbonation to drag it all down into a bitter-sweet caramel palate. Could be a tad drier, but otherwise a really nice late night downer.

Bottle. Pours amber brown. Thin head, quickly dissipates. Aroma is sweet and light. Flavor opens very mild and thin, developing sweet hazelnut notes mixed with some toasted malt. Thin mouthfeel. Simple and very drinkable.
Rich brown colour with capucino foam and intensive hazelnut aroma, vanilla and biscuits. Sweet taste and malty

Bottle. Clear dark amber body, small beige head with average retention. Aroma of buckwheat honey, toffee, hazelnut waffles and vanilla beans. Taste of roasted hazelnuts, caramel, cookie dough, hints of herbs and roasted malt. Considering the style, this is very flavorful.

Bottle: 355 ml, Price : 0,99 eur
Tamsi ruda spalva, gelsva puta.. geras skonis
Leicht trübes, dunkelgbraunes Bier. Geruch nach Bier und Haselnuss. Geschmack ebenfalls sehr nussig, süßlich und mit einem relativ ausgewogenen Geschmack und Bittere.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 30A / 19C). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 02/2017). AROMA: predominant medium-high hazelnut aroma with a low malty-sweet background of toasty and toffee character. no hop aroma. APPEARANCE: dark ambar color and clear. medium-low ivory head with medium-low retention. TASTE: predominant medium hazelnut flavor, followed by a medium-low toasty-like malt background. medium-low bitterness with a semi-dry to dry finish. PALATE: medium-light body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: an interesting brown ale but with excessive hazelnut balance.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2017 Bottle at home. 355ml/ Expiry date : Februar 2017. Pours reddish brown, almost no head. Big hop taste, caramel, malts, sweetness, hazelnut...low carbonation, more godlike malt sweetness and hazelnuts. Pleasent bitterness...my mouth is watering for another sip, and another, and another... excellent.
Clear brown body with a thin beige head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, hazelnut. Taste is sweet and low bitter. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottiglia 33cl. Rosso scuro, aroma di nocciola e malto caramellato. Idem in bocca dove si percepisce anche un pò di vaniglia. Corpo medio, nocciola sempre presente ma mai nauseante. Rogue non ne sbaglia una!

Had a bottle at Pub Italia, and arrived with average size head that doesnt stick around long but leaves a bit of lace. Has a dark amber appearance with reddish hues. Aromas are pretty much hazelnut for me and not much else, maybe light malts as well. Flavours of hazelnut are at the forefront for sure, along with light chocolate notes and hints of vanilla. Some mild roasted malts also. Nectar coming from citrus hops. Creaminess at first, slightly watery at the end. Pretty smooth mouthfeel with a little bit of the hazelnut in the finish. Very good but I think one pint is sufficient, otherwise the taste becomes too much.

Bottle. Reddish Brown in colour, Red against light. Hazelnut aroma. Very Malty; very very nutty, toasty/roasty malts, caramel. Sweet nutty malty with slight balancing hop bitterness. Dry nutty aftertaste. Rather one-dimensional. Easy drinking. Decent. (2011-10-01)
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Bright brown with a small head. Notes of sweet malts, nutty, hazelnuts, light syrupy and some light vanilla. Good!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 Kastanienbraune fsrbe, der wenige schaum der sich bilfet idt weiss. Atoma: Haselnuss ganz klar und deutlich, milchschokolade, Toffee und herbe Sahne. Geschmeidiger, süßlicher Antrunk. Sehr cremig, fast ölig, ne richtige dichte im Körper. Samtiger Abgang, herber Kakao. Wow!

2017/01/19 - Pours a hazy medium brown/amber colour with a thin, creamy, khaki coloured head that quickly dissipates and leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is strong hazelnut, hints of dry dark fruit, roasted malt, butterscotch, cocoa, biscuit and light vanilla. Taste is more hazelnut, biscuit, light cocoa, toffee and roasted malt. Mouthfeel is medium, with lightly biting carbonation and a lightly sweet, dusty, drying finish. Highly drinkable. Hazelnut takes center stage without being overbearing. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours a dark reddish brown with a small offwhite/light brown head. Aroma has a huge hazelnut sweetness and toastiness in the front, cocoa, vanilla, milk chocolate. Taste has a lot of hazelnut aswell, light bitter notes, coffee, milk chocolate, dry cocoa, caramel. This is a brown ale I can slam!

Pours brown from the bottle and leaves a thick frothy head that soon subsides to a thin, creamy layer. A sticky lacing clings to the glass. The aroma is all hazelnut and chocolate. Reminded me sof Nutella. Taste is lightly sweet, nutty, with a chocolate undertones. The finish is bittersweet and nutty, but takes a light sour twist. Overall quite good, although the taste did not quite live up to the aroma.

Bottle. Brown color, medium white head. Aroma is malty, nutty, light caramely, cocoa and chocolate. Taste is light roasty, malty, lught caramely, nice nutty with chocolate and cocoa, notes of vanilla, solid hoppy, medium sweet finish

12oz. Pours a reddish mahogany with an off-white head. Aroma is overpoweringly hazelnut with brown sugar and toffee malt. Taste is hazelnut, caramel, light chocolate, some roast, some fruit, and vanilla. Somewhat sweet. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Fairly thin but smooth and slick mouthfeel.
0.5 draft @ Fermentoren   Basically hazelnut everywhere with vanilla, butterscotch and some milky additions. Almost full. Terrific and quite drinkable.

Una Brown Ale de color marrón, turbio de baja carbonatacion y espuma color mocha. Su aroma privilegia los frutos secos, destacándose las almendras, chocolate con leche y el café. Su sabor es a café con notas de almendras y chocolate con leche, con un final amargo insípido.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ fermentoren. Pours reddish brown with an off white head. Aroma is extremely hazelnut forward. Also some vanilla, caramel, butterscotch and milk chocolate. Taste of hazelnut, vanilla, roasted coffee, chocolate, cocoa beans and caramel.
Good malty carmel nose, hazelnut in the nose. Solid smooth caramel malt with a good toasty taste, obvious hazelnut flavour. Feels a little, slapped on, but not bad overall.

Bottle @ Køge øldag w senior & friends/the chef. Appearance: clear brown with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, nuts, light chocolate, biscuit, light dried fruit and some floral hints. palette: strong malty and nutty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average to long duration and an oily texture. Overall: very nice brown ale with a nutty twist.

A brown ale so dangerous that a six pack is quick and risky business. Smooth as can be from the delicious hazelnut and light caramel malt. Smooth and sweet, friendly for those taking a turn toward darker brews. The best brown ale on the market

Bottle. Pours dark brown with light tan head. Nose of brown sugar and nuts. Some bread malt, caramel, brown sugar, and nuts. Thinner body than expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2017 Hazy red/brown with strong frothy tan foam. Aromas of hazlenut chocolate spread, rather sweet and with light hints of salted caramel popcorn. Palate, medium body with lighted but smooth texture leavong lightly bitter finish. Taste, mainly sweed developing into biterness with nutty, lightly fruity and somewhat floral notes. Overall, failry light but with amazing aromas and rather naice taste beer, interesting and unusual!

0.33 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with Vinja 666 and Goran. Thanks! Murky dark amber, small off-white head. Malty, cardboard, some caramel. Hazelnut ice-cream, watered down Nutella, strangely sweet and roasty. Light to medium body, medium carbonation, abrupt sweet finish. Strange, but not sure if this is a successful brew, maybe not fresh if it makes any difference considering the style?

Bottled 355ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Amber coloured, small to medium sized pale beige head, pleasant nutty nose. Moderate malty, caramel, decent nutty and light hoppy with notes of sugar and distinct nutty finish. Quite pleasant beer.

From a 355ml bottle on 30/12/2016. Pours a murky amber with not much of a head. You really get the hazlenuts in the nose, along with some caramel and toffee. Flavour wise its very sweet and malty - chocolate, caramel, toffee, nuts, biscuit and brown sugar, with just the barest hint of hops. The body is full, the palate quite rich and the carbonation average. A very enjoyable sweet brown ale.
Draught. Brown colour, weak head. Aroma of hazelnut, bit artificial, in taste better, medium sweet with some chocolate and caramel. Medium to low body, soft carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours brown color, beige head. Aróma of nuts, peanut butter, nougat. Taste is medium sweet, lot of hazelnut, peanut butter, chocolate, bittersweet finish.
Draft. Cloudy brown with small cream head. Relativly sutle aroma of hazelnut but with rich taste of the aformentioned with sweet malts and brown sugar.
Braun. Geruch nach Haselnuss und Nutella. Geschmack ebenso, allerdings leicht wässrig.
Aroma 7. Appearance 4. Taste 7. Palate 2. Overall 13. A nice hazelnut aroma and taste, but overly sweet.

Bottle. Pours dark red almost brown color with small-medium head. Aroma of caramel, nuts, some dates. Taste has more pronounced character of nuts, also here is bubble gum, dates, vanilla, caramel. Nuts are pronounced especially in aftertaste. Sweet. Medium body. Overall: nice one with not so much overly pronounced character of hazelnuts

Pours deep dark brown with an off white head. Big hazel nut aroma. Hazel nut up front with background flavours of coffee and chocolate. It has a smooth body and is easy to drink. Great beer from the taste to the art on the bottle, but i dont understand the cow and pig symbol on the label, I thought it was going to contain meat.
Big nutty aroma in a reddish brown black pour. Nutty start with a malty caramel body and a crisp clean finish leaves one wanting another. A very tasty variation on the style done as you would expect.

A brilliant looking brown, with a full light tan head and a deep toffee coloured body. Hazelnuts front and centre in the taste profile. Toffee, butter, plums, cereal, biscuit malt and coconut add fresh additional elements. A really nice blend with a strong nut lead, which I love in a Brown Ale.

Nice bottle with all information - perfect!!
Red brown beer with nice cappuccino head, smell is hazelnut, taste is also hazelnut and coffee, not bitter or sweet, thin texture, medium body, very good beer with hazelnut aroma 
(I have 0.65l bottle with best-before 30.04.2017)
Aromat gotowanej brzeczki. Za to w smaku wspania?e orzechy laskowe! Br?zowa barwa i lekka piana dope?niaj? ca?o?ci! ?wietnie piwo
Taste: Nice complex nutty, creamy sweet, hazelnut notes. Smooth nutty aroma. Mahogany, mostly clear, with nice lace to the head. Medium body. Some hops, and agave nectar sweetness for balance.
12 oz bottle. Pours dark amber with off white head. Aroma is sweet toffee nutty. Taste is sweet hazelnut honey like with a malty hazelnut finish. Too sweet for my tastes.

Right off the bat you get the smell of hazelnuts, backed with some slight caramel and chocolate notes. The slight bit of foam dissipated within seconds, and what was left was a dark amber beer, with a hazy reddish-tint. Because of the carbonation the first bite is bitter, but then the subtle taste of hazelnut come through, and with a little chocolate/toffee as I let the beer warm. The body was medium, and in some mouthfuls it did feel slightly thick. Overall a good brown ale, with some nice hazelnut notes; however their was not so much complexity.

Drank from a 22 oz. purchased from Walmart. $6. Shared by 6 people. Tasted like a brown should taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber with minimum off-white top, which diminishes quickly. Aroma is very weak, some hazelnut in there some maltiness and honey notes at the back. Beer is very well balanced, some aggressive carbonation upfront quickly gives way to a more subtle malty and full taste. A nice fresh finish makes the beer an excellent amber!
從泡沫到酒液
Налил. Цвет коричне& Понюхал, попробо& Вот это действи& нектар. Орехова& бомба и в носу и на языке!
Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is pecans, hazelnuts, nutty cereal, maple / brown sugar. Taste is clean, smooth and dry malts. Great aroma. Very drinkable.

From tap. Dark amber to light chestnut brown with an off-white head. Aroma of sweetish roasted malts with honey and some flowery hoppy notes. Medium body with a medium to heavy sweetness and a light bitterness. The taste is rich of roasted malts with honey, brown sugar, molasses, biscuit and a nice distinct aroma of nuts in the finish. Very nice brew.

Dégustée avec mon Appiantiqua dans nos petits verres Duvel: jolie robe Acajou avec une fine mousse couleur crème peu persistante et une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des arômes chocolatés intenses mêlés par la suite à des notes vineuses ,épicées..La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec la bonne amertume des amandes et le goût des noisettes dans une harmonie extraordinaire.Une bière très vivante(de nouveaux goûts arrivent au fur et à mesure de la dégustation),originale,riche et subtile avec une finale assez courte mais plaisante.

Goûtée avec mon Kittenbieer dans un petit verre Duvel 18cl.
Température de début environ 6°.
Belle robe acajou surmontée dune fine mousse crème peu persistante; bonne carbonatation.
Nez absolument extraordinaire sur la noisette version gâteau ou macaron : une véritable madeleine de Proust!!!
Le goût ajoute de délicates notes de vieil alcool et de chocolat/cacao dans une très belle harmonie.
La finale est brève et légère mais plaisante.
Une bière originale mais fort bien réalisée qui fera lunanimité.
From decervecitas. In Teku glass. After dinner. Too much hazelnut here, in aroma and aftertaste, so much that even makes me want to puke. I like hazelnuts, but this is excessive

Ambar oscura, rojiza. Espuma ocre de poca duración. Deja película. Clara avellana en el aroma. En boca resulta aguada, pero con un sabor agradable, malteada, con la avellana predominando, y notas de chocolate. Rica pero sin cuerpo.

Been drinking this for years and wont event get sick of it. Beautiful beer with a great brownish red color, aroma like nutty molasses, taste is smooth with a little sweetness and a nice subtle hazelnut flavor.
Bottle. Light but nice aroma of hazelnut and roast, hint of toffee and caramel. Taste is dry, light sweet and bitter. Flavor of nuts, caramel, hint of citrus seeds at aftertaste.

I bought this bottle in a Monoprix, in Paris. I drank it tonight, relax at home, during this nice but cold day. In my point of view, it is a delicious beer, original. First, there is a nice brown color, thin foam, middle low carbonation. The first impression is that you drink a doppelbock. There is a side of malt, toffee, little smocked but there is a really nice touch of nutd at the final, discreet presence of hop and a bit watery, refreshing and pleasant for the soul.

W aromacie sa wyczekiwane orzechy, troche palonosci,, przypalonego pieczywa, bardzo intensywny zapach
W smaku jest deserowo, delikatnie, gładko, łatwo pijalne i niska gorycz, posmak lodów z orzechami, masła orzechowego, nutelli
Podsumowując bardzo dobre piwo, takiego Risa zrobić omomom

Orangy colored pour. Loads of hazelnut on the nose, reminds me of belgian chocolates. Yum yum dessert. In addition to the hazelnut milk chocolate, slight notes of coffee, sweet malts, bitterness from coffee. Very smooth and buttery. Very focused flavor profile, yet shows nice restraint.

Bottle, 355mL. Home. A sparkling brown amber beer with a medium beige "oily" head ; average retention. Hazelnut, roast, caramel, red berries. Medium sweet, round, light dry bitter refreshing. Light to medium body, thin texture, average carbonation, sweet toffee finish. Overall, a good brown ale ; nice roasty character.

Pours a thick brown head with lightly torrefied malts. No hazelnut in nose. Dark Amber colored body. Explosion of hazelnut chocolate in mouth without the thickness though. Medium length.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ruby amber pour with nearly no head. Very nutty nose. Weak, soft mouthfeel. Uneventful flavor. Some nuttiness. Finishes bitterly.

Bottle porgu Tallinn good solid brown colour lovely sweet hazelnut chocolate aroma taste same so sweet like a kinder Bueno in a glass just up my street this nice malty finish smooth and light carbonation which is perfect normaly brown ales too dizzy for me.

Aroma espectacular resinoso y a avellanas
Muy buen aspecto y carbónatacion correcta
En boca explosión de sabores, maltosos, frutos secos. Compleja

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours brown with a beige head. The aroma is Nutella and toasted malt. Nutty and malty flavor. Low bitterness.
Pours a clear medium brown with a big head of white foam. Nice aroma of hazelnuts. Nice roasted nutty flavor but not that great. A tad thin. Fairly enjoyable. Ok but not great.

nuts, caramel, brown, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, light body, creamy, flat. Intense, nutty aroma. Muddy brown color, but not off-putting. Hazelnut of course, but equally caramel in taste. Soft and smooth on the tongue, dark chocolate aftertaste. The right beer for the right time to be sure; unfortunately I drank this on an empty stomach and missed the opportunity to compliment a meal.

Birra alla nocciola estremamente equilibrata... ha profumo non è complessa... buono l aroma, l aspetto é fantastico, in bocca é molto equilibrato... ottima birra... da abbinare a dolci ma anche a qualche carne  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
One of my all-time favorites. Never get tired of this one. Very smooth, delightful beer.
un profumo fantastico, nocciole, cioccolato e caffe, il tutto cremoso e intenso. birra spettacolare

Fantastic! Surprisingly un-Rogue-like. Very mild hops for an American Brown. Interesting raisin like caramel. Beautiful hints of red!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle from Boxbeers. Copper brown with white/beige head. Aroma is lots of hazelnut, fruity, spices/herbs, cardamon, cinnamon, nutty, malts. I feel like having "äppelkaka". More of the same spices in the taste, medium sweet, not bitter at all. Light body, creamy with soft carbonation. A beer for the winter or with a dessert, on its own its a bit too much of the cardamon vibe.
Brown with small pale brown head. Malt, biscuit, oat, the flavor is biscuit, sweet malt. A hint of chocolate is found in the aftertaste. Well-balanced beer.

That sweet hazelnut aroma is so intense, it feels almost solid as it creeps up your nostrils and takes hold of your brain. The taste follows up like a second assault, rich and complex, the perfect followup to the aromatic introduction. This goes right to the top of my favorite beers.
A rich beer with an excellent hazelnut taste, perfect fit to go along with a chocolate dessert
Another one I cant believe I never rated before. On tap at TJs. Poured a deep amber color with a small sizded off white head. Hazelnuts, vanilla, and caramel. Personally not a hazelnut fan.
Medium brown with red hues and a small off white head. Aroma is some toffee with a Touch of medium toasted malts. Nutty sweet flavor with a short bittersweet aftertaste. Medium to light palate

Couleur ambrée/brune, mousse qui se fait vite la malle. Au nez ça tape plutôt dans le chocolat. En bouche également avec un subtil complément de noisettes (sisi !), mais aussi de caramel, genre toffee, sans quil ny ait la moindre trace damertume (ou si peu). Hélas le finish est gâché par une grosse note aqueuse, ce qui est bien dommage car le début est pas mal plaisant.
Flesje gekregen van Benzai en gedronken met Tom. Zeer sterk aroma van gebrande hazelnoten. Smaak van noten en koffie. Nasmaak is iets bitter.
This bottle is shared by Inoven. (With special thanks to Benzai) the color is dark brown. It has little foam. It smell and taste have a hint of roasted hazelnuts

From the bottle, the pour is hazy and dark auburn in color with a light brown to maple colored head that lingures. The aroma is milky like skim milk and nutty. The taste is hazelnut initially quickly followed by roasted malts and hints of coffee. The finish is malty with a medium mouthfeel.

330 ml bottle. Bought in a Jumbo supermarket in Santiago. Smells fantastic! Strong yeast very sweet and cereal smell. Brown/red color with creamy big head. Taste surely is a little hazelnut in it, but it fades. I would like a little more puch in the end, but still is really good. Creamy in the mouth and an easy drinker enjoyable moment.
Nutty, sweet brew. Really easy to drink maybe too much if youre not careful. Medium body and not much of a head. A beer anyone will enjoy.

35,5 cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured a clear hazelnut brown with a very small half finger tan head that dissipated very quickly. Light carbonation. Lovely aromas of loads of hazelnuts, then some vanilla, milk chocolate and caramel. Taste: Hazelnuts, nougat, toffee, vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, malty but watery mouthfeel. No bitterness. A thin body with a malty, sweet hazelnut finish. After the great aroma the taste is a bit of a disappointment. Kind of one dimensional. This was drinkable to me but nothing more. It had potential but its way too watery with a very flat carbonation. I expected a lot more from this brew...

Pours clear light brown with minimal tanned head 
Aromas of hazelnut, caramel, hints of fudge, hints of burned caramel , vanilla 
Taste has notes of vanilla, fudge, hazelnut, hints of butterscotch, nougats, caramel 
Mouthfeel is sweet, medium bodied, low to medium carbonation, low bitterness
0,33 l Flasche aus der Bierothek in Fürth. Kastanienrot, mit bräunlicher Schaumkrone. Riecht intensiv nach Haselnüssen. Im Geschmack Röstaromen, kombiniert mit Haselnüssen. Interessant

Hazelnuts in pie fantastic. Hazelnuts in port and wine quite ok. Hazelnuts in beer? Gewöhnungsbedürftig is the german expression, i believe: need to get used to it. I do not see the need. Ntl a full 3 points for trying.
Pours a rich brown from a bottle. Aroma is of a nice light chocolate hazelnut, flavor is more of a hazelnut with caramel. Nice, a little thin. Good beer.
From bottle at a friends house. Nutty brown aroma and pour. Gentle hazelnut flavor with some vanilla, brown sugar. Medium mouthfeel. No bitterness.
Numbers and comments, some miscellaneous notes: Nuts nuts nuts bit sweetness and some more nuts.
Sample at Omaha Beer Fest, Stinson Park. 6-11-16. Bottle. Pours dark brown, tan head. Aroma was nutty, hazelnuts, walnut. Taste was medium sweet, nutty, breads, malty. Nice.
Bottle at Eriksen Vinhandel. Brown with a beige head. Aroma medium malty (caramel, roasted), hazelnut. Flavor medium sweet caramel and hazelnut, light bitter, dry. Light to medium body.
Dark brown color, creamy little head. Sweet hazelnut aroma, little bit caramel also. Medium sweet taste, slightly bitter maybe. A lot of hazelnut taste! Overall very nice and smooth beer.
Bottle. Dark brown color with creamy tan head. Aroma - Nuts, vanilla, maple, caramel. Taste - Lightly bitter, medium sweetness, peach, honey, nuts, malt.
Pours a brown with dark tan head. Has a cream hazelnut taste with finishing of caramel and light bitterness. A smooth, thick palate. Very nice.
Clear red brown, beige head. Nutty aroma, light chocolate. Sweet milk chocolate and nuts flavour.

Aroma and taste is toasted and sweet malty, with some high nutty hazelnut prominence, some caramel and cocoa notes in support, very moreish brown.

duft: chokolade sødme vanilje
smag chokolade ristet eftersamg. chokolade karamel lidt nød
The hazelnut is very light. The mouth is more on woody flavour. Nice color of dark amber. Short last in mouth.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bière assez simple, pas dimmense surprise mais pas de fautes notes voire plutôt gourmande !
Nez : très caramel, beaucoup de noisette.
Bouche : relativement aqueuse, un peu plus amère que le nez, on retrouve légèrement le caramel derrière lorge assez malté, typique dune "ambrée". La noisette est très perceptible derrière tout cela, devient plus franche sur la finale et monopolise carrément la longueur (légèrement caramélisé), dailleurs toute relative.
Très sympathique, buvable, plutôt équilibrée et se tient bien, bref bien fait. Les amateurs de bière plus franches et corpulentes vont surement trouver cela décevant.
De geur is enorm sterk. Precies een pot nutella dat je opendoet, echt lekker. De kleur is lichtbruin. De smaak is lekker vol, bijna romig. Echt een aanrader
Bottle at lannexe cafe in Nantes. Brown color with a small white head. Medium body and medium carbonation. Sweet hazelnut taste. Quite nice once in a while.
Intense toffee nut, malt sweetness. Brown with light brown head. Nutty dry taste. Medium body, sticky texture & soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours dark amber with off white head. Aroma is sweet toffee nutty. Taste is sweet hazelnut honey like with a malty hazelnut finish. Its pretty good.
A beer of two halves. Pours ruby, thin head. Starts nutty and toasty and very drinkable then inexplicably fades really badly becoming thin and anonymous. Weird. Drink quickly I would recommend.

He de reconocer que no soy muy fan de las cervezas aromatizadas, pero me atreví con esta por las buenas críticas. Los de Rogue consiguen un resultado interesante con esta cerveza, y seguro que los bebedores aficionados a este tipo de cervezas quedaran satisfechos. Para mi gusto la cerveza en un primer momento sorprende y agrada al bebedor, consiguiendo un equilibro perfecto entre las noas ahumadas y las de la avellana, pero en un momento posterior, la cerveza llega a empalagar y a aburrir.
Dark brown in color with a hazelnut aroma, a rich nutty flavor and a smooth malty finish.
Light mouthfeel. Fake hazelnut flavor that overpowers everything. I took a few sips and couldnt finish it, which is rare for me.

Bought at a specialty beer store.

Pours dark with a tan head with no lacing and slowly dissipates.
Smells of chocolate, earthiness, hazelnut, dash of caramel and has some sweetness a bit like brown sugar.
Tastes absolutely AMAZING! Just as it smells with a bitter cookie finish.
Only strike is that it goes down a little watery, but its forgivable. I really honestly had to look hard for a flaw with this amazing beer.

Overall? Absolutely GREAT! This is just another example of brewers knowing what theyre doing to produce a fine product!

Smells of hazelnut choolate and sweet malts. Nice ripe brown color. Deep rich nutty taste of the hazelnut with chcocolate hint in the middle finishing off with a sweet malt taste. Full body with a lighter carbonation which suites this beer. Big hazelnut fan which this beer satisfies my palate for being a big coffee drinker it works. Nice brew!

Poured from growler filled at Rons bar and grill. Hazy brown color with small tan head and no lacing. Smells phenomenal with aromas of hazelnuts, roasted malt, caramel and subtle hits of chocolate. Taste follows the nose, but the mouth feel a bit watered down and thin in compared to the way it smells. Overall it is a very unique and tasty brown ale that smells like a much bigger beer

Magnifique robe brune caramel lipide avec des reflets rouges, fine mousse blanche qui ne tient pas. Nez noisette, biscuit et chocolat. Bouche sur la vanille et les noisettes, une pointe de caramel, les houblons ne sexpriment pas vraiment. Carbo limite, longueur moyenne, corps faible. Une belle bière aux saveurs de noisette, agréable mais manque un peu de corps et de complexité.
Cocoa and vanilla, not a sweet as I remembered. Then comes the toasty hazelnut. Not too complex, very drinkable and enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2016 the aroma of caramel, toffee, milk chocolate, hazelnut and vanilla... the taste is caramel and tart with notes of hazelnut paste, toffee, sweet chocolate, brown sugar, coffee and bisquit... sweet, tart and dry aftertaste...

Bottle. Dark brown body with a small head. Aroma has plenty of sweet toffee with a light hazelnut touch. Sweet malty and caramelly taste, the hazelnut part adds some, well... nuttiness. Quite balanced and easily drinkable, its sweet but within reasonable limits (at least on my scale but Im generally fond of sweet beers). Finish resembles dark cookies with hazelnuts. Kind of simple but tasty.
Tap. Brown, hazy, rocky head, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Bottle from Uba ja Humal in Tallinn ( 3.90). BB 06.2016. Pours brown with a rusty orange hue. The heads beige, fluffy, drops to leave isets and very little lace. The aroma is unsurprisingly hazelnutty, at points rather pleasant, then seeming artificially sweet... Earthy with a herbal moment... Not too keen on this. Tastes too damn sweet and nutty, somewhat caramelly, and again, finishing with that earthy-herbal bitterness. Thin, near flat carbonation. Thin body too. Hazelnut skin dry on the palate. Im glad I tried it even though Im no fan of such stuff.
On tap in Portland. Amber with a medium head. Aroma and taste of malt, nuts, light hops and some caramel.
From bottle. Pours rich brown with head thats gone in no time. Strong nutty aroma and flavor. Very sweet almost sickly. Unique but lacked balance for mine; too sweet
Mouth gazim for a brown lover. Its in a very small list with my favorite beers  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

12 ounce bottle into signature pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep ruby red/brown color with a 1-2 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of big caramel, hazelnut, brown sugar, brown bread, toffee, toasted biscuit, light chocolate, herbal, floral, and nutty/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balanced of dark/bready malt, hazelnut, and light earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big caramel, hazelnut, brown sugar, brown bread, toffee, toasted biscuit, light chocolate, herbal, floral, and nutty/toasted earthiness. Slight herbal hop and roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, hazelnut, brown sugar, brown bread, toffee, toasted biscuit, light chocolate, and nutty/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, hazelnut, and light earthy hop flavors; with a good bitter/sweet balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready, and lightly silky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent brown ale! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, hazelnut, and light earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Great beer! Hazelnut flavor actually comes through and adds good character to the beer. Nice dark reddish brown color and an aroma of nuts and malt.
Celebrating state and tribal wildlife grants with beer, with coworkers. Its good for a brown ale.

Some roast and light chocolate. Pours dark mahogany with decent head. Caramel and nut. Light bittersweet finish. Bottle pour at senate wildlife event in dc. Very nice for a brown. Drinking on the governments dime.
Dark brown pour, light tan head. Hazelnut almost overpowers this beer, but it is such a unique flavor that ill still give it a high mark. Mild spices in the finish.

Pours an amber colour, with a small white head that fades soon, leaving a ring and lace. Smell of chocolate, spices, cherries, nuts. Medium body and average carbonation. Taste of chocolate, cherries, hints of nuts.

Tap at Harrys Hofbrau in San Jose. Aroma is a rich hazelnut and sweet malt both showing strongly. Clear brown with tan head. Taste is delicate nuttiness that really marries well with the malt. Moderate residual sweetness and crystal malt flavors are very nice. This was very enjoyable.

Pours hazy, dark copper color. rather poor head. Really nice malty, caramel and hazelnut aroma. Very pleasant, not to sweet. Almost exactly the same in the taste but the particular notes are even more intense. Nice mouth feel, a bit over carbonated. Smooth and soft bitterness in the aftertaste. Quite good beer, but Im rather disappointed that it was brewed with hazelnut extract. It sounds just too easy...

33cl bottled
dark brown color
light aroma of caramel and hazelnut
taste caramel as well, a bit carbonated
nice mouth feel

Pours brownish amber with not very long-lasting tan head. Aroma is mostly nutty: hazelnut (of course), walnut, chocolate, prunes, figtree leaf, honey, brown sugar. Well balanced in the mouth: seems sweet due to its aroma, but its not. Medium bitterness.
Brown liquid with minimal head. Aroma of caramel, malts, nuts. Tastes same. Medium body.

Dark brown a bit reddish color with light brown medium head. Aroma has nuts, wood, caramel and vanilla. Taste is malty with long somewhat bitter aftertaste. Flavors of nuts, caramel, ripe fruits and malt. Nice mouth feeling and good nutty aftertaste.

Color marron, medio cuerpo. Cabeza blanca marronosa. Aroma a avellanas y tal vez un toque a chocolate. Sabor, avellanas y un amargor suave y constante. Mejor dejarla templar, coge mucho mas aroma y sabor casi a ferrero.

At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, hazy brown and red color, aroma of cake and nuts with just a spicey hint, flavor of cake and nuts with some milk chocolate, rounded and drinkable but one dimensional.

Marrom avermelhada escura e turva. Espuma bege de pouca formação e persistência. Aroma de nozes característico, castanhas, cacau, chocolate, seca. Paladar transparece mais dulçor, leve amargor torrado, inicia aguada mas finaliza mais seca. Corpo e carbonatação leves, um pou o abaixo do esperado. Aftertaste mantém as nozes e cacau com final seco, boa drinkability mas corpo muto leve para o meu paladar nesse estilo.

Kolor : Brązowy, głęboki, mętny.
Piana: Hiper-drobna, zwarta, w ciemno kremowym kolorze. Podnosi się do góry na zaledwie 2-3cm.
Umiarkowane krążkowanie.
Zapach: Wow! Tak intensywnej orzechowej woni nie czułem jeszcze w żadnym piwie jakie miałem okazje degustować.
Orzechy laskowe zdominowały w super przyjemny sposób aromat tego piwa.
Wyraźnie wyczuwalne akcenty nutelli, orzechów laskowych, czekolady z orzechami oraz miodowo-karmelowej słodyczy. 
Smak: Orzechowe w 100%! Czuje jakbym pił rozpuszczoną czekoladową Milkę lub Nutellę.
Po chwili dochodzą do głosu słodkie nuty : karmelu toffi i miodu.
Jest to tak fantastyczne uczucie, że ślina cieknie przed każdym następnym łykiem.
Goryczka niska, krótka z delikatnym orzechowym ściąganiem.
Smak jest słodko-gorzki.
Jest lekkie, delikatne i obłędnie pijalne.
Wysycenie: Niskie.
Podsumowanie:

Browar Rogue Ales z Newport w stanie Oregon specjalizuje się w warzeniu nowatorskich piw.
Piłem już kilka ich piw, wszystkie były wyborne, ale dopiero tym piwem skradli moje serce.
Śmiało mogę stwierdzić, że jest to jedno z najbardziej wyszukanych i nietuzinkowych piw jakie piłem.
Aromat i smak orzechów włoskich jest tak oczywisty i tak intensywny, że pijąc to piwo mam wrażenie jakbym pił roztopioną mleczną czekoladę z orzechami.
Pomimo sporej dawki orzechów, a także karmelu, toffi i czekolady piwo wcale nie jest mulące.
Jest kremowe, gładkie i super-pijalne.
Prawdziwie ekscytujące doznanie!

Bottle: Reddish-amber coloured, hazy, bigger -slowly collapsing - brownish head; distinctive - surprise, surprise - nutty traces in the moderate malty and fruity nose, some hop-illusions in the background; sweet-bitter flavour, a bit tart; shorter nutty and bitter finish. Surely good, but not my favourite

Bottle, 330ml. Pours dark copper-brown with almost no head. Scent of hops, malt, toasted notes, nuts. Carbonation is quite flat and body is medium-light with a watery mouth feel, slightly sticky. Tastes lightly bitter and acidic, too acidic to my taste. Quite dry with very light sweetness. Flavors are hoppy, dark malt, toasty with nutty backnotes. Ends very nutty with notable almond and hazelnut notes. The nutty flavor is interesting, but does not compensate for the mediocre flavor and taste. OKish.

Bottle 33cl.
Aroma: caramel, coffee, notes of roasted nuts.
Appearance: pours hazy amber/brown with a minimal white head
Taste: medium sweetness, hints of breat, nuts and slight fruit
Palate: soft carbonation, medium body, oily texture
Overall one of my favs!

Disappointing with such a high rating I expected better. Smells sweet, too thin and carbonated for a sweet beer IMO. But then you loose the sweetness on the palate and its replaced with an awkward imbalance until you get the honey/nectar after taste.

Bottle in Jerusalem, poured into wine glass at room temperature. Exp date: 9/2016. Pours ruby or cherry red with a finger of head thats slow to settle. Aroma is alcohol, hazelnut, sweet chocolate, cranberry, subtle vanilla, damp wood. Also getting the yeast. Taste is sweet upfront, resembles strawberry cake, pie crust. Cinnamon. Sweet potato. Mild hazelnut bitterness on the back. To be honest, not sure whats happening at the middle. Carbonation is gentle to average, body is medium, no lacing. This is okay -- not compelling enough to really leave a lasting impression, though.

Large bottle purchased at Total Wine and Spirits by commonshawn. Shared for NYE. Lighter brown like a cherry cola. Tannish color. Maple syrupy aroma with some nuttiness. Taste is relatively mild but leans towards the sweet side of things. Nutty aspects come through with some bready and caramel qualities. I want so much more from this one. Just a little too mild which is not what I expected from this brewery.

Big bottle with commonmac. Plum with small white head. Sweet maple syrup nose. Syrupy, sweet, very much syrup. Thin body. A bit much in the sugar syrup and honey. Not enough depth. I expected better. Nectar is right.

Bottle. Pours amber brown with a small beige head. Smell of nuts, caramel, biscuits and light roast. Moderate sweet, taste of nuts, milk chocolate, caramel, bread, light fruitiness, pleasant balancing bitterness with dry-ish finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and smooth texture. Good one.

Bottle 330ml. Slightly hazy amber with small beige head. The aroma has lots of nuts, notes of cookies and milk chocolate. Sweetish flavor with notes of nuts and nougat, followed by light citrus bitterness ,a bit piney. Medium-bodied. Nice.
Bottle. Pours brown with small tan head. Aroma is sweetish, bread, raisins, caramel, hazelnuts. Taste is sweetish, bread, chocolate, raisins, nuts, rye. Medium body. Good brown ale.
On tap. Dark brown with beige head. Aroma of malt, nuts. Strong sweet flavour, dry nutty finish

Aroma is pronounced nutty, hazelnut light sweetmalt. Appearance is medium brown clear with reddish tints, small off white head. Taste is nutty/hazelnut forward, pleasant sweetmalt lingers, light herbal bitterness in background balances and blends well. Palate is medium light and crisp. Overall a very pleasant beer that does bring out nuttiness in a beer very well without tasting artificial. A fun beer worth a try.
Um aroma expetacular que combina café e chocolate. Aparência avermelhada escura e com espuma bege não duradoura. Sabor marcante com o paladar com notas de café e chocolate.

Bottle at home, dark brown with beige head. Smells awkward. Weirdest aroma, very mouldy, sickly, boiled sweet sterilised milk, lactoderm, sour wood, cream, hazelnuts are only in the background. Taste is moderate bitter, sickly and light sour. I cant match the ratings I read with what Im tasting. Its disgusting. Like drinking cold puke. Tastebuds say no. Bad nutwater. Little to no carbonation. Weird creepy taste. Goosebumps. Bottle says best by 05/2016.

Clear brown color with medium tan head. Rich hazelnut aroma, sweet, malty, biscuity and sugary. Light body. Taste follows the nose, lts of nuts and hazelnuts, malts, sugar, some caramel and bready notes. Smooth finish.
Fantastic beer,great sipping ale on a cold winter night!!! Snuggle up with the wife/girlfriend/or both at the same time, and have a good night!!
On tap at Rogue bar n grill. Looks great, dark brown but not thick. Weird sweetness lingers in mouth. Finishes a bit bitter.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2016 Appearance: pours with a medium light tan head, the beer is a very nice brown color with some maroon hues, Aroma: toasty grain, mash, toast, smells good Taste: very nice malt backbone, some maple, moderate sweetness, no bitterness to speak of, nutty, gingerbread  Palate: average carbonation, medium mouthfeel, minimal nutty aftertaste Overall: this is very good, the hazelnut and toasty grain go really well with the sweet notes, no bitterness really ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz poured on wine glass with dinner of vegetables on sour broth
Appearance: Deep light brrown to amber, clear , minimal head
Smell: Fresh cooked grains, hint of hazelnut
Taste: light and refreshing
Feel: Creamy mouth feel
Overall: Great beer with great aroma, balance taste

Draft - Not much of a smell at all. Only slight hint of nut, smells like Christmas. The color is weird, just this very clear brown color to it. Was expecting something a little more cloudy. Malt forward taste. Subtle hints of nut, hazelnut, malt. Not a bad beer.

This wouldnt ordinarily be my style of beer, but Rogue gets the hazelnut parts of it right. It smells and tastes faintly sweet, but not in an overpowering manner, and it finishes smooth. Its a beautiful chocolate brown color as well.

Ambra con riflessi rame, buona schiuma beige molto compatta. Buon aroma di malto, nocciola. Sorprende la bevuta con dolcezza e buon sapore di cioccolato e nocciola. Molto beverina. Ben riuscita questa Brown ale.

So the best place to find beers from Oregon is in Yellowknife, right? Right? Well, Im not one to negotiate on the finer details but heres a bottle I done found ways up here. This one has a modest head and okay brown-copper body with a decent amount of carbonation. The aroma is lots of toasted bread and little else. The flavour is a lot of caramel and chocolate with a medium finish. Kind of infused. Not bad, but watery on the end and certainly artificial tasting. Ill drink it like theres no tomorrow but that does not detract from the fact that its a chocolately soda kind of thing.

Bottle, at home in the dining room... oh what a dining room.
Pours a hazy brown color with a big head that settles out into a medium head and leaves some spotty lacing on the glass.

The aroma is really sweet and really nutty... chocolate, honey, HAZELNUT... maybe some forrest floor if you really get your nose in there. Mostly its like sweet hazelnut, which is not something I dislike.

The flavor is much like the aroma, maybe a touch earthy and roasty, but mostly sweet and nutty. Its got chocolate and a whole bunch of hazelnut. The bitterness is very mild but does have some lingering pleasantness. As it warms it becomes more toasty which is chill.

There are a bunch of reasons why this is a whole bunch of folks gateway into beer application. Its a classic for a reason, hell I remember years where this used to be the #1 brown ale on ratebeer.com, but at this stage in the game I think Ive had enough nutty browns that dont come off so literal and cloying as this one. Its fine.

Hazelnut aroma with chocolate and bread
Pours an amber brown with small with lasting creamy head
Hazelnut flavor with chocolate bread
Medium body, medium co2, sweet bready finish with bitterness
Enjoyable beer. I could drink a few of these.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle. Pours brown with small off-white head. Aroma of hazelnut, malt and caramel. Medium to light body with light carbonation, light sweet and bitter taste.
Bomber. Poured reddish brown, tan head mild lacing. Aroma of hazelnut and malts. Taste is also lots of hazelnut but seemed a bit on the watery side. Overall not bad, easy to drink.

1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Body is clear brown, head is small, cream, brownish, average lasting, fair lacing. Nose is tomato soup, flavor is milk chocolate, honey, vanilla, dried fruits, tomato soup, light herbs. Medium sweet, medium roasty bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty bittersweet. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessert beer, cant feel any hazelnut but very unique and interesting, good one.
Pours a clear copper brown with minimal lace and solid carbonation. Aroma is sweet, nutty, and vibrant in hazelnut. Tastes nutty and sweet, borderline dessert-like.

Pours a deep brown on tap with thin ring of khaki head that leaves light lace. Aroma of sweet nuttiness and caramel malts. Taste is like drinking hazelnut coffee, but not over the top. Definitely a dessert beer, nice balance though.

Good nutty flavor but with a slight sour and bitter after taste. Slightly watery too.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Clear copper color, medium off white head. Medium hazelnut aroma. Light body with a light malt hazelnut flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark brown with small head. Aroma: clear hazelnut flavor, malt, citrus hopps in the background. Taste: malty sweetness, some caramel, nutts, nice hoppy finish.
From bottle. Pours dark brown with a white head. Aroma of grains, nuts, light roast, meady. Taste is cake! Nutty, light roast, super clean, meady, medium thin body. I was pleasently surprised.
Bottle. Has a very nutty aroma. Pours a hazy red with off white head. Has a very light bitter taste. Medium bodied with oily texture and a very nutty finish. Interesting.
Bottle. Pours brown with a white head. Aroma of grain, honey, nuts, almonds, light roast. Taste is sweet, very nutty, honey sweet, no grains in taste, very clean. Nice one

Bottle. Lets put it this way - imagine hazelnut cream in a wafer, garnished with subtle red fruit. Slightly tanninic finish, fitting the nutty main part. Very aromatic but also light and crisp. Excellent.

Appearance- dark brown, ruby tinge, a solid beige foamy head which slowly dissipates. Aroma- very nutty, pecan, hazelnut, caramel hints, malty brown bread. Taste- malty, bready and a bit yeasty, hazelnuts, cocoa, some bite from the hops, smooth and reasonably full mouthfeel. Nutty malty finish. Hints of honey and caramel sweetness. Good stuff.

Pours a ruby amber color, with a thin off white head, and nice lacing. Aroma is hazelnuts, licorice, soy sauce. Very heavy hazelnut liquor taste. Really over done with the nut taste. Slightly acidic in character, with medium sweetness. Light body, thin feel. Not my thing.

Überraschend gutes Brown Ale. Schmeckt schön malzig, leicht hopfig.
Im Glas ein dunkles Braun, off White Krone. Riecht ganz leicht nach Nutella.
Im Abgang samtig, herb und tatsächlich viel Haselnuss. Überraschend und überraschend gut. 
Sollte man mal probiert haben.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Slightly hazy, brown color, very small head. The aroma is astonishing, sweet roasted hazelnut with chocolate and toasty malt components. Not too sweet taste, decent bitter. Thin texture, low carbonation, but fits. The hazelnut is neither sweet nor sticky, leaves a nice dry finish, with a bit hazelnut, caramel and coffee. 

Great beer!!!

12 oz bottle. Chestnut color with a dense, lasting khaki head. Aroma of vanilla, wood, spices, dried dark cherries, fig. Plum, dark breads, spices, raisins, light chocolate, coffee. Nutty but not getting much hazelnut. Palate is fairly light and clean. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, hazelnut, chocolate and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque red/dark brown beer with no/a slight beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, hazelnut and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Great flavour thanks to mixing hazelnuts with a Brown Ale. Feels like the base beer could have been more intense, but it is still fine for its abv. The aroma could have been stronger and the palate better though.

Couleur brune sombre, très légère mousse. Fort nez de noisettes grillées. Gout noisettes grillée, creme de noisettes ( genre pour gateau et buche de noel), avec notes douces legeres café/chocolat en fin de bouche. Bon corps oncteux. Fin douce et café cremeux.

On tap at Gollem Amstelstraat. Clear, dark red with a thin, creamy, tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, chestnuts, nuts and caramel. Sweetish, fruity-malty taste of raisins, nuts, chestnuts, caramel and almond. Sweetish-malty taste of raisins, nuts and caramel, followed by a short, slightly bitter and sweetish finish. Nice!

Bottle in LA. Pours clear brown with off-white head. Hazelnut essence aroma. Flavour is mostly the hazelnut, base beer has mild malt and hops that lets the hazelnut be forward. Pleasant beer, happy to try it.

8/9/2011 1:52:32 AM On tap at Beer Temple. Dark brown body with thin head. Taste of hazelnut is pretty overpowering. Thin and smooth texture. Creamy lots of chocolate in there and hazenuts. Some bitterness in the finish.
Rich reddish brown tea color with creamy chocolate head. Taste, intense hazelnut like Ive never had before in a beer. Reminded me of a Nutella wafer, sweet but not in the same manner.

Brown beer, tan head. Nose is malt, metallic notes, some nuts, mild alcohol. Flavor is malts, bread, sugray notes, slight metallic hints, mild nuttiness. Bready-nutty finish and aftertaste. A brown ale with mild nuttiness... yeah.

Agradável surpresa. Marrom turva com média formação de espuma de pouca duração. Aroma com notas de cereais, farinha lactea, brownie, malte torrado e um leve suspiro de lúpulo. O sabor confirma o aroma com a presença de café. Corpo e final médios com nuances adocicados e presença de café no retrogosto

Light light tan head, with a clear light brown body. Aroma is sweet and nutty. Taste is sweet and nutty with hints of candy sugar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very enjoyable brown ale, lovely aroma from the hazelnuts. Doesnt even seem 6% really :) Pours a cloudy deep brown colour.  Seems fairly light in body.
Clear red/brown with a medium, quickly-diminishing, beige head. Aroma of nuts, chocolate, caramel malt. Taste is low sweet with a bitter finish. Good.
Very tasty brew. Smooth nutty flavor. Malty, caramel. Has this many times, but just realized I never rated it. A touch flat.

Bottle (from Koht). Pours brown with beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is hazelnut, malt, sweetness. Flavor is sweet, hazelnut, malt, caramel. Finish is hazelnut and dry bitterness. Overall: not a fan of brown ales, but this is delicious stuff.

Bottle from hop hideout, sheffield. Copper with very little head. Aroma is toffee and honey, chocolate and nuts. Taste is sweet and sticky, a touch bitter too. Nice light body with medium carbonation compliments the big sticky flavours. Very nice.
Очень интерес& яркий аромат орехов, во вкусе также присутс& жареные орехи. В целом вкус очень сбаланс& В послевк& лёгкая сладост&

The color is beautiful dark brown with a foam that unfortunately does not last as long as I could wish. It smells not of much, but you sense a little malt sweetness and hop and can also easily sense a refreshing scent of hazelnuts. Taste dominated first place the hazelnuts on a soft and comfortable way. After this, the taste of the comfortable hop bitterness which also has a comfortable sweetness included. It all replaced by a long and pleasant aftertaste of hazelnuts, but you get pretty fast like a new sip to again experience the explosion of taste happens in the mouth! I think it will go really well with lightly spiced dishes, such as chicken and pork.

355 ml bottle from Jumbo, gift from Daniel Sovino, thanks mate!. Pours a slightly hazy brown color with a medium off-white head that diminishes into a thin film which lingers. Not overly intense aroma but it shows a dense nutty character. The most obvious notes of hazelnut are complimented by caramel coated peanuts, chestnuts, walnuts, coconut bark, brown sugars. Taste is very nutty as well with bready touches. A hint of caramel adds some sweetness but its harmless compared to the walnut slightly bitter character. Moderate intensity. Like a high-end, high-fermentation version of a South American "malta". Medium body, slick, medium to low carbonation. Highly drinkable, standard Brown Ale.
最初にほどよ
aromas de avelã e tostado. sabor marcante de avelã, caramelo e chocolate em consonancia com o aroma. excelente cerveja.
Pura avellana color rojizo, espuma algo consistente, dulce y espesa, empalagosa pero agradable.

Marrom, turva. Espuma média de média duração. Forte aroma de avelã, com notas de caramelo e chocolate. Sabor de avelã, café, chocolate, tostado e um leve toque de alcaçuz. Retrogosto adocicado, levemente ácido ao final.
12 oz bottle pours clear brown with very little head. Aroma is all hazelnut. Taste is nuts, toast and hints of coffee. Smooth finish. Great nut brown ale!

Bue en bouteille de 33cl.
Couleur ambrée foncée.
Nez noisette à fond effectivement.
Palais décevant, peu de CO2, peu de corps.
Très bof.

Bottle.

A- Nuts, hazelnut, slightly sour.

A- Dark brown color, hazy liquid, light brown head.

T- Nutty, hazelnut, pecan, subtle dark fruits, watery.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, slightly sweet finish.

O- This one dumbfounded me. I poured it into my glass and the head just kept growing and growing like there was miracle grow in this damn beer. I had to spoon it out because it wouldnt stop building. The hazelnut was certainly there and a lot of it but there was also a weird chemical like aroma and taste that really turned me off. Not even close to what I wanted from this.

Clear brown pour with almost no head. For an extract-added concoction, the aroma is a little weird - hazelnut, yes, but also a strange chemically smell. Flavor is much better - lots of nut and some sweet malt. Pretty tasty stuff. Fairly smooth, and nice aftertaste.

Piwo silnie pachnace orzechami laskowymi. W smaku orzechy, figi oraz nieco czekolady mlecznej. Slodkawe lekko czekoladowe oraz ze spora dawka smaku orzacha laskowego. Pianka minimalna. Barwa czerwona ciemna lekko mglista. Do deseru pasuje
Cor marrom, brilhante. Espuma boa e cremosa. Aroma de avelã, caramelo e toffee. No paladar chocolate, avelã e café amargo. Retrogosto adocicado. Espetacular!!!

Bottle. Brown with a pale beige head that lasts well. Aroma of toffee and hazelnuts, some vanilla. Taste is much the same, only less so. Sweet and rather bland, low bitterness. A little spicy at the end. OK. [edit] The last quarter of the bottle is increasingly disagreeable. Sure smells like freshly roasted hazelnuts though.

nuts, coffee, roasty, chocolate, grass, licorice, soy sauce, very acidic in character. 
Ruby colour, medium very creamy beige head, lacing.
medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, salty, hm, feels thin to me.
light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, abrupt and slightly sweet finish.
Nah, not my cup of tea.
Clear medium brown pour, quick tan head. Nose is hazelnut. Bittersweet. Middle is hazelnut redux, caramel, medium roasted malt. Finish is biscuit malt and slightly dry. Nice beer.
Very nice Brown Ale with precisely what it says; a hazelnut aroma. Very nice and slightly hoppy.
Pours dark red/brown with short lived beige head. Really nice aroma of whole grain bread and nuts. Taste is bready, a bit sweet and light bitter. Easy drinking, smooth palate. Very well made beer.
Good colour. Not a very pronouced smell. Taste is great, not too heavy, its refreshing and nutty.
Bottle into a glass. Pours a light brown with a nice tan head. Hazelnut and caramel malt on the nose. An excellent beer. Roasted hazelnut does not take away from the damn fine brown its built on.

(Rogue HazelNut Brown Nectar) Bottle 3355 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 6.2%
Brown coloured body with a small tan head on top, with low retention.
Aroma of nuts, hazelnut, pistachio, light caramel. Seems strange at first but it turns to be very appealing.
Taste also of hazelnuts, pistachio, chocolate, same again - weird at first but easy to drink.
Medium thin body, carbonation on the low side.
Not bad at all.

First off I need to say the color of this beer is absolutely gorgeous. Ive had some truly remarkable looking beers and this is now one of them. Aroma is nice and sweet. You really get the hazelnut, like it just pops out at you. Very authentic as well not some weird adjunct smell. Taste is so smooth and delicious. Like this is the definition of a delicious beer. Its nutty, and sweet with a unmistakeable hazelnut taste. Absolutely delicious. Im kind of fan boying the shit out of this right now. I actually dont drink a lot of Rogue beers, I think theyre a bit over priced but this is absolutely worth the price. I could crush a ton of these its that good.

330ml bottle @Beerfox, Riga. Clear copper color. Small size, bubbly white head, stays. Very malty, sweet, hazelnuts, cookies, biscuits in aroma. Biscuits, cookies, sweet, hazelnuts, roast in taste. Sweet hazelnut brownies in aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Exciting and fantastic at first, but end is kind of too sweet and becomes a struggle.
Первый для меня орех, очень мягкий, при этом с большой карбони& недоста& горечи и крепост&

Excellent aroma and flavor. The scent is clearly reminiscent of hazelnut and ginger. The mouthfeel is smooth and satisfying. Low IBUs (28-33) are welcome and help make this one very enjoyable brown ale for this drinker. My new favorite brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 fl oz bottle. Very pleasing hazelnut aroma. Nutty brown aroma with nice head. Good aftertaste.
Drank from bottle. A nutty taste but nothing special. Perhaps better consumed from glass.

Brown as can be expected. Fuller palate than anticipated. Aroma was faint with hints of nut. The hazelnut was more pronounced through the flavor with a pretty malt base. Decent and got better as it warmed.

Pours a dark brown with a small head. Smells malty and nutty. Taste is sweet, and not necessarily bitter, but a nutty taste is definitely there. The first rogue beer ive drank and I could not be happier!.

Pours clear, dark brown. Small white head. Smell is bit sweet, some chocolate undertone as well as malts. Taste is surprisingly bitter. Hazelnut-cacao strikes in the next move, and against all expectations, this beer can still be called balanced. The hazelnut-flavor strongly builds up the more you drink though, yet with a name like this, what else did you expect? I happen to like the taste so yeah, for me this is quite a good beer ! Average body for the ABV, yet very intense taste. Carbo level is where it should be . 
On the other hand, I would love a version with less bitterness, perhaps, and a thicker MF. Perhaps also more intense chocolate aroma that is now rather hidden, if not imagined by myself.

6% ABV. Brown ale.

Tapped out a rich dark amber brown, something around 25°SRM. Thin head of light brown small compact bubbles. Visually, a very inviting start.

The nose had a pleasantly light sweet rice aroma. In Singapore, a local desert of steamed fluffy rice cakes, ma ko kueh has the same beautiful aroma. There are predictably nutty aromas suggesting hazelnuts (duh!), brazil nuts and acorns. There are hints of darks sweet cherries. 

Mouthfeel was light and clean with just enough carbonation to allow the fairly abundant palate to be highlighted and appreciated. 

Goes on favorites list.

355ml bottle from Whole Food Market, Giffnock:
A real surprise to me, unusual but highly drinkable with a solid hazelnut & plenty of sweetness. The balance was good & the beer smooth,a really impressive offering from a beer I wasnt particularly looking forward to either.

Tasted from the tap on the 12/06/2015. Nut brown colour with a good retention and lazing head. The beer is dominated for the Hazelnuts, milk and cocoa. Very good and refreshing. I really like it. Next one please!

12 oz single bottle from Mollys Spirits. Deep brown appearance with a tan head that eventually dissipates. Aroma of dark malts, bitter chocolate, hazelnut, toffee, caramel and light hop spice. Similar flavor, rich and mildly sweet with a light earthy bitterness. Medium body. A nice brown ale overall.

Bottle. Sensoric. Bottle. Deep brown with medium, semi-densed, beige Head. Really nice hazelnut aroma along with some caramel and toffee. Also light roasted malts aroma. In general semi-sweet with some dry-accents in the finish. The taste is not so complex and nice as aroma. In general brown ale is not exciting beer style, but this one is worth trying. The only cons is artificial hazelnut aroma I think
330ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours brown with a small head. Aroma of hazelnuts and chocolate. Taste is hazelnut, chocolate, vanilla.

Bottle 0.651L.
Brown body with reddish nuances; average, frothy, tan head, mostly diminishing with fair lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel) and light-to-moderate hoppy aroma with notes of nuts, raisins and light ref fruits (cherries).
Heavy sweet and light-to-moderate bitter flavour; liquor feeling in the finish.
Medium-to-full body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
Cloudy brownish tan body, light tan head. Molasses, light vanilla. Slightly earthy. Sweet. Quite oily, long balanced finish, medium body. Really tasty.

Bottle: Nut brown color, off-white head. Aroma is malty, sweet, nutty, cocoa-nut wafers. Flavors is also malty, nutty, cocoa, milk and dark chocolate, roasted malt, raosted malt and dark chocolate bitterness.
So much hazelnut aroma and roasted homeless guys boots. Very nice, taste is the same. Bit like ice cream
Dark, slightly reddish brown. Solid, white head. Sweet, sugary scent. Strong hazelnut flavor. Sweet. Good in small amounts.

Caoba rojizo limpio y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de chocolate, frutos secos y galleta. Cuerpo medio y meloso, inicio dulce de galleta que pasa a un sabor de fruto seco y final de amargor seco moderado.

Bomber. Sweet caramel malt aroma with caramel nuttiness. Pours cloudy caramel colored with a thin tan head with poor retention and good lacing. Starts with sweet caramel malt flavors to go with a medium body and slick mouthfeel. Finishes smooth with rich hazelnut flavor melding with the caramel. Nice brown ale.

Aroma of fresh bread, nuts (hazelnut), and maplesyrup. Dark brown, almost black colour with a almost white head. Wow what a special taste. Hazulnuts are fully present! Really round flavour, its like nutella :) also present are popcorn, bread, maple, white chocolate. Aftertaste like biscuits, a bit dry and again nutty. Really interesting!
a very interesting brown ale. I was not overwhelmed by hazlenuts, but did enjoy the beer.
Bottle at home, dark brown beer with a small head, aroma is hazelnuts. Taste is the same, some malt, some sweetness, interesting
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 Draught. Brown. Sparse head. Hazelnut and caramel aroma. Creamy in the tongue, mostly sweet, bitter finish. Ice-cream character. Oily.

Dark ember colored beer with a clear white head. Great taste and smell of roasted hazelnuts combined with a good and well balanced brown ale flavours. All in all a solid and good beer with hazelnut aromas.

Dark brown, almost clear with a slight haze. Short lived head that persists around edge of the glass. 
Carmel, sweet, hazelnut, toffee, candy bar. 
Over carbonated. Finish has a familiar taste that I just cant name right now. 
12oz bottle gifted from friends for my birthday.

Medium beige head. Clear brown body. Caramelly popcorn aroma with thick rough nutty notes. Dryish roasty nutty popcorn taste. Mid-to-thin body. Mild, soft, slick mouthfeel. Dryish earthy popcorn and perfumy butterscotch aftertaste. Lingering buttery hazelnut and vanilla finish. Awful. Artificial. Drainpour. (0.355l bottle, from Vinbudin Kringlan, Reykjavik. Label said 6.2%.)

On tap @Brewdog Birmingham. Beautiful dark brown colour with beige head. Aromas of malts, caramel and nuts. Tastes very nutty, lots of hazelnuts, caramel, malts, honey, hoppy notes. Well balanced. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. A beer masterpiece!
Pours copper with a thin white head. Aroma of toffee and hazelnut. Taste is of hazelnut also. Very nice.

On tap at Llywelyns. It poured a brown color with an off-white head. The aroma was very malty with some nuts. The taste was very nutty with malts, caramel, earthy hops and woody notes. It had a medium body with medium carbonation. Tasty.

Aromat: przede wszystkim wyraźne utlenienie, kwaskowość i melanoidyny, z pod których jedynie w niewielkim stopniu przebija się orzech.

Barwa: czerwona / miedziana, zgaszona. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niewielka i szybko opadająca.

Smak: nuta kwaskowa, pochodząca z ciemnych słodów, z orzechowym posmakiem. Słodycz niewielka, trochę miodowa. Goryczka symboliczna. Średnia pełnia, umiarkowane do wysokiego wysycenie, nieco szczypiące w język. Wytrawny i alkoholowy finisz.

Trafił mi się niestety egzemplarz z datą do 04/2015 i to było czuć :(

Notes of caramel and nuts, creamy, with a great finish of roasted hazelnuts. Poors dark brown with a small head. Tastes slightly sweet and well-balanced. The hazelnuts are not too dominant. Creamy and smooth mouthfeel.
Top five beers. Amazing smell and great dark look with tremendous taste. This is one of the best beers of all time.
Pours a nice mahogany color. Nutty aroma. Big hazelnut flavor with a malty finish. One of my favorite beers.
12 oz / 355 ml bottle. Served at Metro in Lahti. Strong hazelnut flavor. Nice dark beer. Rouge makes good beer. I would drink again but probably not going to be the first choice.
W zapachu i smaku coś specyficznego, przypominającego ciasto drożdżowe z truskawkami, ciekawe : )
I enjoyed this beer a lot. Has a medium-dark brown color. Tastes of caramel, honey, bits of malt. One of the better brown ales out there. Little bit of a kick too. As the label says...its "nectar".

On tap, u netopyra, with mom. Pours amber body with high light tan head. Aroma has a lot of caramel, malty, light honey. Taste has caramel sweetness upfront, long lasting malty sweetness, noble bitterness in the background. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Bottl from Rehills, Nwcastle. A hazy red-brown coloured beer that has a thin white head. It has a very rich hazelnut and nutty flavour with chocolate notes and a malty, nutty roasted finish. Unusual and excellent!

12 oz bottle. BBE 04/2015. At the Majatalo, Tampere, Finland. 
Hazy brown colour with a tiny tan head. Hazelnut, chocolate, sweetness and some maltiness in the aroma. Not bad. The flavour is hazelnut, chocolate, malt, sugary sweetness and mild bitterness. Watery. Thin for a 6.2% brew.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Moriartys. Very dark slightly hazy copper that starts with a light tan foam that mostly disappears. Strong solid flavors of hazelnuts and semi-sweet chocolate. Ergo Nutella. Nice dark malts. Hint of burnt peanut shells. Impressed with how clean the flavors are. No bad notes. Admittedly not overly complex but bests most other chocolate hazelnut beers I have had. Nearly a Porter, billed as a Brown Ale is being pleasantly modest. Would love to see Rogue try an Oatmeal Stout with these same flavors.

Botella 33 cl. Cokor marron oscuro con espuma beige, media formacion y persistencia. El aroma demasiado dominado por la avellana, recuerda a frangelico o licor similar de fondo buena carga de maltas, cuando oxigena recuerda a madera tb, bizcocho. En boca aceitosa cremosa, donde esta muy presente la avellana, pero tiene mas gracia hay buen equilibrio con las maltas y lúpulos. Final mas maltoso no demasiado largo. Sin ser de mi devoción las Birras con extractos, creo q esta bastante rica y muy bien hecha.

Piana beżowa, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, nietrwała, pozostaje w postaci kożuszka. Barwa brązowa, herbaciana, mętna. W aromacie faktycznie na pierwszym planie orzechy laskowe, gdzieś dalej toffi, mleczna czekolada i kawa cappuccino. W smaku intensywny orzech laskowy przykrywa całą resztę. Piwo nie jest słodkie, jest za to lekka kwaskowatość od ciemnych słodów, karmel, krówka i minimalna korzenna goryczka. Wysycenie średnie. W afterteasie placek orzechowy ze sztucznym olejkiem. 
Generalnie dość duże rozczarowanie - piwo jest wodniste, nienaturalnie orzechowe, ani wytrawne, ani deserowe. Pijalność raczej niska z uwagi na powyższe...
12 fl oz Flasche. Dunkelbraun und klar. Minimale Schaumkrone. Starkes Nussaroma. Milder Abgang.
Bottle. Lively aroma of of hazelnuts. Very drinkable beer. Soft, lightweight, good Brown.

On tap at Matchbox, Washington DC. Cloudy dark brown color with a small, light beige head that leaves a little lacing. Mild carbonation and thin to medium body. Strong hazelnut aroma. Flavor is hazelnut, milk chocolate, caramel and sweet malts. Bittersweet malty aftertaste. Couldve done with slightly less hazelnut extract.

Pours dark brown, hazy with a super thin head. Aroma has already some hazelnut, feels like Christmas, super nutty. Taste is also full of hazelnut, loads of vanilla. Doesnt really feel like a beer but more like a spiced and chilled Christmas drink. Aftertaste is drier, lasts long. Hmm, I am actually not sure if I like this that much, bit too Christmasy for me, wasnt really expecting this. Hazelnut does not feel very natural as well, more like the flavour I get when I put a few drops of hazelnut extract into my coffee.

355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy dark brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of nuts. Taste reminds me of a vanilla ice cream wafer. Sweet finish. Very pleasant although maybe a little thin.
