Bottle from Free Press, Cambridge..pours an uninviting cloudy milky light brown. Bouquet of burnt coffee, Lotus biscuit spread, hazelnut, cedar. Sweet milk chocolate taste. Thinnish palette. Not perfect but mighty tasty and a joy to drink.

Draught @ NYC Craft Beer Festival. Dark amber color with small foamy whitish head, no clear aroma, medium carbonation, hazelnut taste, long finish with enduring hazelnut aftertaste. Interesting effect of hazelnut.
Bottle from tommyknocker bar in Helsinki. Beautiful brown porter with lots of hazelnut and very little roastiness. Easy drinking beer and a wonderful combination. Superb!
Brown with a medium persistent beige head. Aroma is chocolate, hazelnut, bread. Same in taste. Bittersweet aftertaste. Simple but delicious beer!
Disig dyp oransje kropp med et medium lysebrunt skumdekke. Krokan og lønnesirup dominerer av lukt. Nøtteaktig karamell og knekk i munnen. Medium kropp. Lettdrikkelig.
Awesome pint pour of hazelnut brown, rich amber notes. Aroma is lightly hopped with plenty of caramel and hazelnut notes. Plenty of nutty notes. Smooth malt and super enjoyable.

15.5.2014. Brown-amber colour, thick dense brown head. Aroma of strong hazelnut, cant get much more, maybe toffee. Palate is smooth and creamy, also lots of hazelnut, malts, some chocolate and coffee, syrupy sweetness. Surprisingly good for flavoured beer.
On tap at Rogue, San Francisco. Pours hazelnut color. Small head. Aroma is sweet malty biscuit and lots of hazelnut. Flavor is hazelnut, and really sweet malt. Really nice.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2016 330ml bottle in Reykjavík. Aroma is nutty, chocolate, light coffee. Appearance is black with a brown-ish head. Taste is sweet and sour. Soft carbonation, dry. Very nice one.
Piana drobna szybko redukuje się do krazka. Aromat intensywnie orzechowy, kakao, nuty palone. Smak wytrawny delikatny karmel i posmak orzechow, przyjemny posmak w ustach.

Dark brown colour. Aroma of caramel and toasted hazelnuts. Flavour is rather sweet but has genuine hazelnut taste. Tastes a bit like a certain posh chocolate. Ooh, ambassador with these Rocher you are really spoiling us.
Color dark brown with medium head. Aroma malt, caramel, alcohol. Taste malt, caramel, nuts, dry.
Draught at BeerTemple. Dark brown with a small beige head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with some bitter tones. Malts, caramel, hazelnut, honey and herbs. Quite a tasty brew.
BJs beer dinner pairing #7. Part of the dessert course. Moderate body. Good hazelnut flavor.

Bottle from Soho Wine at home. Translucent dark brown pour - a bit light. Thin brown-tan head. Aroma is very English and malty, with a nutty sweetness. Taste is similar - a bit empty though. Some mild bitterness, nuttiness and nutty sweetness. Very very malty. Palate is slightly bubbly but the nuttiness makes it seem richer. Empty taste sort of ruins it for me but not bad.
Pours brown with light tan head. Aroma is hazelnut, toast, syrup and vanilla. Flavour is hazelnut, chocolate and light sweet. A fine, well crafted, well balanced beer.
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 Notig, hazelnoot, honing, wat fruit, licht zoet, medium body en smooth finish. lekker.

330ml bottle from Mitsuyas Liquors in Asagaya, Tokyo. Poured into a a stemmed tulip. Deep brown color with a nice beige head. Nice malty and hazelnut aroma with chocolate undertones. Creamy mouthfeel. Nutty flavors with sweet malt, chocolate, caramel and nice finish with a hint of piney hops. Excellent brown!

A: Somewhat clear mahogany color with 1/4" quickly dissipating head.
S: Chocolate malt and thats about it. Maybe a bark-like essence. Cinnamon? A slight hint of coffee creamer (hazelnut).
T: Again chocolatey without any sweetness. A hoppy bite with a hint of roast/toast dark bread.
M: Medium body with more carbonation than expected but not enough to distract. I dont get much of the the nuttiness I remember.
O: I thought this was the best stuff in the world back in the 1990s. OK but doesnt hold up to my memories. Oh well. Rogue seems to have a bit of a reputation problem now and I definitely dont like their refusal to date their products. I guess I can let this go. Too expensive to be this mediocre.

Barwa: ciemnobursztynowa, zmętniona.
Piana: jasnobeżowa, obfita, brobnopęcherzykowa, szybko redukuje się do cienkiej warstwy. 
Zapach: bardzo intensywny, na pierwszym planie orzechy, na drugim planie aromaty ciemnych słodów, nuty opiekane, karmel, dużo słodyczy. 
Smak: dość wytrawne, dużo nut ciemnych słodów, karmel, toffi, opiekane ciasto, wyczuwalne również lekkie nuty ciemnych owoców i orzechy, na finiszu bardzo przyjemna goryczka o lekko palonym charakterze. 
Wysycenie: dość wysokie, mogło by być niższe.

Incredibly heavy and good smell of nuts. The taste is of nuts and hints of chocolate too. Slightly bitter which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. Seems that the beer loses flavor very quickly and almost becomes watery. Okay rating yet. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours a hazy brown with a thin tan head. Aroma is awesome, full of hazelnuts. Body is medium
And carbonation low. Taste is hazelnuts with a tiny hint of chocolate.
0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear chestnut with a low off-white head. Aroma is malts with plenty of hazelnut. Flavor is full malts, hazelnut and some hops. Great if you like nuts.
Aroma is colossal hazelnut at Nutella level. Taste is more mild but the texture is hugely creamy. This ain't an every day beer, but delicious nonetheless.

Standard American brown ale with light beige, moussy, lacing head and clear, warm, beautiful, deep copper colour. Aroma abounds with toasted malts; impressions of roasted pine nuts and chestnuts dominate, bark, autumn leaves, nutmeg, bitter honey, peanuts, burning wood, caramel, the kind of cocoa powder I used to make chocolate milk with as a child, biscuit, moccha, cardboard. Restrainedly sweetish onset, toasty, smooth and slick with rather thin body and lowish carbonation, nutty and slightly caramelly maltiness, somewhat resinous, peanut- and toasted bread-like till the very end, with some leafy hops adding a mild bitterness. Brown ales will never be my favorite style, but this is an enjoyable, straightforward example, with a pleasant sweet roasted nuttiness as its main theme, lasting for quite a long time after swallowing. Glad I tried this.
Bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a thin tan head. Mild aroma and taste of nuts and malt. A bit thin-bodied and bland for my taste.
It pours a dark amber with a decent beige head..The aroma is nutty with roasted malt... taste is hazelnuts with a hint of chocolate, with a dry finish..

Dark reddish-brown color with big head. Hazelnut aroma, lots of hazelnut, caramel, chocolate. Hazelnut chocolate is probably the best way to describe it. Very full-bodied taste but still a light fresh taste. I like it, but its a bit too light.

33cl on tap in Piwna Stopa, Poznan, PL. Pours deep brown with small head. Lots, lots of nuts in aroma, very intensive. Taste is a mixture of caramel and nuts, which gives an impression of nougat. Average carbonation. I would like to have even more body in it, then it would really be a nectar. Very drinkable

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 35cl bottle bought from cerveteca bar in Lisbon. It pours a dark reddish-brown colour with a large creamy and lasting tan head. Aroma is roasted nuts, roasted malts, caramel and chocolate. Taste is overwhelmingly nutty and sweet at the beginning, caramel malts, roasted flavour, chocolate and mocca feel, some dark fruits and a little bitter at the end. It has a medium body with a creamy feel and decent carbonation. This beer has a very nutella-like flavour, and its very enjoyable.

Bottle from Mitra Kisjes. Reddish brown to black colour, minimal head. Aroma has nuts, mocca, some chocolate, a lot of carbo. Full bodied taste, round, chocolate-like, and also hazelnut and or mocca. Nice full beer.

330ml bottle from Dronfield Beer Stop - Cloudy muddy brown body, no head. Nose is dusty nuts, overwhelmingly so. The taste is equally nutty, but not in a good way. Not a fan of this one and rather disappointing.

Bottle poured into shaker: Dark reddish brown with a tan head. The aroma was roasted nut, caramel and chocolate. It has a smooth malty flavor with a chocolate and a little bit of espresso flavor. A very creamy and medium body ale. Very enjoyable.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, hazelnut
Appearance-brown, cloudy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Bottle. Light brown pour. Aroma of malt and hazelnut, bit too mild. Taste of creamy hazelnut, with some spices, brown malt, pumpkin and a nutty bitter finish. Thin body, but a nice beer.

I keep telling myself that this is a brown ale and its really not going to be a viscous pour, so as dark as it is, Im not surprised when it flows out of the bottle at about the rate of an RC cola. (Dating myself?)
The liquid is a toasted honey-brown and light-bodied. It threatens to go over the top of the mug with a fat, delicate head that is so ambitious, I actually have to sip the foam down to a level that is compatible with a good photo. :-) Its gone in minutes, leaving only a thin stream of islands across the surface.
Head aside, the first drag demonstrates a fairly light-bodied beverage, nicely carbonated and tasting of slightly overdone chocolate chip cookies without the chips. A deep vanilla and toasted hazelnut make a play for my sweet tooth; silky warm malts seal the deal. Im hooked on this Rogue and am happily surprised by the tempting and creamy texture despite the lightness of the beer.
The finish is decadent, keeping the flavor true to the end and inviting me to enjoy yet another go...

12oz bottle bb04/2015, Maruhn. Mistook this for a porter instead of a brown ale... Pours a quite thin caramel brown. Instant full-wallop hazelnut concentrate in the nose, an immediate flashback to the 90s and its hazelnut-infused espresso shots with a generous helping brown sugar. Cherry Coke says Hi, wearing its glitzy shoulder pads. Taste is a supremacy of inferior Nutella spread and roasted hazelnuts ruining a palpably decent, if watery brown ale underneath, the delicate citrus zing of Saaz and Perle peeping gently from underneath the cheap nutty overload at the very end like the innocent glint in the eye of a shy first-time bukkake victim caught off guard in a cheap motel. Why this racy kitsch when hazelnut flavours can be had as a nuance of roasted malts? (Cf. Hermann Broch: Das Böse im Wertsystem der Kunst.)
Very sweat. Too sweat. Wasnt expecting it to be this sweat. Go with the Alesmith Nut Brown. Really not a bad beer, just not what I wanted.
Dark brown beer with a white head that quickly disapears. Taste is nutty, earth tones, sweet nectar and some hops. Nice one.

Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Minimal haze. Sweet hazelnut dominated aroma, with toffee, caramel and roasty notes. Some chocolate and roasty flavours buried within a largely sweet hazelnut dominated flavour. The label is bang on. Hazelnut nectar indeed. Some dark malt bitterness and a slight astringency. In no way sessionable, but its not intended to be I dont believe.
on tap at Morimoto in Philadelphia; deep, dark brown color; nutty, caramel aroma; sweet malt flavor with nutty, hazelnut notes; sweet malt finish; well balanced

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with small creamy beige head. Aroma is nutty, hazelnut. Sweet bready malts, light toast. Smells a bit like wort. Taste is surprisingly fresh. Loads of hazelnut dominates the picture, also unripe nuts. Sweet, slight burnt caramel. Light toast in finish, slight bitter earthy spicy hops and medium body.
Earthy, nutty notes, fade into a hint of coffee and pine hops that stand out strongly for a brown ale but not too much, this isnt trying to be an IPA or anything. Good beer.

Bottle at home. Clear brown pour, thin off-white head. Aroma is full of hazelnut, caramel, a hint of roasted malts and some cacao. Flavor is dry, a bit thin, chocolate and nuts. A bit thin body, decent carbonation.
Bottle @ home. Thanks vaiz. Aroma big duo penalties with some malt. Flavour is dry roasty chocolate with some liquorice.

I first had this on tap at the first World Craft Tasting a few years ago where it was one of my favorites at the festival. A lovely mahoganey brown pour capped with a thin head of beige foam gives off nutty toasted bready aromas with a semi-sweet caramel undertone. Yum. Medium bodied with a dry finish the texture is a touch cola like but nice. The taste is sweeter than I remember with pronounced hazelnut, roastiness & bready mild caramel. Good stuff though not as nice as I recall.

Opaque crimson brown.No head. Roast, malt, chocolate, caramel, toffee, and nutty aroma. Pungent emphasis on nuts and toffee. Thin, smooth, creamy. The same flavours present in the aroma exist in the taste, but are far less intensive than Id like. Perhaps I simply dont enjoy browns any longer.
Duur. Te bruisend mondgevoel. Op geen enkele manier de moeite waard. Pompompom. Jammer.
Tap. Pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma is malty with nuts. Flavor is very nutty with malt, caramel, earthy hops, and woody notes. Medium body with medium carbonation. Very nice.

650ml bottle, filled a pint glass. Nice off white head under an inch, with a lovely amber brown colour. Light nose, hazelnut and toffee come to the fore. Taste is hazelnut and toffee with a creamy feel, leading to a slighty malty finish with hints of chocolate, coffee and oak. Nice lacing remained; a distinct toffee/hazelnut creamy sweetness lingering on the palate. Alcohol extremely well hidden throughout. 

Quite nice, but Id have liked a bit more of a stronger finish. A sweet treat.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 Botella. @XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine,Sevilla 27/12/2014
Botella de @Llupulu, Langreo. 31/05/2016. BBD:08/2016
Color marrón, aroma frutos secos, sabor dulce, caramelo, peculiar me gusta, cuerpo medio.
22 oz bottle. Aroma: nutty, with hints of hazelnut (obviously), bread, and toffee. Taste/Palate: creamy and sweet; starts crisp, and finishes slightly astringent and bitter.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 (przeprowadzka z excela: 2014-07-05, Kufle i Kapsle) Karmelowo-orzechowo-kawowo-czekoladowe - zarowno w aromacie jak i w smaku. Drugie takie pod rzad co prawda nie do wypicia dla mnie, ale jednorazowo - fajne. z butelki, 2016.02.16, warka do 06/2016, mam wrazenie - choc troche bardziej po opisie powyzszym, ze a) mniej karmelowosci b) mniej orzechow c) bardziej latwoprzyswajalne c) wiecej palonosci (w sensie - w ogole jest). d) ocena 3.5 -> 3.7Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Herrliche Färbung, dunkelbraun, im Geruch malzig, nussig. Im Geschmack Kaffee, Nuss, später leichte Süße, sehr komplex. Fast wie ein Stout aber deutlich leichter zu trinken. Im Abgang leicht bitter. Die 6,2% merkt man überhaupt nicht. Sehr sehr lecker!
Braun, leuchtend. Haselnuss, ROcher, Malz, Haselnuss, Haselnuss, Süße, lecker.
Looks good, smells good, tastes good. Weird, tastes like a nutty brown ale. There are a few brown ales I like better but glad I tried this one finally.

Dark brown to black colour, mokka coloured medium head, sweet nuts malts warm smell, medium carbonation, fresh a bit watery jet nutty hazelnut taste, ice cream like, low to medium bitter some chocolat, wood, malts coffee taste balanced

22 oz. bottle from SoHo Organic Market, Elizabeth City, NC. Light brown pour with a short beige head. Distinct aroma of nuts and light chocolate. Hazelnuts are at the forefront of the flavor and add a lot to what is normally a rather boring style. An excellent brown ale.
Just a pretty mediocre brown ale with a bit of decent hazelnut character. Not much to say, a bit of an acrid/burnt taste. Disappointing given how much I remember liking this beer years ago.
Pours amber with a generous head that dissipates quickly paired with a hazelnut nose. Smooth entry with a lightly-carbonated, mild palate and finishing with hazelnut, caramel, and brown sugar.
Very tasty smooth dark beer. It has a rich roasted nutty scent and strong chocolate and hazelnut flavors.

Tap; pours a dark amber with a beige head; aroma is hazelnuts, roast malt, vanilla, and a hint of chocolate; taste is light sweet hazelnuts, chocolate, roast malt, and vanilla; finish is mostly dry; nice beer

This is a nice flavoeful hearty brown ale. Slightly nutty and hazelnut in flavor. Pours orangish red in color with a white head. Smells like hazelnut. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one did not worked with me. Nuts and some malts in the nose. However tha taste is rather earthy to nuts however not fullbodied. Fuller body and some more roast would suit this one.. I dont know maybe I was just to drunk :) Rogue is a a nice brand so I will re-rate this one later.
Hazelnut aroma with a brown colour not much head and a watery feel with a distinctive hazelnut taste and a nutty finish.

Small bottle, served in TeKu. Pours deep amber and ruby with great, creamy head. Very clear. Aroma is dominated by peanuts, even roasted ones. There is a hint of caramel and toffee. I dont really smell any maltiness or hops. When it comes to taste, there is maltiness and floral hopiness. Finish is long with distinct nuts flavour. Its medium-bodied, a little bit oily. Each flavour is at best medium, there isnt one dominant. Terrific beer, worth recommending to everybody. I regret having only small bottle.

On tap. Dark brown pour with small tan head. Aroma of malts, hops, chocolate and nuts. Taste of roasted malts, faint chocolate, caramel and nuts. Medium bodied, nutty middle and a bitter hop finish, medium carbonation.

Bottle, imported. Astonishing beer. After initial hazelnuts on nose, intensive barnyard & horse blanket aromas become dominant. Dont mind it, but I didnt expect it in a brown ale. Head is not impressive. Very drinkable with low co2 and low bitterness.

Bomber bottle. Aroma is nutty, and sweet. Opaque brown color, sort of muddy. Sweet taste that is very nutty and sweet. Medium bodied. Overall a pretty drinkable beer. A little too sweet to have too many in a row.
The nutty flavour/aroma dominates the beer in a negative way. There are some hints of caramel but very subtile.

12 oz. bottle from Cash Wise in Watford. Appearance: finger light brown head, head does not last, light oily lacing, copper to brown color, clear. Aroma: nutty, grassy and floral hops, light coffee, toffee. Palate: medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish, oily texture. Taste: sweet toffee and nuttiness, into light coffee, and finishing with light bitter grass finish. Overall, amazing beer. Such bold flavors and balance is super good. Always been a fan of this beer, can not believe that I have not rated this one before!

Oddly enough, I like hazelnut more in my beer than in my coffee. It's not my go to, but it's a nice change of pace. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich dark brown colour, small off white head. Rich, sweet, nutty aroma. Bittersweet hazelnut and praline taste. Sweet on the palate. Smooth nutty finish. A very quoffable brown beer.
Bottle - dark tea brown color with a small head. Has a sugary molasses nutty caramel taste. Not very malty. Very smooth. Nice sipping beer and one of the better brown ales that Ive had.
Lekker biertje. Door de hazelnootaromas bijzonder. Prima nasmaak ook. gelukkig niet al te kruidig want dat zou botsen met de hazelnoot

September 25, 2014. Bottle at SBWF. Pours dark red/brown with a minimal tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate, hazelnut, caramel. Taste is nutty, milky and malty sweetness, light bitter. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.
the hazelnut lends a unique quality to the otherwise standard fare. it;s got a good body and aroma (of a traditional brown) with the hazelnut flavor lingering on the finish. nicely done."
Carmel with back taste of strong hazelnut. Pours dark brown with no head and taste improves as you drink. My new favorite brown.

355mL bottle BB 30/12/15
Pale bronze body, beige head.
Mild aroma; crystally toffee malts, bit of milk chocolate, gets a toasted hazelnut note as it warms.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, smooth slightly silky texture.
Hazelnut certainly makes itself known on th palate - toasted, roasted nuttiness blends nicely with undertones of chocolate malt & caramel. Restrained bitterness leaves finish with a touch of sweetness.
Nice enough, hazelnut flavour is not over-the-top, but never seems properly integrated with the rest of the beer.

Aroma: caramel, toffee, toasted flavours. Appearance: hazy brown, small, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, intense caramel, grain, some toasted malts. Overall: fantastic Brown Ale, excellent aroma. Pint at Yard House - The Link, Las Vegas.

Not a traditional brown ale, but then the name should give that away. The mouthfeel and head remind me of a beer approaching a stout or robust porter. I found the beer to be very drinkable and the non-beer drinkers in my house liked their first sips. But the hazelnut flavoring does not add to the beer in my opinion. But then Im a bit of a purist and dont appreciate flavorings added to my beer.
Red-brown clear beer with little head and a sweet nutty malt aroma. Flavour is nutty malt with a touch of caramel and coffee. Light and mellow given its strength.

Color caoba oscuro, espuma poco abundante que desaparece rápido. Aroma tostado, ahumado, y un obvio aroma a avellana, a crema de avellana más bien. En boca la avellana, dulce, destaca, se aprecia la malta y el tostado, con un final ligeramente amargo. Poco cuerpo para el alcohol que tiene, se bebe en tragos peligrosamente largos. Le puede gustar a todo el mundo, yo hecho en falta una buena espuma y algo más de cuerpo.
Drank out of a mug. Wonderful aromas of both hazel nut and caramel. Pours a nice deep brown with a nice light tan. A nice sweet hazelnutty flavor with a slightly dry finish.

Głęboki aromat orzechów, a także chlebowy, biszkoptowy, lekki karmel i lekki chmiel w tle. Kolor brązowy, piwo przejrzyste, piana niewielka, ale kremowa z ładnym lacingiem. W smaku także orzechowe, bardzo łagodne, aksamitne, karmelowe, zdecydowanie słodkie. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie, odczucie w ustach pełne. Bardzo dobra, aksamitnie orzechowa kompozycja. Warka do 02.2015r.
It pours a dark amber. There is little lacing. It has the heavy aroma of hazelnut with other malts. It has a heavy hazelnut taste with roasted malts.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2014 Pours a brownish/amber color with slow disappearing brownish and foamy head. Pleasant aromas of caramel and nuts and chocolate... Clearly malty though. Tastes quite roasty in the beginning, but it quickly evolves into a pleasant slightly bitter and mildly sweet creamy coffee/nutty-like aftertaste which lingers quite long. Strong notes of the present hazelnuts and the sweetness of caramel. Medium bodied, very thin, bit watery and disappointing texture and lively carbonated. Not a bad beer. Certainly tasty on a rainy day in October, but I missed something. I wouldve loved a fuller body and a more creamier texture. It would do better justice to the mouthfeel and the appearance in general. But besides that, I loved the bottle.

Poured a translucent mid-brown colour with a one- to two-finger light brown frothy head that retained well and laced well. Carbonation high and fine. Aroma quite sweet with hazelnut plus hints of molasses, chocolate and vanilla. Taste of sweet hazelnut, slight chocolate and it fades to a very slight bitterness. Light body. Smooth, slightly creamy with hazelnut on the finish. Quite different. Quite good.

Butelka 0.33L
Wygląd: Klarowne, brunatne/ciemnomiedziane z rubinowym prześwitem. Piana jasnokremowa, średnioobfita, opada dość szybko, niewielki lacing.
Aromat: Orzechy laskowe, karmel, toffee, wafle, ciastko zbożowe, czekolada, nugat. Dość słodki aromat, jakby syropu.
Smak: Chleb z orzechami, karmel, ciastko zbożowe z orzechami, czekolada. Miły czekoladowy posmak zostaje w ustach. Lekko słodkie ale nie tak jak w aromacie. Goryczka niska.
Odczucie: Nasycenie CO2 lekko gryzące, umiarkowanie wysokie, ciało średnie.
Całość: Bardzo ciekawe, deserowe brown ale, stosunkowo słodkie ale przyjemnie. Dobre na chłodne wieczory jesienne do powolnego picia i delektowania się.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass
Aroma- toasted malt with nuts
Appearance- Dark reddish brown with a tan head. 
Taste  A lot of nut malt and hops. not bad at al
Palate- Medium-bodied with little carbonation
Overall- a pretty good beer, I would drink this again
Murky amber brown pour. Nose of hazelnut and biscuity toasted malt. Flavor is hazelnut and nutty biscuit/toasted malt. Only light sweetness which makes this more of a success. Light and clean.

18/VIII/14 - 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ home - BB: II/2015 (2014-927) Thanks to Bene for picking this one up!
Clear ruby red to purple brown beer, irregular beige small head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: toast, very nutty, some chocolate and yes, hazelnut. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: little bitter, sourish touch, lots of hazelnut flavour, some mocha. Aftertaste: cocoa powder, nutty, toast, little sour, some caramel, vanilla, hoppy touch. Interesting, not too bad.
Donkere kersen rode kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, kers en caramel. Smaakt fris, subtiele fruit en honing. Beetje bitter.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Gotta be in my top list. Maybe for nostalgia. Taste is sweet but nutty. Beer is always good from rogue. Tap & bottle
Hazelnuts straight from rogue farms. Strong but wonderful aroma and taste of hazelnuts, smooth, sweet, excellent
(bottle) clear brown colour with a small brown head; faint aroma of hazelnut; balanced flavour; slightly creamy palate; forgettable

(bottle, 35.5cl) Ruby brown colour with a beige and short foamy head. Slightly molassy and delicately toasted malty aroma with distinctive and almost perfumed notes of hazelnuts, also toffee and vanilla. Moderately sweet and slightly bitter flavour, medium bodied with a smooth carbonation. Mildly toasted malt character with notes of toffee, chocolate, vanilla and agasin hazelnuts; moderately sweet and slightly toasted malty finish with lasting notes of hazelnuts, chocolate and vanilla in the aftertaste. Not a very subtle beer, nevertheless easy-going and smooth. 01.IX.14
Dark brown pour, tan head. Chocolate and hazelnut prominent in aroma and taste. Caramel, fairly sweet though not cloying. Medium body.

The Morimoto version. Pours deep brown with low tan head. Aroma of rye, hazelnut, toffee, caramel. Taste is slightly smoky, sweet caramel and hazelnut with a light bittersweet finish. Body is medium full with soft carbonation.

This gem caught me by surprise! excellent brew. caramel nut nose, light color and consistency. bit of an oily texture, delicious none the less. very pronounced hazelnut taste. back end still nutty with some caramel/ sweetness. excellent starter brew as not to punchy, but still down right delicious.
Bottle. Hazy dark amber liquid with small tan head. Medium body and carbonation. Aroma snd taste of nuts, coffee and caramel. Great one.

Cloudy dark brown color, small off-white, maybe even tan(ish) head. Aroma is caramel and nuts. Taste is extremely nutty. Some milk chocolate and toffee. Texture is watery and greasily. Soft carbonation. Slightly sweet. Very good.
(Dobro Pivo Pri čurku 0,33l bottle)
Brunröd öl med beige skum. Doft av hasselnötter och karamellmalt. Lättare rostade toner. Detta återkommer också i smaken. Något tunn.
Pours a deep ruby,off-white head. Aroma is hazelnut,slight caramel,dark cocoa. Taste is dark chocolate,hazelnut,some coffee. Nice,tasty.

Hazy brown color with reddish hue, thin tan head. Medium to full body, soft to average carbonation. Aroma of hazelnut, chocolate, caramel. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Nice creamy texture. Great.
The mocha porter was a lot better and stouty. Aroma of hazelnut and taste like this and a bit of chocolate. medium body and foam which disappears.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Belle couleur brune; arômes et goût de chocolat aux noisette; bien intéressante mais un peu trop sucrée à mon goût
Bottle shared with McTapps. Classic style Brown Ale with a fine chocolate and caramel background and some nuts in the taste. Easy going, bit sweetish, fine balanced piwo. To recommend.

Bottle bought at Rudat in Dortmund. Pours out in a deep dark brown colour with steady low ehad and smooth body. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and hazelnuts. Taste of milky coffee, dark chocolate, hazelnuts, woods, leaves, barley, cookies and malt. Nutty finish. Smooth to drink - a really nice beer.
Amber brown with medium white head with nice vanilla hazelnut scent great unique flavor of hazelnut and a hint of vanilla at the finish. Would like another
Bottle. Black pour with a small caramel head, hazelnut and toffee aroma. Taste is nutty, chocolatey, relatively balanced and a strong hazelnut finish. Very good

Very dark brown on the eye, brown weah head - but nice otherwise. Definite hazelnut and smoky tones on the nose. Fairly neutral taste, clear hazelnut flavour, mild sweet finish. Somewhat interesting, but otherwise like Guinness with nuts.

Olyasféle alkotás, melynek minden egyes részlete a nevében szereplő szóösszetétel hiteléül szolgál. Gesztenyebarna, még inkább mogyorószínű teste pörkölt mogyoró illatát árasztja magából. Hasonló aromák ezek, mint amelyeket egy pumpkin ale kitöltése után érezhetünk: süteménytésztás, karácsonyi fűszeres, pirított diós-mandulás. Nyelvünkön tartva pazarul visszaköszönnek a korábban emlegetett benyomások, mindinkább meggyőzve minket arról, hogy a mogyoró ez esetben nem csak képletesen van jelen a sörben (ezt egyébként a címkén szereplő információk is alátámasztják). Közepesen telt és mérsékelt szénsavtartalma alatt elsősorban ez az intenzíven pörkölt ízvilág munkálkodik, kiegészülve egy cseh barna söröket idéző, füvesen savanykás jelleggel.

Aroma: Hazelnut! Cardboard, chocolate, No hop aroma, no diacetyl.
Appearance: Clear copper body. Medium tan head. Good retention. Lacing.
Flavour: Hazelnut. Light bitterness, medium-light roast, cardboard, wet dog. No hops, no diacetyl
Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation with a sting.
Overall: I assume that the beers has been mistreated or is old. No indication of age on bottle. The oxidation faults on this beer are overpowering the aromas and flavours. I thin that this beer would be great if it was fresh and/or better taken care of.

335 ml bottle, poured.
23. Specialty Beer
12A. Brown Porter
Tastes like hazelnut flavour medicine syrup. Sweet. Somehow surprisingly enjoyable. Medium body. Not bad at all
Bottle at home. Pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malts, caramel, and hazelnuts. Taste is malty, hazelnut, some vanilla. Bit thin, but nice.
Bottle (22oz): Dark brown with tan head. I taste chocolate and maybe nuts. Malts. Good brown ale.
The hazelnut blends perfectly with the sweet brown ale for a nice nutty, smooth experience. Nutty aroma, some roast grain bitterness, sweet and bitter finish. Delicious at any time of the year.

Cerveza de color ambar oscuro, casi marrón. Buena formación de espuma y persistencia media-baja. Su aroma es de malta tostada, con notas de frutos secos, en este caso avellanas que se tornan protagonistas, notas dulces que recuerdan a miel y suave lúpulo. Su sabor está en buena correspondencia con el aroma. Posee un cuerpo medio-leve y una buena carbonatación. El retrogusto es seco y maltoso donde las avellanas son las actrices principales. Sorprende. (Botella, 355 ml)

Appearance with (very dark) copper color, cloudy liquid and medium foaming. 
Aroma of hazelnuts, peanuts and wood. 
Taste of nuts and caramel. 
A great Brown Ale, unique!

På fat @ ALEhouse, Riga. Brunröd öl med givmilt smutsvitt skum. Hasselnöt och billig mjölkchoklad (tänk utförsäljning på lågprisvaruhus för 5 kronor för en kaka á 200 gram) i både smak och doft. Det blir alldeles för mycket i det långa loppet. Lätt gräsig beska.

Very drinkable brown ale. I enjoyed the aroma and flavor. Nice hazelnut. I enjoy a bit more body in a brown but overall an enjoyable drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drinkable, refreshing and aromatic beer that is ideal for autumn or rainy summer days, full of lovely tastes like hazelnut, bread, cookies, chocolate... I liked the easy, "watery" palate, making it more enjoyable than other hazelnutbeers I have had.

bottle at home. Pours amber with a small light beige head. hazelnut aroma allright, but also some nice dark malts and barley wine swiffs. Very light, watery body with some sweetness and lots of malty notes, coming back in the flavour... but the watery character is killing it for me...

Pours a lively brown with a khaki head. Aromas of caramel malt, hazelnut, slight cocoa, and a little grassiness. Moderate carbonation opens up the nice caramel, toasted grains. This rolls into a nice nutiness, the hazelnut shines. Finishes with a soft cocoa and some more toasted grains. Very easy drinking tasty beer. Medium light body.

(Bottle) Clear mid brown with a modest off-white head. Pleasant aroma with quite a bit going on - definitely nutty, also smokey hints, perhaps dark chocolate and toasted muesli. Light body, good carbonation. Taste is excellent and unusual. Its basically a good brown ale with plenty more going on, mainly a rich nuttiness develops around the mid palate, followed by some lovely toasty and chocolate notes. This is a very nice and unusual beer.
A good brown, not too browny. Dont really taste hazelnut, but I still thoroughly enjoy it.
scura con riflessi rossastri..troppa poca schiuma..aroma ottimo! biscottoso e maltato ma anche fruttato e lievitoso..calda ed avvolgente nel gusto con un finale leggermente amaro..buon corpo
Draught @vanmoll. Red brown color with a off-white. Smell and taste sweet, malts, roasty, nuts, bit chocolat. Like this one.
Bottle at home. Pours brown, nose is nutty, toffee, taste is dry, chewy, nutty, sweet, toffee, caramel.

nuts, dark fruits, some caramel; dark brown, ruby reflexes, medium off-white foam; medium sweetness, light(+) bitterness; medium body, incredibly smooth feel, soft carbonation, long but delicate nutty bitter finish;
Overall: balanced, tasty, incredibly smooth

Draft. Pours a medium to deep brown color with a light brown head. Aroma is nutty, toffee, hazelnut, toasted malts. Flavor is quite sweet with hints of toasted malts, lift coffee, hazelnut. Light to medium in body and very smooth. Delicious brown ale!

35.5cl fles, kastanjebruin met minimale kaki kraag.
aroma van caramel, kastanje/notigheid en mouten.
smaken zijn matig zoet, matig bitter, zwak fruitig, matig gemout, redelijk notig, aardse tonen, lichte chocolade, glad/romig in de mond, lage co2, en iets droog en zoete afdronk.
edit: waarom krijgt dit bier zulke hoge ratings ?

On tap at the Vega Lounge. Brown pour with an off white head. Nutty/malty aromas. Big nutty/earthy notes with a bitterness from the roasted malts and sweet honey/brown sugar/caramel notes. Quite a lot going on here. Not a big body and somewhat artificial tasting. But all in all its not as bad as the rating reflect.
Helt klar brun med ikke særlig holdbart cremefarvet skum. Duft af malt og en meget mild smag uden megen bitterhed. En god brown ale der godt kunne bruge lidt mere kant fra brændt malt.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel and some artificial like (hazel)nut. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and light notes of wood. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, some caramel and light notes of wood. Your quite typical brown ale with artificial like (hazel)nut in the aroma. Lacks character.
Mmmm. Not really my kind of hazelnutty liquid. Smells like mashington, tastes honeyish and i didnt notice a hazelnut note or anything. Still quite enjoyable
Caramelly malts, honey and hint of hazelnut... lovely honeyish sugar sweetnes on tip of tongue... bit watery with sof carbs and a medium caramel finish

Bottle. This really didnt live up to expectations. Some hazelnut on the nose, fairly malty. Less hazelnut in the flavour, mostly malts with some light hops. Not bad, but the hazelnut flavour is pretty subtle and doesnt match all that well with the beer in my opinion.

Clearish reddish-brown with a tan head. Aroma very earth, roasted hazelnuts, some smoke. Taste has a strong hazelnut note, otherwise medium bodied and fairly sweet but not overly so. Quite drinkable, except that the nut taste would get old rather quickly.

Hazelnut jumps out the glass and lodges itself firmly in the nostrils. Really unique and enticing. Roasty malts, dark chocolate offer some background perspective. Taste unfortunately fails to offer added depth. The prevailing hazelnut flavor is retained and becomes more reminiscent of hazelnut paste than actual hazelnuts. The roasted malts are background fodder again and there are some light spicy, earthy notes that continue into a very light bitter finish. Feels like emphasis on novelty and as a result fundamentals and depth are negatively impacted.

Aromat słodki, karmelowy, bardzo doppelbockowy, lekki aromat ciasta orzechowego. W smaku za to bardzo dobra słodycz mlecznej czekolady z orzechami, tudzież ciasto w płynie. Finisz wytrawny, dobrze kontruje słodycz. Świetna pijalność, świetne piwo!

Aroma: dark malts, hazelnut.
Appearance: slightly hazy brown color, poor head.
Taste: low bitterness, dark roasted malts, amazing hazelnut taste, caramel and chocolate.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Amazing hazelnut taste, thats what I really like.

Bottle - As soon as i opened the bottle the hazelnut aroma hit. Pours reddish brown with tight off white head. The aroma is very inviting as you would expect dominated by hazelnut. rich sweet taste with creamy nuttiness. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy. best Ive had in a while!

Its body has a deep dark reddish brown color with lighter reddish highlights. The head is big and foamy and has a nice light tan color. It also has very good retention and makes cool splotchy lace that is slick and slowly sides down the sides of the glass. The aroma is malty sweet, buttery and has an assertive nutty character. It has a wonderful roasted and buttery smooth nutty character. It is mildly sweet and creamy with little to no hop influence. The finish is mildly sweet and creamy as well and it has a solid medium body. On the tongue it has a slick and silky smooth texture with soft carbonation.
Just read the name of this beer and you know it is going to be good! Then you add that it comes from a great brewery and you know it is going to be outstanding....and it is!!

Transfer from BA review on 5-01-12- 
Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance  Pours a lighter brown color with a billowy tan head. The head has big carbonation bubbles entrapped within. These pop slowly overtime and leave a very nice level of lacing. 

Smell  Sweet aromas of brown sugar and molasses are quite strong. These are mixed with a malty breadlines and a hazelnut aroma. They all were in some ways not too complementary and instead seemed to be somewhat stale and artificial in nature.

Taste  A sweet brown sugar and roasted maltiness start the taste quite strong. These are soon meet with some of the hazelnut flavor and a sweeter molasses flavor that develop more toward the middle of the taste. The nuttiness intensifies as the taste advances more and is mixed with a lighter coffee flavor which dry the sweet flavor a bit at the end and leave a bitter sweet taste on the tongue which lingers a bit too long.

Mouthfeel Creamier then the average brew with a very medium level of carbonation. The creaminess suits the malty flavors well, but the carbonation sort of takes away from the flavors.

Overall  It was an alright brew. The flavors werent the greatest as some seemed a little bit artificial and the bitter and the sweet did not seem to meld very well.

On tap, pours hazle yellow with a big white head. Huge nose of roasted hazlenuts (it really lives up to its name). Attack is hazelnut and roast and peanuts and malt. Very strong but not overwhelming. Finish is long and slightly sweet. good beer.

I wasn't sure about this beer but as it turns out i loved it! Fairly easy drinking but complex enough to make a
Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at In de Wildeman, Amsterdam. Cloudy brown with cream head. Yes this certainly has a nutty, roasted hazelnut flavour and aroma along with a fruity edge. There is a touch of red wine hints, sweetish and full. Really quite interesting.

about as good as an american brown ale gets!

strong chocolate and nut aroma up front. pours beautiful brown with minimal head. a tad overcarbed for my taste, but thats really my only complaint. really perfectly balanced brown ale on the slightly sweet side, but never cloying. medium finish. flavor of milk chocolate, hazelnut (obviously), other tree nuts, biscuit, and sweet malt. 

great to drink casually, but complex enough to really appreciate. im pretty stoked this is being sold for less than $3 a bomber at a local gas station. i always pick it up along with Dead Guy whenever i fill up there.

This rich tasting ale has a distinct hazelnut aroma and taste. As an external flavoring agent, it works pretty well, but of course it can never replace the standard malt and hops basic combination. Hops in this beer is average and they do not overwhelm the hazelnut.

Butter, creme brulle, cream, lot of dairy stuff. The blend is amazing. The milky things are mostly in the aroma, less in the flavor. Creamy palate, yet also lightly fizzy. Rogue rules.
Tap at in de Wildeman.
UPDATED: OCT 22, 2014 Botella de 35,5 cl, adquirida en Beer Inn Mugishutei en Sapporo, Japon. Color marron. Sabor a avellana, malta, ligeramente a chocolate. Una cerveza espectacular.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Lightly hazy, garnet-brown with a small khaki head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of hazelnut, chocolate, toffee and roasted malt. 

Taste of caramel, hazelnut, roasted malt and chocolate. 

Medium body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to shaker. Pours mahogany amber, small off white head, not much lacing. Aroma of nuts, roasted malts, earth. Taste is very roasted nut sweet, nutty bitterness. Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Finishes malty sweet up front with floral, nutty notes that linger. Not bad.

Aromas of fresh mash, hazelnut, and chocolate. Clear brown with birnt orange highlights, and a moderately quickly fading beige head. Dry, lightly roasty, subtle dried fruit, prunes perhaps. Smooth and clean, medium bodied, finishes abruptly with lingering nutty and earthy-chocolatey notes. The flavors of hazelnut are present but by no means over the top. A great representation of a traditional English-style nut brown ale.

Really solid brown ale base with a good amount of hazelnut. Super easy drinking and really well done. Rogues bad rep aside, great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap in the Wharf, Macclesfield. Poured a dark brown colour with a medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, nuts. Flavour is similar, very nutty. Basically if you like a nutty malty beer this will fit the bill. Not my kind of thing and I still enjoyed it. Good beer.

22 Fl. OZ ($6.99) This is a very complex beer and not for the newbie. its a very good light beer mix with aspect of a dark beer and coffee. very hard to categorise as its so unique. all on its own it would be a flavor sensation and maybe too powerful, but tasted with a group of other crafts it surely stands out on its own. a great beer that would be great for an early morning or for "tying one on."
Poured from bomber into tulip glass.....dark brown with 2 finger creamy head....beer smells of nuts and malt....taste is same....very tasty beer with a great finish....i really enjoyed.

Bottle. Brown, clear with no head.
Aroma: Wow effect, hazelnuts! After it goes cereal and caramel. 
Bit sweet taste, no bitterness. Rich flavours: hazelnuts, caramel, English walnut, some chocolate. Nice creamy finish, but high carbonation.

Very good beer!

Draft at Beer and Bacon. Pours cloudy dark copper with a bubbly beige head. Tastes like malty, roasted grains, dry with a light sweetness. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet malt, and roasted grains and nuts.
Strong hazelnut flavor and aroma. Actually surprised me how much hazelnut I could taste. The head formed thick on this one.

On tap poured into an 8oz shaker. Mellow, light aromas of primarily vanilla and toffee comes through. I was expecting more hazelnut in the nose, but not so much. The murky, red brown beer is topped with a light, cloudy tan head that retains a thick ring, and has a runny lace that leaves the glass clean. A mellow, medium malty sweetness combines with a light bitterness on the tongue. The malty, syrupy texture holds a medium full, rich malty body and an average amount of soft carbonation. The roasted hazelnut comes through with a vengeance at the finish with notes of toffee, coffee, honey, and toast. A mostly nutty with some coffee remains in the aftertaste.
On tap. Dark cooper color with little head. Sweet malt aroma. Hazelnut really comes out in the flavor, along with sweetness. Very solid beer.
650 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with a small creamy beige head. Nutty aroma with malt and vanilla. Sweet nutty malt flavor with a dry finish. Texture is oily, carbonation soft.

Bottle at Cherry Bomb. Dark amber. Sweet malty aroma with lots of hazelnut. Flavour is incredibly smooth, nice sweetness from the hazelnut along with chocolate toffee notes. What a surprise! Drink it if you can find it!

Pours a dark reddish-brown with a foamy, quickly-dissipating white head. Has a sweet brown sugar, caramel, and malty aroma. Flavor is sweet, though less sweet than the aroma, with brown sugar, caramel, malts, and a small touch of hazelnut. Surprisingly little hazelnut. Has a medium body feel. The more I drank this the more I liked it, as I feel most of the flavor was on the bottom. Delicious.
2014.05.04 - 12oz bottle at Mimosa. Not going to write a detailed review. Tasty, surprisingly so. One of the few Rogues I have tried that were interesting (not that I've tried that many).

Cervesa molt dolça i bona, amb gust a avellana molt ben equilibrat.
Cerveza muy dulce y buena, con sabor a avellana muy bien equilibrado.

From Newport, Oregon to Newport Beach, California: on-tap in The Yard House, on 13th March 2014. Came a hazy mahogany brown with an off-white collar. It had an aroma and taste of sweet malty molasses and nuts with an undercurrent of honey notes (or maybe the nectar in the name made be think there was honey about?). Different and pleasing, one was enough though.

WOW!!! This one was a really good surprise. Reddish brown color with a small off-white head that keeps a nice lacing for a long time. Aroma is too complex, notes of parfaits, cornstarch biscuit, cappuccino, roasted malt, toffee and something more. Flavor is like some cappuccino beer, is sweet with notes of coffee, milk and chocolate. Slightly cornstarch again. Very impressive! Low carbonation and a medium to full body with a dry sweet cappuccino finish.

Appearance: a dark amber brown with a small (1 finger) beige head. it does leave some lacing
Aroma of chocolate, hazelnut, toasted malts, (Liquid nutella :-) )
Taste: sweet Hazelnut upfront then some roasted malts in the finish, light chocolate and Nuts aftertaste.
Low carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, slightly below medium body

Fits very well the description, and worth a try.
Rijke geur van hazelnoot. Dunne textuur en een kleine kraag maar de smaak maakt veel goed. Is de naam waardig.

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark amber brown with a small khaki head that leaves a bit of lacing that mostly slides back down into the beer. Mild aroma of chocolate, hazelnut, toasted malts, toast. Taste is hazelnut up front with toasted malts, toast, and a bit of chocolate. Quick finish of toasted malts and chocolate. Medium body, thin but not quite watery palate and high carbonation. Interesting. Would like to have more hazelnut flavor, but overall good.

Bottle: Served in a taster:
Clear ruby amber colored beer.
Aromas of hazel nut, sweat, toast, light chalky light malt toast...
Flavours of toast, bitters, malts, hazelnut, light chalky some toast...
Aftertaste is bitter, toasty, light dry, light malty and some nuts.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied and a light dry light creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: APR 21, 2014 Bottle shared with Abijen and Countbeer @ Van Moll Brewpub. Nice red brown color, medium sized off-white. Smell and taste malts, hops, roasty, nuts, bitter. Medium body and carbonation.
Pours a cola ish brown beer with a good white head. Smells hazelnut, chocolate. Tastes hazelnut, chocolate and milky. Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.

355ml bottle from The Beerhive. 
Small bubbly off white head, decent lacing. Body is slightly hazy ruby-amber. Nose is very nutty, a little chocolate. Flavour is all hazelnut, malt to the fore, only a little bitterness on the finish. Full, rich mouthfeel, little carbonation. Very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
From tap @ BBF 2014. Pours dark amber with a small beige head. Malty, nutty aroma but very well balanced. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, nutty, candy, a bit acidic. Candy aftertaste.
Bottled. No visible foam and slightly hazy. Tastes like toffee, caramel and burned sugar. One of my favorite beers in this category.

Drank with Thierry in Eindhoven 10-4-2014. Okay beer. A bit watery. Taste a bit sweet, like ranja. A bit watery also. Not bad, but not my thing. Hazelnut taste was okay but also not really my cup of tea.
Aroma of malts, nuts, some chocolade, Flavour is slightly roasty sweet malts. Smooth finish with just a little bitterness. Nice brew.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, nussig, Karamell. Geschmack röstmalzig, Karamell, Haselnüsse, klasse!
Bottle @brew night with jeevan & allmyvinyl. Pours Brown, sweet malt first up on the nose then some chocolate. Taste is very much the same but with some nut at well, a little sweet for my liking.
Tap at Bricks. Pours clear dark ruby. Mild malt in the nose. Delicious creamy hazelnut flavor. Nice dry aftertaste.
Bottle. Served a dark brown color. Taste follows with roasted malt, hazelnut and bit of chocolate. Mild bitterness and the finish is quite nice. Enjoyable beer.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Hazy brown body with a thick beige head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of plum, Fererro Roche and cheap advent calendar chocolate. Flavour of caramelised nuts. Its much lighter than I thought it might be, although the flavour becomes richer as it warms. Thin body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Soft fizz. The hazelnut is a really nice addition - its not overdone and works really nicely. That said, its not a beer I could drink a lot.

Pours medium brown with one finger of creamy tan head. Aroma is malty and nutty. Lots of hazelnut. Flavor is sweet malt with lots of nutty hazelnut. Slightly tangy. Lighter bodied. Slightly bitter. Nice beer.

couleur entre ambré et noir, nez sur le chocolat, le caramel, un peu de café et de noisette. Bouche légère, peu épaisse, aqueuse, sur le caramel, le chocolat noir, légèrement marqué par la noisette. Finale assez courte, peu amère. Une bière facile mais très simple, un peu décevante au final.

355ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear brown, thin off-white head. Aromas are chocolate and light nuts, touch of spice. Taste has more chocolate sweetness. Finishes crisp enough, not sticky. Good.

On tap. Served a dark brown color with a nice tan head that fades to lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, nuts, hint of chocolate withbit of malt sweetness. Taste follows with roasted malt, hazelnut and bitof chocolate. Mild bitterness and the finish is quite dry. Medium body, smooth and creamy with a nice malty richness. Enjoyable beer. Nice take on the style.
Mmm delicious. Lots of malty goodness and nutty hazelnut flavor. Bomb. On tap it was real smooth. Light and dry, but also filling.

Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar has a very thick, cream-colored head, a pretty dark, obscured, brown appearance, and decent lacing left behind. The aroma is of medium-roasted barley malt, sweetness, and hazelnut. Taste is the same, with a tea note and low bitterness (Id never guess 33 IBU). Mouthfeel is medium and slick, and Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar finishes dry, easy going, and nice. RJT
brown beer brown beer how do yo taste? malty/caramel sweet and dry. Hazelnut ??

Poured with short-lived light tan 1" head. Vibrant clear brown color. Many bubbles on side of glass like a soda. Very low aroma of hazelnut, had to sniff repeatedly and vigorous to detect. Mostly malt aroma. Adequate balance of malt sweetness and bitter, nice to drink, but didn't pick up as rich nutty character as I had expected. A bit metallic aftertaste. Low to Moderate body, high carbonation - very burpy. Overall drinkable brown ale but on the boring side, I had expected more special character.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is one of my favorite beers, if not my favorite! Rich tones of coffee and grains, not too heavy and pairs great with red meat! I haven't had anything from Rogue that I do not like, yet! Lol

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Bottle: Swampy brown with a copper edge tint, light clarity & light haze throughout; a soapy, beige head stretched out thinly on top. Aroma is full force sticky toffee, more so than hazelnut even. Actually only a very mild hazelnut tone in the aroma. Slightly artificial, like concentrate with an undertone of residual sweetness. Off-notes of wet cardboard & dry rot... What? Is this oxidized already? Hazelnut is more relevant on the palate... Hazelnut, cola, toffee, dry cocoa powder, & nuts, leading into a lasting woodsy & earthy finish. Im getting that weird, wet cardboard flavor & its really turning me off. Not as sweet as I was expecting... Rather dry, nutty aftertaste. Wasnt a huge fan of this one... Not sure what that cardboard was all about. Id like to try another bottle to see if things are different, but I wont be rushing to do so.

Nutty choc aroma. Clear amber colour with nice rocky head. Nice nutty flavour with delicious caramel malt. Med body and carbonation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Strong flavors of artificial hazelcut, but very watery, and overly nutty. Not something Id buy again.

Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Clear, dark ruby red. Halo of off white head. Looks the bees. Fruity, nutty, gianduja aroma. For me though, the taste is too overpoweringly sweet. It verges on artificial. Quite unpleasant, by the end of the glass.
Catching up on some old ratings from Untappd -- First rated on 28 May 2011.
Pours a dark brown. Strong smell of hazelnuts with some brown sugar. Taste follows the nose.

Tap. Deep brown body with an average, lacing beige head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, caramel and chocolate notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with a bitter touch. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A very nice brown indeed.
Pleasant taste and smell of nuts. Reminds me of a light belgian. I guess thats why its a brown ale.

Bottle. Dark Brown Body with tan fast disappearing head. Aroma is nutty, malty. Taste is also hazelnuts malts with moderate sweetness. Aftertaste is moderate bitter also with hazelnuts and malts.
Very nice one.
pours a deep brown. Aroma is nutty, caramel, and chocolate. Flavor is dry with a nice nut backbone with little hazelnut character. Finishes with a sweet caramel finish.
Aroma of hazelnuts and syrup. Nice full body and dark color. Good but not great.

Bottle; Pours dark brown with little head, very nice flavour with hints of coffee and hazelnuts, quite smooth and easy drinking, I little to carbonated for me but overall very good Id have it again and again :)
Pours very clear with just a little head. Great taste and good after taste. Very smooth. Maybe it's just me but I can't find the hazelnut... Overall, I would order this again and again and again.

12 oz bottle served in a snifter.

A: A fine dark brown color; Clear with a modest head. Head has only a short life.

S: Aroma of light malt is nearly buried under the powerful aroma of roasted hazelnuts. 

T: A remarkable nutty flavor is true to the "Hazelnut Brown" label. More nutty than any beer I can remember. This component is mainly hazelnut but there is a bit of generic roasted nut flavor there too. It finishes with an extravagant roasted hazelnut and malt flavor, with hints of chocolate, oats, and spicy hops. Excellent bitter/sweet balance. 

M: smooth; medium-full bodied; excellent, moderate carbonation.

O: This is a world-class nut brown ale. Not to be missed by any beer aficionado.
Pours brown with a thin head. Nutty aroma with hints of toffee. Flavors are the same as the aroma.

Reviewed from notes. Ive had this beer more than multiple times in my life.
The appearance is a dark brown colored body that leaves a nice one finger creamy tan lacing looking head. The body is totally too dark for any carbonation to be seen and a perfect super light foamy lacing is left.
The smell has hazelnuts and brown sugar up front with some malts in the background, reminds me a bit of beer bread.
The taste is the same as the smells coming through on my tongue with a bit more nuttiness.
On the palate, she sits about a medium, maybe closer to heavy, still has a good deal of sharpness on the tongue with a sticky aftertaste.
Overall, this is probably one of the best English Brown ales on the market one can get in the USA. Dont pass up if you see it.

Light clear brown. Sips with big toffee. Aroma is slightly hop centered. Body is medium low and a little more watery than I remember. This is the first time Ive had off draft though. Finish is sweet chocolate and toffee with a very slight dry hop balance. Low carb liveliness. Not the best brown, but a decent choice.
nuts, raisin, woody, red, brown, cloudy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter,

On tap @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a dark red hazy colour, small quite diminishing off-white head. Aroma is medium malty with notes of hazelnut. Taste is medium sweet. Little to medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, sweet finish.

Brown ales in general do not impress me, but this is better than most. Soapy dishwater aroma and big malt as well. Cool khaki head, brown translucent body. Like most browns, its a bit thin. The hazlenut does give it more character though. For its style, top notch. In general I wont rush back for this one.
Bottle->SA. Medium brown with small khaki head. A: tons of malt and nuts. T: same. Bittersweet aftertaste. Moderate carbonation and clean finish. Good.

On draft at Aqueous, Nemacolin. Poured hazy brown with thin brown head. Flavor is of roasted malt, chocolate, toffee, woody, and plenty nutty. Medium bodied. Really a fine beer if nuts are your thing.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 Draft pour.  Tried a couple more times just to be sure.  Pours a very dark brown with a faint malty aroma. Probably one of the nuttiest beers i?ve had. Sweet on the nose.  Really nice, smooth favor.  Maybe a bit too sweet.  Some hazelnut and graham crackers flavors with a touch of spice.  Overall, a very good beer.
Nice nutty, sweet flavor. Plenty of chocolate as well as hazelnut. Enough hops to keep it balanced and not too sweet. My wife likes it too; a good beer for everybody.

Aroma : sweet malt aroma paired with a fairly pronounced hazelnut smellTaste :very sweet malt flavors that f8nish with hazelnut, chocolate and a very subtle and well balanced bitternessAppearance : cloudy brown body with medium to low retained head

A distinctly pleasant surprise to find this so far from home in one of my locals in Christchurch. Well, it des what it says on the label: its ruby-brown in colour with an off-white head that budgeted off in short order. This was poured to cold to ascertain the aroma at first, but as they came forth there was a lush nutty, chocolate cocoa that set the appearance off nicely. The flavours were similar with very subtle bitterness. A delight of a pint, best suited to warmer serving in Autumn.

pours a dark brown color with a beige head that did not stay long, only to leave a ring around the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, nuts and herbs. Taste of roasted malts, nuts, herbs, hints of coffee and chocolate, and brown toast. Light carbonation and a little watery finish. Nice light tasty beer, nice balance of flavors, a little too light overall. Nice enjoyable beer,

Too dark for me to see now. Love the hazelnut flavor and very smooth. No real hoppiness. Still very pleasant.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 hazelnuts of course but no strong taste...
Good but too light...

On tap at L express de Lyon (Paris)

On tap version much more aromatic than bottled. AND if you drink parallel with decent IPA, IPAS intense hoppy character, highlights brown ales nuttiness even more. So.. intense nuts, with quite intense malt background, bit roasted, some wood, quite low on hops, but enough for balance (I balanced it even more with IIPA :D ) Sweetish with moderate bitterness. Quite smooth. Very interesting and enjoyable brew

Bottle into pint glass, cloudy copper-brown color with tan head. Aroma of hazelnuts, chocolate and rich caramel malt. Taste adds notes of toast and chocolate milk. Medium body, low-moderate carbonation, creamy with light roasty sweet finish. Nutella beer describes this pretty well, I found it quite tasty.
average carbonation, light body, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, brown, cloudy, minimal head. very tasty!
I remembered this being good and it didnt disappoint. Really enjoyed this one. Nice dark color with great brown hazelnut flavor.

What's not to like about a hazelnut brew! Beautiful flavor with a nice sweet nutty brown flavor. Frozen hazelnut smooth finish. Excellent beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Nice brown color with a brown head. Aromas of hazelnut and milk chocolate. Same taste with notes of brown sugar and malts. Sweet aftertaste. Medium body and low carbonation. Nice for what it is, but not something extraordinary!!
For what it is, its a solid brew. Rich chocolate and huge hazelnut notes. Almost like a liquid candy bar. In small amounts I liked it.
11 Jan 2014, bottle. brown, clear, no bubbles. nose is sugary malt and hazelnut. med body and mildly fizzy. toasty nut, syrup, hazelnut. meh.
Clear brown and copper pour. Aroma of hazelnut. Taste is hazelnut. Not much else going on. Like drinking Nutella. Light watery body. Not bad but also not impressive

Kaatuu lasiin kuparinruskeana ja hieman valoa läpäisevänä, runsaalla 2,5 sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Hajussa on vahvimpina limppuisuutta ja makeaa sokerisuutta. Paahdetta ruisleipääkin on reilusti joukossa, ja hiven pähkinääkin. Ei mikään suuri elämys ole hajun perusteella tiedossa. Maku on samaa sarjaa: limppua, paahdettua pähkinää ja paahdettua leipää sekä hieman sokerisuutta. Suutuntuma on melko maitoinen ja keskitäyteläinen. Erilainen brown ale, jossa selvää bockmaisuuttakin joukossa. Ei mikään erikoinen olut.

Caramel color. Thin to no head. Sugary aroma. I do detect the malts but they are vague. Lacking in a bold taste. Really simple. No body. Needs a more boozy taste. Or even some bitterness. In all honesty this is a boring brew. It crazy since their Old Crusteacean Barleywine was my absolute favorite brew of 2013. But at least they consistently put out good stuff.

This one had me at the first sip. So rich. So nutty. So sweet. Hazelnut Brown Nectar is nectar of the gods. Brown ales are characteristically mellow, but this one takes advantage of their soft mouthfeel while creating flavors that pack a wallop. I couldnt get myself to put this ale down.
The head is ok, body dark brown. It smells hazelnuts, chocolate, soft, malty. The taste is intensive, hazelnuts, tasty, chocolate, aromatic. Delicious. 4.0

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a nice deep brown with small yellow head. Aroma is hazelnut, nutella, roasted malt and some caramel. Taste is chocolate (Nutella) with an aftertaste of hazelnuts, oak and hop bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared with northropfrye. This was nice but I was expecting a bit more from it. Some hazelnut flavour but it could be so much more.
The only thing I like to say is hazelnuts. Its this beers goodside and curse in the same time. After a while I cn think only about hazelnuts and it wasnt so great, but still stays in mind.
Amber body off white head. Aroma of hazelnut sweet vanilla and dairy. Taste though is abut like a typical cream ale or amber with a bit more sweetness and lactose. Not bad.
Light nutty aroma with little one finger head, drinking from the tap. Lightly hopped on the nose, it has a sweet body, with a mild bitter finish.

From a 33cl. pours a dark brown color with a beige head that did not stay long, only to leave a ring around the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, nuts and herbs. Taste of roasted malts, nuts, herbs, hints of coffee and chocolate, and brown toast. Light carbonation and a little watery finish. 
Nice light tasty beer, nice balance of flavors, a little too light overall. Nice enjoyable beer, but something is missing.

Brown bodied, clean bubbly. Huge hazelnut aroma, very typical and interesting. I am not a big fan of hazelnuts but this works pretty well. Taste isnt quite as big or typical, but a good brown ale nonetheless. Fun try, but dont think I would want to drink this all the time. (33cl bottle from Peoples Drugstore)

Bottle in the Head of Steam, Durham. Slightly hazy chestnut colour. Definite hazelnut aroma. At first a bit nutty and bitter before an amazing hazelnut blast on the finish. Theres chocolate in there too making it very tastey. A really great brown ale.

Pours deep reddish to coppery brown with small off-white top, min lasing. Aroma - complex malty, intense nutty, sweet. Taste - minimal sweet, light bitter from darker malt, a bit sour end, interesting flavor. Seems quite dry finish, medium bodied, deep fermentation, thick texture, soft carbonation, bitter dry aftertaste. 
 Interesting beer, nutty indeed, dry palette, but its a bit boring, well brewed but nothing to desire so a bit too average.

Bottle date: Rogue dont care, so neither do I!

A: Pours a brown ale with a single finger of fine peanut head. Then I notice excellent clarity with blazing red where light comes through. The head falls to a solid sheet of the same. No lacing.

S: Nose is of hazelnut and pancake batter. Some hints of brown sugar and light malts. Simple, straitforward, nice.

T: Hmm, nice and roasty, dry and nutty. Slightly bready with sweetness. Again, simple and straitforward, nice.

M: Medium with moderate to hi carb. Dry finish.

O: Well done beer. Not much of a Rogue fan, but this is good stuff. I recall having this several years ago and really digging it, but didnt think that memory would serve consistent. Right on.

Serving type: bottle

08-04-2011

Bottle shared by Bobo, thank you! Aroma nutty. Complex malty character, I am not able to discern much more. Clear deep ruby brown colour. Taste is initially cocoa, chocolate. Nutty. Rather sweet, but has subtle balancing roasted notes. Finish quite long in duration. Dark chocolate. Moderate body.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 Pours a brown color with a medium tan head. Nose is chocolate, caramel and hazelnut. Aromas are toasted malts, milk chocolate, with a discreet but quite enjoyable hint of hazelnut. Average carbonation, medium body. Slightly bitter finish. Well-balanced beer and easy drinkable. Love this.

Sicuramente è una ottimo esperimento, perchè al naso si sente davvero la nocciola, però ahimè secondo me in bocca tradisce un pò, forse perchè avendola bevuta on tap non era in grande forma. Non mi ha convinto...

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Red/brown slightly hazy body with small beige head. Aroma is hazelnut, hazelnut and hazelnut. Great! Some toast, caramel and chocolate in the background. Taste is similar, dominant hazelnut, with some more raisin, earth and a subtle roastyness. And although there almost is no bitterness (just very little in the finish), it isnt too sweet. Greatly balanced! The mouthfeel is medium, oily, with a good carbonation and a smooth toasty and slightly astringent finish. Quaffable, unique, very good!

Premetto che ero un pò diffidente quando mi hanno proposto una Brown ale alle nocciole, in primis perchè non amo troppo le nocciole e poi perchè non le credevo troppo adatte alla birra a causa del loro contenuto oleoso. Ho dovuto ricredermi totalmente, al naso si sente lodore intenso della nocciola che si ritrova appena la birra passa in bocca. In un primo momento il sapore di nocciola è intenso, dopodichè vengono fuori tutti i sapori di una Brown ale. Veramente ottima, molto caratterizzata dalla nocciola ma senza dubbio una delle migliori birre che abbia mai bevuto finora.
Tap at Rogue, Portland. Colour is clear copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Hints of chocolate, sweetness, hazelnut and roasted malts.

Bottle, great taste of. Hazelnut and chocolate this is my favorite brown ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells like a nice beer. Homogenous appearance throughout. Nice brown color. Taste is complex. One of the best browns Ive ever had. Palate similarly complex and rewarding. I found this beer in a 750 mL bottle at my local Costco. Good beer to give as a gift for sharing and celebration. Would not drink a whole bottle in one sitting myself.
Bottle. Dark brown with a tan head. Nutty chocolately aroma and taste. Slightly earthy too. Medium creamy palate. Pretty tasty.

Pours a copper brown color with an off white head. Caramel, chocolate, malt and hazelnut aroma. Chocolate, caramel, pale and roasted malt, hazelnut, toffee and some raisin flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a smooth but not quite creamy mouth feel. Hazelnut and caramel finish.

Pours a slighty reddish brown with about a finger of light tan head. Some brown sugar and dark fruit in the nose. Very rich, velvety chocolate with hazelnut notes that fades into a slight burnt toast aftertaste. Very sweet, pretty delicious.

355 ml bottle bought at YATA in Grand Century Place, Mong Kok.
Translucent ruby brown colour; Very thin head and off-white foam which fades in 20 seconds; Small sticky lacing and notable slight carbonation; Aroma of chocolate, hazelnut, light roasted malt, nuts, molasses, light dark fruit and light cream; Mid to light sweet taste of light roasted malt, with light chocolate, cream, nuts, shades of dark fruits, light lemon and grass; Light body, watery palate; Taste profile is dominated by nutty, light roasted malt surrounded by light milk chocolate and hazelnuts. Some dark fruit taste shows up briefly, but otherwise pretty empty; Hoppiness is almost zero hop nose, adequate lime and grassy taste. Notable but fairly low bitterness for semi-finish; Wet after taste; Quite nutty and very easy to mouth.

Comments: This one is only half successful: it has the advertised hazelnut smell and taste, and a pretty nutty character. As a Brown Ale, though, its too watery, roasted malt is thin, too little cream and chocolate, and Perle / Sterling hoppiness is nowhere to be found. Feel like drinking a void. An ambitious Brown ended up with empty promises. Not again!

From 22oz. bottle to shaker. Pour is a very deep copper, barely transcluscent. Very thick and creamy khaki head. Nose is odd, definite roasted malt, caramel, slight chocolate, nut aroma as well. The taste is great, medium bodied, very slight hop bitterness for balance but overall sweet. Very creamy mouthfeel, light carbonation with an awesome malty smooth finish. Great beer, definitely will grab this from my warehouse again.

Botella de 65 cl. En el lupulo. Color ambar cobrizo casi a marrón. Cuerpo medio con espuma blanca no muy persistente. Aroma a frutos secos (avellana y algo amargo nuez verde). Sabor efectivamente como reza en la etiqueta a avellana seguido de malta algo dulce poco Amargor final. Buena cerveza muy equilibrada (como toda la gana Rogue que he tomado hasta el momento) para empezar la velada sin más.
Cerveza facil de tomar pero con aroma fuerte a nuez cafe y caramelo. Aroma muy pronunciado y apariencia opaca.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Aroma a nuez, sabor a cafe, color oscuro caoba, cerveza que se deja tomar no muy espumosa.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Nice deep brown with small yellow head. Aroma is nutella, roasted malt and some caramel. round and smooth mouth feel with low carbonation. Aftertaste is hazelnuts, oak and hop bitterness. Overall: Very Nice. The hazelnuts Smells and tastes wonderful.
Pours brown no head or lacing. Nose is caramel, notes of caramel, some dark fruit, nutty. Tastes is medium sweet and light bitter. Full body and lively carbonation.
Bottle 50 cl. Amber hazy with offwhite head. Aroma of malt and nuts. Light bittersweet taste, malt end. A bit watery
Bottle, kindly shared by Bobo. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Roasted malt, hazelnuts, caramel, wood in aroma Taste, roasted malts, caramel, hazelnuts, dark chocolate, wood. Good.

Brune claire, effervescence moyenne-faible, quasi pas de mousse dès le départ. Super maltée (vu la composition, on ne sen étonne pas!), caramel léger, un peu trop aqueuse, notes de vanille, présence de noisettes mais pas trop.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours brown with a tan head. Taste sweet, chocolate, nutty. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle into shaker. Tons of frothy tan foam. Malty sweet aroma with hints of nuts. Sweet flavor with a very light hops finish. Creamy mouthfeel. This brown ale has more of a sweet porter identity. One of my favorites.
Aroma is light and nutty. Hard pour gives you thick creamy tan head that dissipates quickly. Pours dark clear brown. Taste very nutty with a bit of coffee bitter mixed in.
Aroma of caramel and toffee. Medium bodied and malty on the tongue. Finishes with Hazel nut and hop bitterness. Great, enjoyable brew.

Absolutely one of my all time favorites. Great aroma, perfect finish. Malty, nutty, superb. Love it.

Malty aroma deep brown in colour nice malty well balanced ale bottle from iga wantirna

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Aroma : Sentori di caramello, tostato e noccioline si sprigionano immediatamente all?apertura di questa birra.Aspetto: Versandola nel bicchiere, si può notare una schiuma non troppo compatta, beige tendente al nocciola, che scompare immediatamente. Il colore è ambrato, un rosso ambrato quasi simile a quello della cocacola.Sapore: birra mediamente dolce, inizialmente, con un richiamo amaro deciso nel finale. La pulizia del sorso è notevole,Palato: il corpo risulta medio, non è sicuramente una birra corposa. Cromosa, con carbonatazione abbastanza soffusa ma presente. Il finale, appunto, è amaro ma non astringente. In definitiva, una birra molto beverina ed a parere personale la miglior Brown Ale mai bevuta. Il problema mio è che questa birra è stato un vero e proprio colpo di fulmine, ne berrei a non finire se possibile.
Nuts, toffee, cherry aromas. Caramel malt flavor, plum, hazelut, cocoa, soursweet finish. Nice, flavorful and quite well balanced brown ale.
22 ounce bottle. Pours reddish brown with a nice light tan head. Aroma of malt, nuts, and caramel. Taste is malt, hazelnut, caramel, chocolate, and vanilla. Surprised at how enjoyable this was.

It pours a dark brown color with lots of red highlights and a tan head. The aroma is toasted, chocoalty and nutty. Pretty sweet. The flavor is more sweet hazelnut, toast, mild roasted malt, touches of vanilla good body and carbonation. Very tasty beer, and pretty much as advertised.

On draft at Dan's Downtown Tavern. Pours a clear light brown. Thin head, no lace. The aroma is very heavy on the hazelnut and not a whole lot else. The flavor is delightful. It's thin in the mouth, but I love the prominence in the nuttiness. Makes it a solid beer =]

Pours chestnut color, aroma malty chocolate, toffee and grain, solid middle-malt palate, finishing with a flavor that I guess is hazelnut since that is the name of the beer.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a deep brown with a tanner frothy head. Nose has loads of hazelnut and coffee with an earthy herbal hop presence. Taste is like a mixture of Nutella and espresso. Really smooth on the palate. Nice stuff

Pours deep brown. Head is off white. Not much lacing. Nose is pungent Nutty sweetness. Aroma is syrupy. Wood, earth nut flavours. Medium bodied. Bitterness is there and beer is nicely balanced. Not bad
Draught at Søernes Ølbar. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of coffee, roasted malt, nuts and hops.

Pours an amber red-brown with off-white head. Aroma is the best thing about this beer - smells wonderfully nutty with a tiny bit of malt and chocolate. Tastes of sweet hazelnut, though body is a little on the thin and watery. Flavour doesn't last long. Some nice slick carbonation. A drinkable beer that I am always happy to return to.

Mmmm. A delicious aroma blending coffee, chocolate and of course hazelnut with a slight orange tangy-ness tingling the nose. The hazelnut is more pronounced on the nose, as are the hops, while the malt provides full body and length. Perhaps slightly too sweet, but other than that its lovely.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Tasted this great beer at a beer tasting. The hazelnut aroma/taste was very different and gave it a very unique character. Not a big fan of brown ales but they nailed it with this one.
Poured from a bottle it is the Color is reddish brown with a slight head it has the aromas of coffee and hazelnuts the taste is of hazelnuts and it is sweet that lingers on the palate
From 12 oz bottle shared in Avon NC. Pours a clear cola brown with an off white head. Nutty malt nose. Flavors of hazelnuts. Light to medium body, light carbonation, smooth crisp finish.

Ótima cerveja! O seu aroma já demonstra o porque do nome, trazendo notas de nozes, baunilha, malte, um leve tostado. Sua aparência é boa, com uma coloração cobre e espuma creme, de boa persistência. No sabor as nozes ainda dominam, além de trazer um dulçor dos maltes empregados e um leve tostado. O amargor é leve e também está no retrogosto, que ainda deixa um bom saber no de nozes. Seu paladar que poderia ser melhor, achei um pouco aguada. De qualquer maneira, é uma excelente cerveja!
