Bottle from Erzbierschof - Clear brown color, persitent beige foam - Hazelnut, caramel aroma with hints of roasted malt and vanila - Hazelnut an malty flavor - Medium body, creamy, low bitterness, good carbonation, moderate dry and nutty finish - Really enjoyable beer, well balanced, good realisation.
You can really taste the hazelnut on your lips and in the back of your throat, this beer is creamy and delicious I would drink again and recommend to anyone.

Its like a hazelnut liquor but withou the alcohol, little foam on it, very unique.

For cap collectors: the average Rogue cap.
Thanks for tectactoe on the split. This one seemed ok for the style. Im just not a big fan of the brown ale.

poured from a bomber. aroma of hazelnut, steamed milk, milk chocolate candies. pours a deep mahogany brown with short lasting off-white head; no lacing. Tastes like sweetened iced tea or coffee, notes of hazelnut and caramel. sweet but pleasantly so, just the right amount. Palate is full but crisp, nice carbonation. overall, a very drinkable beer, not very interesting, mind you, but it tastes good for a beer that is sweet.
This is what a great beer should taste like. Fantastic way to spend an afternoon eating a nice gourmet burger and quenching the thirst of a Rogue Beer enthusiast. Now that has plenty of Cow-Bell
amber, brown, sparkling, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium bitterness, fizzy, medium body,

04-15-2011. 22 oz bottle.

A: A deep, hazy amber color, slightly opaque with a creamy tan head.

S: The hazelnut is very prominent, other sweet roasted malts (Im thinking chocolate and some caramel) make up most of the nose. Hop aroma is very mild.

T: A really nice nutty, roasted malt flavor with a more mild breadiness in the background. Just the right hints of smoky char. Plenty of malty sweetness with just a little bitter hops.

M: Medium bodied, good carbonation and a really nice smooth finish. Leaves a very pleasant coating of nutty malted flavor that hangs around for a long time.

O: The hazelnut flavor is great. Definitely gonna pick this one up again.

355ml bottle. Clear ruby red glowing mahogany colour with average, thick, foamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Intense nut and nougat aroma, hazelnut flavours predominate, maybe also Brazil nut, peanut butter. Taste is dry, notes of diverse kinds of nuts and their parings. Unbelievable intensity of nut flavours.
Not bad, but not startling either. Dark brown colour with a little head. Decent taste.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 This beer is delightful. It has a delicious hazelnut after taste. I would recomend this beer to anyone. I?ll be getting it again.
Pours a dakj brown color with a khaki colored head that does not leave. Taste is of sweet hazelnuts, malts, and chocolate. Great beer

Pours a nice brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, plenty of hazelnut, bread, vanilla with some woody notes. Taste is medium to high sweet leading to a mellow finish. Pretty good!

Deep and dark copper color with a medium carbonic and a foamy beige head, in aroma is very malty with notes of chocolate and plastic hazelnut (hazelnut extract). In palate is weak and watery with the chocolate notes with nuts and hazelnut extract and a medium dry finish. Too plastic and without body to balance the sweetness.
Brown dark amber with rimming beige head; slight roasty and sweet aroma some notes of hops; Flava is rich sweet and nutty; feels medium to light some fizz; finishes grainy sweet slightly chocolaty
This is delicious. Its a little watery in the texture, however this makes it more drinkable. Great aroma too.

Pours with a fluffy off white head and a clear burnt brown colour.
Arounds of brown sugar, Vienna loaf bread, roasted macadamia nuts and a little cinnamon.
The taste is super smooth, rich, bread dough, raisins, brown sugar, and just a hint of mild coffee.
The finish has a slight spice and little nut too it, quite thick and chewy.

50cl bottle bought at GBBF13. Brown to red color with thin head. Carbonation is quite present, I wasnt expecting this... Body is quite thin. Taste is medium to light bitter and light sweet. Aroma is lightly hopped, light yeast, chocolate, dried fruits. Really enjoyable!
My favourite brown ale right here. Very well balanced while also being extremely well flavoured - nutty sweet but not overboard, mild hop bitterness. Ripper of a brew.

Tasted from bottle. Puts a brown color with off white head. Aroma is caramel and maybe some prunes. Taste is bready caramel and toffee. Medium bodied. Minimal bitterness. Definitely a good brown ale but not as good as some of the cigar city browns I've had.

Cannot miss the hazelnut flavor. When drinking it, flavors are coming at you all at once. Mouth is left with a full body feeling. There is a slight froth-like feel, but it is overpowered by the light bite of the beer. Overall, great beer with hazelnut flavor (if you are into that kind of thing).

22floz/650ml bottle into a shaker glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Oh so nutty. A little milk chocolate and sweetness too.

Appearance: Translucent deep amber/brick body with a thick (but dissipating) creamy tan head.

Taste: So delicious. It reminds me of honey nut cheerios. Just enough bitterness to round it out and give it some character, but this is a sweeter-maltier beer. And it is great.

Palate: Medium-full body and a nice moderate, malty finish.

Overall: Such a great beer. One of my favorites. Love the sweet, nutty flavor.
On draft at the brass tap, poured a brown color with aromas of hazelnuts, toffee, and some light caramel. Flavors are the same with some sweetness in the aftertaste.

Tap at The Flying Pig, East Dulwich. Pour a nice rich brown colour with a hint of red a good sized off-white head. Aroma is slight whisky, toffee a touch of rum. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. It's like a hazelnut cream soda with a dash of whisky and rum chucked in. Toffee too, and a little roasty. Nice.

Poured bottle into a pint glass, it is brown in colour alright and the aroma was like sticking your nose into a leather boot used by someone who has previously had their foot in a malt loaf

If you got this in a night club in the 80s you would think the pint of Websters you'd bought was off!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a clear brown body with a small fizzy off-white head that left a bit of light lacing. The nose is rather sweet with lots of hazelnut extract and a nutty and caramel malt base. The flavor is pretty decent at first, caramel and hazelnut sweetness up front with a minimal hop bitterness on the back end. It gets a bit tiring and becomes a one trick pony after a while though and starts to bore me. Light to medium bodied with a little clingy stickiness and fizzy carbonation. Pretty decent for what it is, I remember really liking this when I first got into craft beer. I suppose I moved on quite a bit since that time 10+ years ago.
Bread, bread, bread, bread, toast, toast, bread, bread, bread, bread, bread, bread, bread

Keg at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a half-opaque ruby brown, small head. Aroma is lovely - biscuity, caramel, hazelnut, a little earthy. Smells quite like chocolate digestives (which I now want. Damn.). Taste is great, a real hazelnut character up front, with some earthy, spicy notes, a little biscuit and just a fleeting fruitiness. A little dry, medium bodied and refreshing. Really like this sort of beer, and this is a very hood one indeed.

A very well rounded brew. Nectar might be the perfect word for this with its sweet hazelnut almost caramely taste. Strong hints of nut, hazelnut, mocha, malt, caramel. Super rich and sweet creaminess all blend together in harmony in my mouth. Highly recommended! Well done Rouge!!

Bottled. Pours clear ruby in color with a small tan head. Milk chocolate, sweet nuttyness as well, perhaps leaning more to the side of these sweet nutty notes actually. Flavor is quite similar with sweet and nutty notes being there. Nice, quite nutty aftertaste. One of the better brown ales so far.

Bottle at brew on quay. Pours dark brown with not much head. Quite carbonated. Perfumed aroma sweet metallic and malty. Initial taste is unappealing then the sweetness and flavour comes through. Hazelnut syrup and smokey berries. Weird but I guess this would be a decent desert beer.
Brown bubbleless body with a tall and thick tan head. Nutty. Slightly oily and not watery. Bitter and astringent after taste.

A colabroen beer with a medium and beige head. The nose is dark bready, with a personal, pleasant and dry nuts, also wood and some chocolate. Taste of nuts, milk chocolate, bread. The end is quite dry, some sour bread, also still nuts. Medium and smooth bodied, low carbonation, nice to drink. The personal and tastefull Brown Ale, even that style isnt my favourite. Nice nuts and chocolate.
Im a fan. Taste at PGH Brewfest 2013, but Ill certainly buy a full bottle soon. A solid nutella, sweet hazelnut flavor over a brown nutty, malty finish.

Pours a clear medium brown with a big  brownish/yellow head that slowly turns into a thin ring around the glass. Aroma is hazelnut, rich maltiness, sweet caramel, chocolate and toast. Tastes include chocolate, rich maltiness, hazelnut, toasty, lightly fruity, a mild bitterness and a dry finish.

It's my go-to beer. A local bar has it on tap for $3 and you can't go wrong with that.

Great appearance. Nice clear brown poor with a frothy just off white head. Aroma of slight roast malt. Flavour is subtle, just a hint of hazelnut no more. Taste is great with a superb smoothness. Feels just a little watery and thin. Easily drinkable.
Pours red brown with a white head, Aroma is brown and nuts, Taste syrupy and a nutty finish.

On tap at Rogue Distillery & Public House in Portland. Clear deep brown with a thin tan head. Nutty toasty aroma with vanilla. Sweet vanilla and hazelnut taste. Not bad.

Draught @ Rogue Ales Public House, San Francisco, CA
Pours slightly hazy amber/brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, nuts and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Nutty and sweet brown ale, with a smooth malty finish. None of the bitter dark beet taste.
Dark but fairly clear in colour. Nice smell of chocolate. Smooth nutty and chocolate flavours immediately like a liquid version of swedish candy "nötkräm". One of my favorites.

wow! so much nuttiness! just tasty hazelnuts everywhere... appears clear, deep brown with a nice bit of lingering froth... body is bigger than i expected and finish is quite firm. low carbonation.
a cracker

On tap. Formerly a favorite of mine; still one of the better widely available brown ales around. Minimal nuttiness in the nose; palate holds far more hazelnuts as it warms. Thin body, mediocre appearance, and a touch too much carb. Meh :/
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 Fra fad på Søernes Ølbar: lite aroma, kortvarig skum, dessertaktig smak og kort ettersmak. Tydelig smak av hasselnøtt med karakter, blød og rund. Melkesjokolade.

Aroma: Roasted nuts
Appearance: Pours dark walnut brown with a tan/white head
Taste: medium bitterness
Palate: medium body, average carbonation, short bitter (like walnuts) finish

My current favorite brown ale. Enjoyed several on an unseasonably cool day while grilling. Paired very well with BBQ fare.

Draft offering..good caramel color..nose of nuts..roasted malts..natural peanut butter..mouthfeel is dominated by hazelnuts..light body..fairly smooth and goes down quite easy..not the biggest fan of the style..but alright..

Bottled sample at Charcut in Calgary. Light brown with a strong note if hazelnut. Well hopped. Very interesting taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A- Pours a partially hazy brown/coppery color and doesn't appear to have a whole ton of bubbly carbonation rising to the top. The head is somewhat disappointing though, as it is rather shallow to begin with and the tan colored foam disappears rather quickly into a skirmish of bubbly patchwork. The lacing is also not as good as I thought it would be, as some patchy clumps of head do cling to the side of my pint glass but slide right back into the brew. 

S- The aromas are quite nice, there being a noticeable rich malty scent with sweet cooked brown sugar mixed into the background. The hazelnut is there too, but it isn't the overpowering aroma that I thought there might be....just subtle essence! I also notice a slightly yeasty aroma the really helps smooth out any bitter notes that there are on the finish.

T- The flavors follow the aroma closely and very well! Again, rich caramel sweet malt is the dominant flavor with a hint of milk chocolate and toasted brown sugar. There is an Earthy nuttiness that compliments the sweetness overall on the palate and helps to add a mellow dryness to the beer. The finish is a blend of lingering hazelnut and bitter hops. Very nice indeed!

M- This has a very smooth character, with very creamy carbonation hitting the palate. This is a medium-full bodied beer and is probably one of the most well rounded beers a person will come across I believe! This really is a brown nectar and is like velvet desert on the palate!

D- Outside of the initial appearance, this beer has it all! It is full flavored and very well balanced with the hazelnut flavor at just the right amount, the alcohol is essentially non-existent, and is so sleek on the palate. I will most definitely purchase this again and highly recommend this beer! Rouge has put their spin on the brown ale style and more than hit a home run with this!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours like Pepsi with a sodakeg head. Bubbly and the head fades fast. Faint aroma of malt and nuts. Taste is choco-hazelnut and slightly floral-sweet honey nectar. The linger is rich and nutty. Slightly flat as expected in a brown ale. Great-tasting and warmly invites you to have another. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle. Pours a clear deep copper, with a moderate off-white head, which lasts reasonably well but does not leave much lacing. Hazelnut, mild milk chocolate malt and light floral and fruity hops notes make up the aroma. Fruity, slightly spicy hops up front lead into a smooth praline-like blend of hazelnut and chocolate in the mid-palate. The hazelnut lasts into the finish, where it combines with more fruity hops. This is an interesting take on an English-style brown ale, and an enjoyable session ale.
Dark amber, highly carbonated, not much hazelnut taste, crisp, a little on the dry side

On tap @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo.Mild, nut aromas. Pours copper, some hazy, with nice off-white head, persistent. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is mild, smooth, dried fruits, some caramel, sweet, pleasant. Enjoyable.
It does what it says on the label. Lovely sweet nutty nectar; rounded and full of soft flavours. This would go perfect as a float over a natural vanilla ice cream.

Light to medium brown with thin white head. Aroma is strong and sugary, like glazed/candied hanzelnuts, a little toast in the background. Taste is very similar, very light on the palate for a brown ale. This one is a little too sweet for me, I could use more hops.

2/3 of apint at Brewdog Newcastle. Dark brown, tan head. Hazelnet aroma, surprise surprise. Chocolate hazelnut and vanilla flavour, velvety texure. Really delicious. It was served a bit too cold though, and got better as the chill wore off. Minor quibble though, Excellent beer.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2013 Nutty aroma and taste, quite creamy and smooth. Thin head, I quite liked it. Could drink quite a few of these.

I really was disappointed in this, Id bet that on a blind taste youd not get hazelnut. Perhaps I was expecting "boom" but I didnt get that. For me, and me alone, then this isnt a good beer, and Im rather disappointed. Im always worried about being the nay-sayer, but Rogue really do good beers well this wast it, and a fair few of you like it, so it must be me :-)
Bottle from a friend. Very noticeable aroma of hazelnuts, also some caramel. Very interesting beer, like drinking a dessert.

0,33 l bottle as a gift.
Poured amber colored with a medium tan creamy head. Aroma of malt and fruity yeasts, some molasses, and the hazelnut, some chestnut, nutmeg with some rum and cocoa. Smells like the famous Hungarian "Sport szelet". Medium bodied ale with caramel, some herbs and the hazelnut again. Interesting brew;-)

355ml bottle; 6% abv

Dark brown with good white head that dissipates slowly, dark red when held to light. Vague aroma (hay fever not helping me), beautiful nutty tones, medium carbonation, oily on the palate. 

Really good ale, I'll be picking up a few more bottles of this soon.

Dark but fairly clear in colour. Nice smell of chocolate. Smooth nutty and chocolate flavours immediately. One of my favorites.

Quality from Rogue. This hazelnut brown may not be my cup of tea, but it is a very solid brew. Malty, hazelnut (a big hazelnut). Doesnt linger.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Dark brown color, but not much of a head. Aroma is hazelnut and caramel. Taste is hazelnut and chocolate. Very nice taste.

Chilled bottle. Dark brown, not much head. Hazelnut smell is very inviting. Reminds me of nutella or something similar. Taste and body is watery. Hazelnut flavour is nice but its a bit artificial tasting - it tastes very much like a beer flavoured with hazelnut rather than a balanced and well blended beer. 650mL bottle, 6% Bought this to clear some room on the shelves, as I am not a huge brown ale fan. Dark brown pour with a weak bubbly tan foam that disappears quickly. Aroma is strong roast malts, hint of nutty sweetness. Taste is bold hazelnutty sweetness, dominant roast malt, low hop character with a slightly bitter finish that is quite pleasant. Impressive.
Bottle from Rogue market Stall in Portland, Oregon. Pours dark brown red with an off white head. Aroma is obviously hazelnut, caramel, malt, sweetness and cream. Taste is sweet but not too bitter.
Bottle from Hawkeyes. Poured lighter brown with fine beige head. Light aroma of hazelnut and other nutty notes. Quite smooth. Tastes kind of light with some hazelnut.

Bottle at Banquet Night, AHA Philadelphia 6/29/2013 
A bit sweet with lots of toffee caramel and chocolate with a nice touch of hazelnut .

six pack from Capones. Pours dark brown that has reddish lucency/hue when held to light. Slight head that fades to tan ring. Aroma is dough, hazelnut, caramel, malt. Flavor is hazelnut, toffee, roast coffee, chewy/bready maltiness, simple syrup (not too cloying). Medium bodied. One of my favorite "go-to" beers because of the richness and complexity of flavors and the modest ABV. Rogues finest year-round achievement.
Like drinking unsweetened iced coffee! Amazing nutty flavor and a tan head to die for.

Sweet nutty hazelnut aroma. Reddish Brown color. Flavor is pretty sweet, the hazelnut dominates. Very thin bodied. Overall a very enjoyable beer but a little sweet.

Sweet, nutty malt nose, which forms the backbone of the flavor profile with lots of chocolate and vanilla notes and un-shy use of hazelnut. My standard bearer for a nut brown ale.  Dark brown minimal head.  Toasted malts, caramel, and toasted nuts.  Flavor follows with plush body and nice hazelnut sweetness.
Bottle.  Nutty chocolate malt aroma.  Chestnut with large tan head.  Sweet hazelnut and chocolate caramel malt flavor.  Mildly bitter herbal finish.  Nice body.
Keg at west 50, Ontario, 3rd may 2013. This was great and mad a good break from the IPAs, pleasant well presented beer, with a nice hazelnut taste, not too sweet

Pours a clear light brwon brew with a tiny beige head with poor retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate to low bitter with hazelnut, caramek ans chocolate, medium to light bodied, flavor is moderate sweet and moderatw to low bitter, bitter sweet finish.

The appearance of this beer is a brownish red color with a small off-white head that dissipates to a thin layer on top of the liquid, and the aroma is nutty with hints of roasted malts. The taste is mildly sweet, slightly umami, and a touch bitter; furthermore, the palate combines a medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation, and an abrupt finish.

Deep chestnut brown beer with foamy light brown head. Nose is malty sweet with a subtle hint of nuts. Taste is rich with a profound sweetness up front, which is then immediately counterbalanced by a medium bitterness. The sweetness lingers through the hops to create a rich, full flavored aftertaste. This is not a complex beer as there are only really two notes, but those two notes are deeply satisfying, especially if you like a well rounded sweetness to your beer. I really like this.
Delightfully nutty aroma, some candy, sweets and malts. Taste is explosive hazelnuts, with a malty but also slightly hoppy finish. Very good brew, takes some time to get use to but very nice.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours a dark red-brown with a decent one inch head that lasts.  Taste is of hazelnut, vanilla, malt, caramel, chocolate and coffee.  Similar aroma.  Has a creamy, smooth body and a dry finish.  Easy to drink and enjoyable.
On tap. Brown colour with tan head. Hazelnut, caramel and malt aroma. Sweet caramel taste, with hints of hazelnut. Light body.

Chestnut brown, head settles to a tan residue on the liquid. Pronounced hazelnut aroma. Hints of coffee and grain. Flavour is fantastic, sweet nuttiness, light sweet malt, more hazelnut, highlights of vanilla, underscored with coffee. Slightly oily mouthfeel, though nice and light. Carbonation is lively. Mellow nutty finish. Top notch.

Gift bottle. Pours brown with an inch of khaki foam which leaves a bit of lacing. Nice hazelnut on the nose. The flavor is prevalent on the tongue as well. Its nicely balanced and tastes natural. Clean finish. Nice!

Poured from a bottle into glass. Reddish dark brown pour with an off white head that dissipates quick. Smell is dominated by hazelnut, banana, spices. Taste is more of that hazelnut flavor with some light coffee and chocolate. Lots of roasted malts here. The hazelnut tastes almost like Its a flavored coffee. Eh.

330ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours a clear reddish brown with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is strong hazelnut with a little caramel - not hugely complex, but still very pleasant. Taste is a strong chocolatey and nutty sweetness with a certain degree of saltiness to it, assuming thats coming from the nuts. Almost like drinking nutella, or something along those lines. Sweet aftertaste. A little light on body for my liking. Very unique and tasty beer, would recommend it to anybody to try.
Tap at Watering Hole, Tokyo. Brown colour with a small tan head. Sweet hazelnut, caramel aroma. Flavour is nuts, rum raisin, caramel, plum.

Bottle from albatross, also shared with czar. Pours a ruby-reddish brown with a very short lasting beige head. Aroma is caramel and hazelnut. Flavor is honey, golden malt, caramel, and, without any surprise, hazelnut. Some fine bitterness. Light body, bordering on watery mouthfeel. Im gonna paraphrase my friend and co-taster czar on this one : meh.

Enjoyable hazelnut flavor, nice dark coloring, head disappears immediately. I will definitely try again.

Bottle. Clear amber with a cream head. Aroma is nutty chocolate. Flavour is roast malt, nutty, creamy texture. Overall a bit like an Easter egg.

bottle shared by albatross, thanks! pours clear copper-red with a dissipating off-white head. nutty, hazelnut, spices, hint of vanilla, cake-style, toasted and caramel malts, some grassy-spicy hops for a relatively short finish. average carbonation, light body - watery. this brew cheats a little with hazelnut extract - overdone nutty aroma and taste. meh.

Poured into a mug. Color is a rusty brown/orange, with about one finger of thin beige head which disappears rather quickly. Aroma is sweet, and malty, with slight notes of sweet nuttiness, and a hint of bread. Taste is malty, and mildly sweet, followed by a mild bitterness. The palate medium bodied, with a slick texture. This particular bottle doesnt taste as good as some that Ive drank in the past, I think it might be too old. Fantastic beer though, and its only got 5.6% ABV, which means I can (and am) drinking it before work. You cant beat that!
Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Pours an hazy brown to red, aroma of hazelnut cake, cinnamon and chocolate chips, flavor of malt, nuts, pretty watery

Pours is a red tinged dark brown, med-large head that settles quickly. Smells chocolate, nuts of the hazel kind and malts. Tastes chocolate, malt and hazelnut flavouring, some coffee maybe too. Easy to drink.
Draft at Crunchys (from backlog).  Deep brown with slightly tan head. Smells of malt and hazelnuts.  Big toffee and hazelnut flavors with some malt at the end.

Pours dark brown.  Aroma of hazelnut, toffee, flavor is not quite what I expected.....in a good way.  I expected a taste of artificial hazelnut flavour and its not there.  Excellent.  Coffee, chocolate & roasted nuts.  I still expect more, but not a bad beer by any means.  Thins out a bit quickly and gets "dry" near the end.
Pours a nice hazelnut brown. Toasty, bready aromas. Nutty, toasty and malty flavours. Bitter, nutty finish. I enjoyed this one.
22oz bomber. Pours clear brown with a creamy white head. Aroma is sweet and nutty, almonds, and hazelnuts. Taste is overpoweringly hazelnut, very sweet with some toffee and caramel malt.
The name of the beer tells you exactly what you can expect to taste from this beer. My favorite of all time.

There IS a God!

Appearance: When I first cracked the bottle open, suds spewed everywhere as if I had popped champagne. Not a great first impression, but I quickly forgave it. I poured it in a glass and got a nice and creamy tan head, and a beer with a deep brown color. Nice.

Smell: Heavy malts, caramel, and obviously, hazelnut. Theres no hop presence in the smell or taste with this one, I can say that right now. Thats to be expected though.

Taste/feel: Its just what youd expect from a quality hazelnut flavored beer. It has a nice, deep, rich hazelnut and malt flavor. The aftertaste consists of coffee and maybe even some chocolate in the background. Pretty complex, and pretty damn delicious as well. The feel suits the beer well -- medium carbonation and feel, making this an easy drinking beer.

My taste buds liked Hazelnut Brown from Sam Adams, so I decided to try this one out, and I couldnt be happier with that choice ... suddenly one of my favorite beers. I dont think I could drink more than one pint in a session, but good lord this is fantastic for "desserty beer" fans.

Pours a deep hazy brown with a bit of white head. Smell is slightly sweet with a hint of citrus hops and side good nuttiness. Palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied with good carbonation. Taste is a bit of a miss. Sweet at first before balancing with some good bitterness. Aftertaste is slightly strange with rotated bitterness and something a bit strange.

Bottle. Not sure of the age. Pours an opaque reddish-brown. Minimal head. Smells of sweet malt and very much like hazelnuts (reminds me of Nutella, natch). Nutty, bready, sweet caramel. Slight astringency. Finishes drier than expected. Not full-bodied like I thought it would be. Nonetheless a pretty solid beer.

Reviewed 2/20/13. 12 oz bottle into a nonic pint glass.

A: Pours a dark chestnut color. The head is a one finger light mocha shade featuring a good texture, but not much retention.

S: Strongly nutty - not just in terms of hazelnut, but other variants like almonds, walnuts, and pecans come through. Aromatically, its pretty much just peanut butter-esque with not much else to give any other depth. But that one note? Its extremely inviting and enjoyable.

T: Much sweeter than the aroma, and veering dangerously to artificial in terms of how it comes off. The flavor profile is hazelnut...and thats about it. Decidedly one note, and that solitary note has flaws to it. I dont hate it by any stretch, though.

M: The general texture is kind of thin and even insubstantial. Despite that, theres a lot of coarse finishing astringency that comes off slightly clashing with the sweetness and limp body. Hell, it even manages to be both watery AND sugary in its finish. Only thing it does right here is ease of drinkability.

O: Not particularly likable aside from the aroma; Im glad I only bought a single of these and wouldnt buy it again. Having said that, its a good choice for hazelnut lovers - because lets face it, the flavor is nothing BUT that. If this and Frangelic Mountain Brown have taught me anything, its that hazelnut beers give off great aromatic qualities...and not so great flavor profiles.

This beer needs to be fresh or it falls apart to some funky flavors. Tastes like a malty nut brown with hazlenut flavor. The noble hops come through in flavor and aroma subtly firm. Excellent beer when fresh, even though the ideaof flavoring in a beer ddoesnt excite me

The beautiful dark brown beer has a very thick creamy head. The aroma reminds me of cookies. It has a sharp smokey flavor which is tempered with a hint of sweetness.

Great aroma, with a nutty slightly sweet note that fades to pure hazelnut.  Stands up to strong flavors & rich food.

Did the bald fella win the award for champion brown ale? I like his beard although he clearly cant keep his beer in the mug. Malty and sweet (Im onto the beer now) and it tastes good (Gruffalo style). I once saw Neneh Cherry perform in lingerie and waders. It was a pretty special moment.
Bottle pours amber-brown with a thin tan head. The hazelnut is noticeable in the aroma, and very present in the palate. The malts are sweet and rich. Full bodied, rich, and smooth.

Pours dark brown with a tint of ruby red. Small off-white foamy head. Smells  very sweet and nutty. Almost like a Reese's peanut butter cup. Very mild, mellow flavor. Dark brown pour with caramel white head.  Sweet caramel malt aroma. Lovely malt notes. Oh so sweet. A great brown.

Forte attaque de noisettes légèrement caramélisées. Très légère amertume qui reste peu en bouche. Elle accompagnera très bien une pintade rôtie.

Poured a clear mahogany color with a thin light tan head. Aroma is nuts, vanilla, caramel, and not much else. Very subdued smell. Taste is chocolate, nuts, caramel, coffee, smoke, and a bittersweet finish.
Poured a medium brown with a snall off white head, Aroma is hugely nutty. Medium body, flavour of nuts and dark chocolate.coffee.

From bottle. Pours a brown colour with tannish head and lots of lines of lacing. Aroma is nutty, honey, a touch of chocolate milk, Im getting a little cola too. Tastes like honey, nuts, bitter, a bit dry.

Rather good. Sweeter than expected, nicely nutty, very tasty. The guy on the front is my mate Franco. He worked for Lynne Jones but when she retired he seemed to aswell. Problem is that hes only 37. I think thats a little early for retirement, but Im probably simply jealous.
An excellent Hazelnut Brown ale. Pours a dark brown. Starts very nutty in flavor and ends with a rich chocolate taste that lingers. Aroma of brown sugar.

A nice finger of head on a reddish/brown colored body.
The aroma is burnt coffee, caramel candy and a little milk chocolate. Pretty good.
The taste is smooth with coffee and milk, burnt malt and nuts,
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
Get some, its good.
We didnt like this at all.  Very nice nut flavor but quickly overwhelmed by this sweet, acidic yuck taste.  One of our least favorite beers!  Use caution before buying!  You have been warned!

Draft at Beer Temple.  Pours clear brown with an off white head.  Aroma is dominated by the hazelnut, along with fudge, toffee and malt.  Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.  This is really good, the best nut beer Ive tried yet.

Amazingly, I havent rated this.  Ive had every Rogue available in town, visited the brewery - but never tried this one.  Probably because I dont like browns generally... anyway: amber-brown pour with thin off-white.  Aroma is nutty brown sugar.  Tastes are toffee, chocolate, nuts.  Yeah, not my style.
Bottle at brew, bangkok. Hazy reddish brown color, smooth white head. Aroma of hazelnuts, malts and some hops. Nice taste with hazelnuts, some hops, sweetness, smooth finish.

Pours a deep chestnut brown. Hazelnut is the dominant aroma. Hazelnut is also the dominant taste but not too sweet. Very nice balance until it warms toward room temperature, then an overbearing sweetness does takes over. If youre like me and dont like sweet beers, try to keep the temp below 50-55.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Pours murky brown with white film. Very dominant hazelnut aroma, nutty, nut cake. Tastes sweet, like Monin nut syrup, malty undertones. Medium body, smooth texture, muddy finish. I love it. (9/3/8/3/13=3.6) Draught at Gaspar, Madrid, 27.2.2015. Hazy brown with white head. Nutty, some bubblegum, chestnuts and marzipan aroma, marzipan, pecan and tahini sauce in the mouth. Full-bodied, long, pecan, hazelnut marzipan finish. 8/3/9/4/15 - glad to see I still love it!
Fantastic flavor for a smaller brewery that should get more respect. Price line is a little high but worth it when craving a QUALITY nut brown.
650 ml bottle. Pours a red mahogany with light head. Aromas of cereal, nuts, and toasted malt. Similar flavor with the addition of vanilla and grass. Nice enough.

Excellent brown ale with a vanilla Finnish.  Sweet and smooth. Unlike any brown ale I have ever tried.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Murky brown. Cookie-ish aroma with hazelnuts and chocolate. Sweet flavor, rather sugary, with unpleasant artificial hazelnut extract (like you put in coffee), malt, caramel and a bit of metallic hints. Light to medium-bodied. Smells nice, tastes not as nice.

Bottle for Ninas Edinburgh [260113]
Chestnut brown, clear, off white frothy head, good lacing
Aroma - Massive nut aroma with some sweet caramel malts underneath, its obviously a powerful essence added to the brew. OK initially then becomes unpleasant and awful
Taste - Smooth caramel malts with nut essence, dab of scorched  butter, powerful nut flavouring essence, has an artificial tinge. Get worse with the drinking - the underlying malty beer is pretty dull with the nut essence that gets more artificial. Gets undrinkable pretty quickly.
Palate - Soft carb, fairly thin for 6%. Finish is rapid, just left with a bit of that awful hazelnut linger.
Overall - Lots of people seem to love it. Well im in the minority that thinks its garbage. Another mans nectar is another ones poison. Only good point is the appearance in the glass. Straight down the sink.

Im not a hop head, so I tend to gravitate towards the maltier beers. This one gave me pause because I wasnt sure about the hazelnut flavor. Im happy to report that my fears were unfounded! The people @ Rogue nailed this one. The smell reminds me of when I pass those candied nut booths at the fair with the hazelnut hitting me like a truck! The head was short-lived like many Browns. The taste is wonderfully balanced with malty sweetness, followed by the hazelnut, and finishing with just the right amount of hoppy bitterness. Ill be drinking this one again!

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Only had 2oz worth  at world beer festival January 2013 Columbia,SC,, very heavy hazelnut flavor and smell!  X2 almost 4 years later with full glass: smell is heavy peanut butter, taste is light peanut butter...Smoothes out a lot with time...Very malty and medium heavy on palate...At FS for Kala, Patrick and Brittani HH for their new positions

36cl, at 5.6%Vol (from extra small sticker), as Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar, American brew, with hazelnuts, from Saveur Bière Lille, not complex brew, malty/sweet and slightly roasted/woody, yet balanced, hazy, good head, nice brew, yet expensive!

On tap at slaters 50/50.  Pours a medium brown, very thin with no head. Not much aroma to speak of, taste is a run of the mill brown ale with a hint of the hazelnut, caramel and little hop.  Just ok.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Brown beer with a dark cream head. Malt and light caramel aroma. Nutty malt flavor with light caramel. Medium bodied. Caramel and nutty malt lingers with light backing hops.
Lite with a nutty hint... drinkable but with a less than ideal aroma. No lingering after taste. Mediocre for Rogue
Draft. Brown roasted nuts. A little caramel, coffee and some chocolate in there too. Pretty decent beer overall.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 Drank this as Rogue Morimoto Hazelnut but apprently the same recipe. Lovely beer and my first Rogue beer.

Pours medium brown with red highlights.  Starts with big tan head that shrunk pretty quickly as I drank it. Smell is candied roasted nuts. Taste is hazelnut with sweetness that is almost toffee like. Malt notes come in rhe fromt with he sweetness with only a slight, pleasant, bitterness that doesn't hang around.  Overall a very pleasant beer that I was afraid may seem too sweet as I emptied the glass but never crosses the line.  The hazelnut and malt flavor seemed to be in perfect balance with the sweetness.  Great for style and food for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: brown beer with no carbonation and really small foam. Smell: malt, nuts, wheat, caramel. Taste: malt, caramel, nuts and wheat. Aftertaste: rye bread, nuts.
Pours light brown with a slightly tanned head. Smooth, nutty aroma, with hints of caramel. Medium mouthfeel, some lacing. Nice taste. This one is very enjoyable!

First pint after a keg change at a snow resort. Lucky. And it was worth an extra wait to change kegs. Pint- thick head,creamy/fluffy, leaves some lacing,very clear darkish red/brown.
 Has a dusty/nutty aroma with  sweet toffee/caramel possibly chocolate,maybe a very slight hint of roast.
 Taste is smooth,quite drinkable,with a nice balance of caramel,mild chocolate,slight roast, somewhat creamy smooth oatlike,mild  dusty-earthy nuttyness,finishes with citrus and pine in the bittering. Better than expected.Freshness of a new tap helps.
Dark red with a tan head. Moderate carbonation, but poor head retention.  Very nutty, almond and hazlenut shells, smokey. Slight chocolate.

Roasty. Pretty light mouthfeel, but good substantial flavor. Good hazelnut aroma and finish. Overall a good, sessionable, brown. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma is nutty with a flavor to match.Very good brown ale.

Bottle shared by Shaun.Chestnut coloured pour with a small off white head.Immediate aromas of hazelnut and coffee.Hazelnut coming through strong in the taste with the roast coffee and some chocolate and caramel notes.Enjoyable sweetish brew.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013 Pours a nice brown nutty color with a foamy head with a pleasing aroma. Taste is full and malty with nice nutty overtones. Mouthfeel is lacking on my palate, as this ale seems a little more thin and watery then I usually enjoy. Overall this is a good brown ale although not as good as Samuel Smithss Nut Brown Ale.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2013 Nice hazlenut aroma. Pours with a light brown head. There is a light nutty flavor. This has an excellent taste.

355ml bottle with no freshness dates. Pours clear dark ruby red with a small cream colored head. Disappears quickly. Aroma is hazelnut, creamy coffee, oreos and some biscuity malt. Taste is caramelly malt, hazelnut and earthy hops. Slightly roasty aftertaste. Medium carbonation, mouthfeel is crisp. The base of the beer is nowhere nearly strong enough to carry all the essence. Not for me.

Chestnut pour with a moderate off-white head. Aroma: hops, malt, hazelnut, wet cardboard, smoked woodchip, raisin. Taste: sweet from the chocolaty malt, hazelnut and fruit. Slightly hoppy and smoky bitterness. 

Very nice.

Deep brown pour, with nutty scent rising above the malt. Flavor is of malt, with a hint of hazelnut. Very well done nut flavor, not over the top like most drinks with nuts. Additional flavor of a tinge of caramel. Great mouthfeel and palate, very consistent throughout.

Deep mahogany in color, with an off-white head that sticks to glass. Nutty, toast, roast, caramel, and malt in the aroma. Medium-bodied, average carbonation. Not overly sweet, malty, but fininishing dry and nutty. Very nice, not cloying at all. Quite drinkable.

Draft at lucky lab. Pours clear brown with a small off white head. The aroma has nuts and some caramel. The taste has tons of hazelnuts and a good bit of coffee notes. This is just as good as frangelic mountain brown for a third of the price.
Bottle poured a clear light brown w/ small off-white head. Light malty aroma. Initial flavor is a moderate sweet, tastes are amaretto, almond, and hazelnut.
Brown pour with a tan head. Nutty and caramel aroma. Very balanced, much less sweet than I expected (and thats a good thing). Flavors of malt, hazelnut, caramel. Finishes with coffee/chocolate.

On draft at Bilbo Baggins in Alexandria.

The beer is brown with an inch or so of head. Smells of hazelnut, nuts, malt, vanilla, sugar. Pretty sweet, so one pint is plenty. Nice flavor. Im a huge fan of hazelnuts / hazelnut flavor, and this beer delivers. Well balanced and tasty, although a bit sweet. Still, a solid effort, and Im a sucker for hazelnuts. I enjoy having this every now and again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-13-2011
Pours dark amber with a small brown head.  A little hazelnut on the aroma.  The nuttiness and a bit of toffee become apparent as it warms up a bit.  A little bittersweetness on the finish.  Nice.
Bomber.  Pours brown with a thick cream head.  Aroma is coffee, hazelnut, and nuts.  Flavor is the same with nice roastiness.  Very nice brown ale.

Dark brown opaque pour. Medium to thick khaki head. Sweet specialty malt aroma. Similar to an Oktoberfest.  Light to medium mouthfeel. Roasty malt flavor with a nice balance of hazelnut. Mildly bitter finish. 

---Rated via iPhone

Unique aroma and taste with hints of coffee and hazelnut (hell, its in the name).  

A dark coffee brown color, with visible carbonation, and a thin, light brown head. 

I drop a few points for taste and overall due to liking my beer to taste like beer, not coffee.

Aroma with hints of hazelnut and coffee. Nutty flavor and slight bitterness at the end. Medium body with copper color. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is nutty, large hazelnut notes. Appearnce is a beautiful golden brown, two-finger beige head. Taste is light to start, typical brown ale flavor, finishes nicely with a hazelnut and bitter flavor. Mouthfeel is average. Overall, Im a bit disappointed, I was expecting more flavor, overall.

Bought a bottle after many of my friends told me very good things about this. It has lived up to expectations. Good strong hazelnut taste. Lovely nutty aroma, with a nice thin lacy head. Good body to this, definitely buying again. Have a bottle of Shakespeare oatmeal stout waiting for me :)
On tap WJ Kavanaghs Dublin. Pours dark brown with no head or lacing. Nice hazelnut aroma. Thin but balanced mouthfeel. Hazelnut chocolate taste without being cloying. Nutty finish. Very drinkable

Great beer, well balanced. Tastes very clean, subtle nut and malt flavors dance on your palate. Another solid outing from rogue. ..I wasnt expecting it to be as good, most nutty brown ales take the nutty flavor too far.this is just right.
Bottle at bar. Brown color, white head. Sweet, malty taste with nuts, caramel, almond and honey. Very nice speciality ale.

Single bottle. Clear, dark brown pour with a small creamy head. Mostly roasted malt in the aroma, with some caramel and hazelnut. Flavor is roasted malts, then a big rush of toasted nuts - maybe a little too artificial. A little on the sweet side, too. Good, not great.

Pours murky brown, thin head with little lacing.  Aroma is hazelnut, malty and I think I noticed a bit of licorice.  Taste started off malty and fairly sweet and finished with a nice hazelnut flavor that lingered.  On the palate its thick and very creamy.

The new Morimoto  Hazelnut Signature Ale bottle. A great session brown ale with a big roasted malt and nutty malt note. Light chocolate and hazelnuts bountiful.  Big and robust roast for a brown ale. A medium hop finish with a mild drying of the palate. Rich toffee, caramel, chocolate and big nuts. Well done.

12 ounce bottle. Reddish brown color topped by a thick rocky tan head. Toasted malt aroma with an obvious hazelnut prescence. Nutty malt flavor with a touch of sweet  cocoa. Nice malty backdrop that is balanced by a wonderful complex hoppiness. Everything works so well together. Spicy, nutty hop finish and aftertaste. Very well done.

Rusty Bucket, Dayton, OH, draft. Very flat. No carbonation. No head, no lacing. Very malty. Very hazelnutty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Medium brown appearance with little aroma although the nutty smell can be captured. The hazelnut notes are very noticeable and gentle to the palette. Overall a very good nutty brown. Cheers!

355ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours a beautiful copper to cherry colour with a nicely proportioned lacy head. The nose is of chocolate or more specifically toffee and theres definitely a nuttiness in the background. The taste is of more praline notes. Theres also a creaminess as it develops on the palate. The palate is medium to full bodied with a big creamy texture though the finish is just a little cloying. Overall, good beer though slightly too rich.
I did not care for this. Overwhelming hazelnut. Too sweet. Too much spice. Too much hazelnut. Overpowering to the point of unpleasantness
Pours clear brown with smells of hazelnut and malty brown. Taste was overpowering on the artificial hazelnut flavor, just too much for me.

Pours a medium brown color, with a thick creamy tan head that leaves good lacing. Smells of hazelnut, roasted malt, chocolate and caramel. Tastes of all the same smells but the hazelnut and chocolate are the most prevalent. Palate is light and creamy with awesome carbonation and a dry finish. This is one of my favorite Rogue beers, its very unique and a great nut brown ale.

Quality, as expected from Rogue. Good, warm aroma of nut brown ale; pours black/deep brown with a fluffy head that dissipates fairly quickly. Roasted brown ale flavor; I found the hazelnut subtle, not overwhelming. Some chocolate notes. Very easy to drink. (10/20/12 @home)

Pours clear brown with a quickly disapating head.  Nutty aroma with mocha and malt aromas.  Coffee, chocolate, nut, and sweet malty flavors.  Nice creamy mouthfeel.  Medium body and carbonation.  A very tasty brown... Paired well with Belgain waffles.

Bottled. Pours a dark reddish mahogany with a finger of creamy head. The nose is sweet and has a nutty smell with bananas, chocolatey; almost like banana nut bread. Taste is very pleasant with roasted malts, hazelnut, caramel, and toffee. This was an extremely pleasant brew.
Brown, mahogny. Nose is sweetish nutty, like nutella bread spread. Some vanilla, milkchocolate. Malts. Body is lightish, full of hazelnut, some oak. Very tasty brown ale.-- bb/h

Pours medium brown. Smell is nutty. Dryer than expected, but very good hazelnut notes. Finish lingers in a way that I don't like. A bit of a stale adtertaste. Overall a decent brown.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at UnionAle, Santa Barbara CA. Brown/black pour with a trace amount of cola-colored head. Smells like molasses and fresh bread, good scent but faint. Light mouth feel with low carbonation. Watery but bold coffee flavor, hazelnut flavor for sure. Finish is light and clean, a little bitter and sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg at Brewdog, Camden, London. A copper coloured pour with a small beige head on top. Sweet, nutty aroma. Tastes nutty, rich, malty, almost creamy. Very nice drop.

355ml bottle @ Rotterdam, Helsinki. Poured light brown, somewhat unclear with a thin head. Very nutty aroma, sweet toffee and vanilla. Flavor has hazelnuts, toffee and milk chocolate cookies. Long nutty finish that lingers forever. Light bitterness. Velvety smooth. Wow, more of this please!
Very palatable beer this. Strong aroma of roasted nuts. On the palate this continues with a lovely earthy nut backbone which finished with a mild bitterness. Very mild smooth and enjoyable!

On tap at Brewdog Camden. It pours a clear copper colour with a smallbeige head. Aroma is nutty and malty. Aroma is sweet with similar flavours, mostly toffee and hazelnuts. It reminds me of my Wawa coffee, love it. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation. Overall, a brown ale as base beer, but not much more in common with the style. Difficult to cathegorize, but a pleasant beer.

Smells like something Im not normally allowed to have but im glad that im not allergic to fermented or cooked nuts. Hazy brown hue medium head. Malty but notes of what I believe nuts to taste like haha. Good overall.

Pours a dark brown color with a small amount of head that lingers a bit.  Huge hazelnut aroma mixed with sweet molasses and chocolate.  Taste is rich and nutty with a hint of chocolate.  I thought it would be sweeter based on the aroma but there is only a slight sweetness.  Slightly floral and grassy hops come through a bit in the finish along with some spicines.  Mouthfeel is a bit thin but it makes this easy drinking.  Very little bitterness.  This is about as good a brown ale as youre going to find.

Had on tap in a pint glass.

Poured a slightly hazy reddish brown with barely any head. This I attribute to it being served in an extremely cold glass.

Nuts immediately on the nose along with some milk chocolate and toast. Honestly it smells almost exactly like Nutella.

Flavor carries over more of the milk chocolate and nuts along with some biscuit and toast. Maybe some caramel and toffee thrown in there too. Bitterness is moderate and the finish is clean. Really not too sweet at all.

Overall, an extremely enjoyable beer and one that would be great with dessert. Its great that it is not too sweet with the presence of the chocolate and hazelnut. One I need to have more often.

Great smell of hazelnut that dominates. The taste is equally strong of the nut. There is head that goes away shortly after the pouring. Very interesting ale, all that is needed during a winters afternoon.

Aroma is a sweet Carmel malty butterscotch. Pours a brown with a little haze small head no lacing. Taste is very sweet  Carmel butterscotch with some coffee and maybe some toffee. Very clean. The beer taste is great however the appearance and aroma is not much there. Very good.

Shared a big brown bottle into a schooner glass, thanks gregwilsonstl! It poured a mostly clear red-tinged medium brown color with moderate beige foam and good Belgian lace. Surprisingly weak aroma: just a hint of caramel, hazelnuts, almost no hops or yeast aspects. Strong flavors came across, though: complex malt bill, caramelized brown sugar, husky grains, burnt toast, strong nutty/tannin-y tastes from the hazelnuts. Light-medium body. Well-rounded, chewy mouthfeel. Overall, not very bready or fruity. Definitely an extremely dry interpretation of "English nut brown ale." Good not great.
Very nutty. Smells toasty and of roast hazelnut. Thinnish flavour but full of hazelnut flavour.

Tap (The new place thats a sister pub to the Euston Tap, London)
Slightly diacetyl sweet treacle pudding aroma. Butter vanilla tracle indulgence. A bit too sweet, but still very pleasant.

Bottle.  No head and spare lacing.  Inviting dark brown and cloudy.  Nice lightly roasted nutty start and finished fantastic with smooth chocolate malt taste. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Petites bouteilles au pluriel et quelque grosses. Superbe bière brune avec une mousse brune pâle. Le nez est facile avec des notes de noisette, café, chocolat, noix et de malt grillé. Le tout est très odorant. La bouche est quelque peu sucrée, il y a des saveurs de café irlandais ou brésilien, de noix et de noisette. La longueur est moyenne et la finale sur des notes de malt grillé très agréable.

I love the smell of this beer but the appearance makes it less appealing. When poured from a bottle there is almost no head or lacing but it has a nice dark brown color. Taste is nutty and a bit sharp at the start. It is somewhat smooth and creamy but not too heavy which is perfect for this kind of beer. This is one I really enjoy drinking,  especially this time of year.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 Bottled. It’s aroma was nutty with slight vanilla coffee bean. It pours dark brown with a medium head. The taste is perfect has just the right amount of Hazelnut and nectar. Overall I would buy this again. It’s not to nutty and drinkability is great light on the stomach. I love this Brown Ale one of my favs so far indeed!

Draught at the World Craft Beer Tasting in Osaka, as "Rogue Brown Ale." Sugary, cookie-ish aroma. Medium brown color with translucent edges and a nice tan head. Sourish edge to the initial; goes to a sugar sweetness in mid palate; final is a bit tart, with some bittering to balance out the sweetness. Thin-medium body. This beer is fairly uni-dimensional, but tasty all the same.

Rogue Hazelnut Brown - Lived up to its name perfectly!  Great hazelnut aromas promising a hazelnut taste, and it delivers.  Head is fantastic, great lacing, deep reddish brown color.  To fit the Brown Ale style, in addition to being nutty and semi-sweet, its light-bodied without being watery - not weak at all.  Can either session or savor - exceptionally balanced.  My new favorite in the style - Sam Smiths, Lagunitas WTF, and Sierra Nevadas Tumbler are all great beers, but Rogue Hazelnut eclipses them all.  Hats off to Rogue.

Bottle at the house in Kauai split with Matt and Octo.  Dark ruby with a creamy beige head. Blatant nutty and milk choc aroma. Smooth mocha and hazelnut confectionery flavour well kept in check by roast. Finishing hint of bitterness. Good.

Rich smooth distinctive taste. Great aroma and drinkability. Perfect balance of sweetness and nutty flavor. Would love to see a double of this style and increase the richness. But dont mess with a good thing. A fantastic beer

Draft. Dark amber brown, very nutty, smooth and rich.  Complex flavors and solid all around.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazelnut hits this right on the head. Poured from a 355ml bottle, a deep ruby/brown with a small off white head. Loads of hazelnut on the aroma, with a lot of malt character. Taste is the same, almost like eating nuts, incredible nutty, malty, little bit of caramel. Medium bodied, very smooth with a slightly bitter finish. Soft carbonation, a very good ale.

Warm brown, bright, garnet when backlit, thin tan head.  Aroma/flavor are a relatively dry maltiness that has substantial hazelnut and bark character.  Personally, I do not feel that the hazelnut flavor mates well with either a dry maltiness or the moderate-to-light hop bitterness which is present in this beer.  Perhaps this is due to a bad experience Ive had with a similar tasting English mild that I brewed though.  My opinion of this beer may be colored.  I wouldnt get this again though.
Bottle on 9/5....pours a medium brown; definite sweet / molasses nose...almost too sweet.  Nutty / hazelnut taste dominates...smooth finish...Id say good but not great to this one.

Rogues reputation is sliding with me.  Its been a while since Ive had anything from them that I absolutely loved.  There aroma on this brown is pretty nice, somewhat nutty and perhaps biscuity?  The first taste, though, is a blast of what can only be described as Panera worthy hazelnut flavoring.  Its a but too obvious, mate.  Once that calms down though, there is a lingering nuttiness that is actually quite pleasant.  Bready? Buttery sweet? Not sure, but definitely enjoyable.

Déja quelques bouteilles derrière la cravate.  Un liquide brun et sa mousse parfois majestueuse et parfois tombante.  Un nez de noisettes et de malts rôtis et grillés.  Des saveurs collées aux arômes avec, cependant, une noisette qui me semble artificielle.  Aussi, une présence houblonnée qui nest pas à mon goût.  Un corps mince et des bulles qui sont à point.  Une texture qui me semble être à la limite aqueuse.  Une finale courte sur des notes maltées.  Pas mauvais mais aucunement transcendant.  Tout de même facile à boire.

Aroma: Sweet highly trail mix like aroma

Appearance: Bright red copper tan head

Taste: sweet nutty bread, mellow hops

Palate: Very smooth light carbonation

Overall: Nice sweet nutty brew
Bottle. Brown beer with a dark cream head. Malt and light caramel aroma. Nutty malt flavor with light caramel. Medium bodied. Caramel and nutty malt lingers with light backing hops.
Meh. The beer itself was reasonably solid, but then the finish comes along where the hazelnut pokes through, and theres a non-hop bitterness that is quite unpleasant.

Bottle at home - May 12.
Dark amber brown in colour with a finger of tan head that thinned after a while.
Malts, toasted nuts, caramel and a little chocolate on the nose.
Taste follos from aroma with a sweetish taste and you can pick out the hazlenuts more allied to a little more chocolate akin to a beer version of nutella!
Medium bodided with a very smooth and creamy finish.
Not a big fan of Rogue beers in general but this was decent!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a clear brown with medium lasting tan head. Aroma and Taste of sweet hazelnut, nocciolo, yeast some caramel malt, and nice chocolaty under tones with mild bitterness. Palate is a nice balance of sweetness with a bit of creamy and smooth mouth feel, with moderate carbonation. Finish is a nice sweet hazelnut, nocciolo flavor with a bit of chocolate malt and light bitterness. Overall a nicely balanced flavorful and enjoyable brew.

Keg at the Holborn Whippet, London. Labeled as hazelnut brown, 6.2% abv. Nose of nutty chocolate, malt sweetness. Tastes sweet with just a touch of hop bitterness that livens it up. Really moreish and drinkable. Like the tail end of a Snickers bar. Decent carbonation under the tongue, but little to no head. A dangerously drinkable companion. I like it.

A very nutty, malty, and yeasty aroma. Pours a very dark brown colour (fully opaque) with about 2 fingers of head that dissapates at an average rate. Medium bodied with a forceful hazelnut and malt taste. The finish is smooth, long, and slightly sweet. A nice evening sipper.
I love this beer. Pours dark brown with not much head. Nutty and malty flavors. One of my all time favorites.

Draft at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Before saying anything else, let me say "WOW". The guys at Rogue sure know how to brew! Dark brown cloudy pour with a light frothy head and minimal lacing. But hey who cares what it looks like, it's the taste that's all important and this beer delivers big time. The smooth malty caramel and nutty taste really hits you right in the face and there is a hint of coffee in the aftertaste too. There is almost no bitterness at all and I'm more than happy with that for this style of beer. A real find and another winner from Rogue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured dark brown from a 22oz bottle into tulip glass.  Nose is roasted malt.  Taste is strong hazelnut and malt.  Not a particularly complex beer, but good.
Bottle - not much head, dark amber color, salty and sweet nutty aroma and flavor - pretty sweet but not too overbearing

Pours dark brown. Smells like roasted malts and nuts. Taste is med and dark roasted malts and hops, sweet hazelnut and a little earth. Interesting flavors, but the hazelnut comes on a little too strong for my liking and seems like artificial flavoring. Interesting.

Bottle from GBBF 2012.  Now then.  I had assumed that I have had this before.  Its not like it hasnt been available in the UK for a long time.  Its just that when I went through the bottled list I checked it and no Id not had it.  A very dark beer with a thin beige/grey head.  Nutty malty aroma.  Almost some praline.  Fullish in mouth.  Some brown malts, some praline flavours.  Like a lot of Rogue beers, this is interesting and full of flavour.  Its fine.  Would I buy it again?  Probably not.  Is it tasty?  Yes, its pretty good.  Fine.
Pretty nice brown ale. Has a dark, toasty flavor to it..........................
On tap in a shaker.  Pours brown with a lacy head.  Aroma of caramel malts, hazelnut, and floral hops.  Malts and nuttiness dominates the flavor.  Average texture.  A pretty good brown ale.

Appearance was reddish brown with creamy diminishing tannish 1/2 finger head, lacing spotty. Aromas are sweet coco, coffee, nutty, roasty, toasty malts, slight deep fruits of date, fig, cherry and the hazelnut. Taste was nutty coffee, toffee, chocolate, roasty  malts with slight bite of  spicey hops. Palate was creamy light CO2 with meduim body, then roasty nutty average length coffeeish malty finish. A malty goodness of a good brown...
Pours golden brown. Aroma is malt and mild alcohol. Flavour is a weak beer with hazelnut. I liked this, but I think it would be better as a richer drink.

Great brew. Pours deep amber in color with a thin off white head. Hazelnut up front with hints off vanilla and roasted malts. Very minimal hops. Finishes very sweet. Makes for a great after dinner beer.

Bottle with Fantasy, pours cloudy amber brown with small head and not much lacing to note. Aromas of hazelnut coffee, caramel, bitter cocoa, and sweet sugary malts. Taste is vanilla, smoked malt, and nutty ass coffee. Hops come through in the finish but not much in scent/flavor. Pretty enjoyable brew from Rogue. Cheers.

Has a funky nutty flavor and pours a reddish brown color with minimal head. Has an alright hazelnut taste with a little roast, pretty light.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Alright, alright, the hazelnut extract tastes good. A desert beer if ever there was one.
Bottle pours a brown with tan head. Smells tastes of nuts caramel coffee roasty but malt semi sweet nice beer pretty sold.

Pours cloudy-tea with a tall, solid, creamy tan head.
Aroma is hazelnut, smooth chocolate.
Nut flavour is a a bit sharp rather than sweet.
Hints of cola, gentle chocolate roast.
Very pleasant and tasty beer.

Hazelnut dominates the aroma. Brownish purple appearance with a thin foam. Flavors of nuts and oats upfront with a coffee and caramel finish. Lightly carbonated with a medium body. Overall, this is a spectacular brew with nutty and malty characteristics. Id give this an A- rating.

Bottle to glass shaker.  Pours a cloudy amber - brown color with a medium tan head.  You can smell the hazelnut on the nose.  Has a great up front taste & mouthfeel, however the aftertaste leaves tart note.  Oh well, overall its pretty good.

Milder aroma than I expected, with roast, hazelnut, and some earthiness.  Flavor is sweet with hazelnut.  More nutty flavor and a little coffee bitterness in the finish.  I wasnt so sure that hazelnut was going to be a great beer flavor, but this is tremendous.

Poured from 12oz. bottle into my Rogue shaker.  Translucent dark brown with a light cream colored head.  Aroma is roasted malt with some mild nuttiness.  Flavor is roasted malt, hazelnut, and some vanilla.  Palate is creamy.  Overall a decent brown ale, but I was hoping for something a little more memorable.
my bottle was a little flat and overly sweet but damn I bet this is a good beer with some carbonation!

12 ounce bottle.  Somehow this winter seasonal was still sitting on the mix-six shelves of World Market in mid-July.  Despite the 90-some degree weather outside, I really liked this fuzzy warm teddy bear of brown ale.  Rogue hits all the right spots with the style without venturing into any adventurous territory.  Its great when such a predictable beer is so good.  It has a remarkably smooth quality from soft carbonation, but its by no means flat.  The mild palate feel really lets the chocolate and hazelnut flavors sink in.  It has a foamy, residue-laden red-brown color thats also encouraging when first poured.  There wasnt much of an aroma.  I highly recommend this stuff, and for once, the award noted on the bottle ("Best in Brown") seems merited.
This beer has a decent flavor, but its too fizzy. It foamed up in my mouth before I could swallow it.
Tap at one of Rogues Portland locations. Bittersweet with obvious but not overpowering hazelnut notes. Good stuff.
140712. Tap at Portland saturday market. Pours brown with smooth head. Aroma slight hazelnut, malts. Slightly sweet taste. Not Bad.
Pours brown ..heath bar aroma.. taste is extremly smooth ..wood..nuts..awesome..will def. Do again..
Slight fruity smell. Smooth nutty flavor. Somewhere between forgettable and fairly tasty. The TWO AND A HALF MEN of Rogue beers.

Pours red brown with generous foamy head. Taste is thin and lighter than it looks. Not much to this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Think of eating a Belgian waffle and then drink this beer.  Lots of honey and sugar.  Brown pour with a light head.  Very easy drinking, but just a bit too sweet.

Pours rich red-brown with small foamy head. Aroma is hazelnut, coffee, and malt/grain. Taste is sweet with a hint of sourness; finish remains sweet with mild bitterness. Medium-bodied, not too heavy. Love the hazelnut.
Puts pale translucent brown, strong nut presence, generally lovely biscuit promising joys. Body a little thin, but biscuits, sweet jammy dodger, nuts cover the flavour. Delicious.
Excellent brown ale with great hazelnut notes. Definitely one of my new found favorites.

18-JUN-2012, bottle @George & Dragon, during "Un Mare di Birra".
Hazy brown with lasting tan head.
Caramel and hazelnut on the aroma.
Really nice taste with loads of sweet hazelnut and caramel.
Quite hoppy. A bit watery finish.
A better than most brown ale, just still not as good as first time five years ago with Ulkløbben.
Nice brown ale with a hint of hazelnut to round things out. My favorite Rogue Ale.
Rich pallet, not too busy with flavour. Slow drink, very hazelnutty. Almost like a flavoured coffee. Very smooth.

Mid to dark reddish brown coloured beer with a thickish cream coloured head. Full nutty aroma, slightly sweet, with chocolate, bready, roast malt and a hint of smoke. Fizzy and medium bodied mouthfeel. An initial dry taste, then a balancing, slightly sweet flavour of coffee and hazelnut, likened to "karamalz, chocolatey and bready, with a background roast malt flavour that underpins the whole taste. There is a slight sourness in the finish.
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2012 Pours a clear red-brown with barely a tan head.  Smells of nuts, strongly, with hint of caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet and bitter, strong note of hazelnut, hint of vanilla
Clear brown.  No head.  Smells nutty.  Great malty and dominant hazelnut flavor.  Nutty.  Delicious.

Pours a clear, dark copper with a frothy, tan head that stays. Excellent lacing. Inviting aroma with subtle, roasted nut notes. Effervescent mouthfeel. Taste is complex and strong of sweet hazelnuts. Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice red-brown color with a quickly fading tan head. Smell is especially nutty, like hazelnut creamer, woody, and oats. Taste is initially quite sweet with slight bitter on the exit. Medium body, a little foamy.

Smells chocolatly and an aroma of hazlenut. Its deep red with little head retention. The taste is very hazlenutty with malty notes and not very bitter. Its clean crisp light body, overall not a bad brew.

Loved this since I tried it in Seattle last year. The hazelnut is real mild and as you drink it, becomes less noticeable. Smooth and good, slightly bitter aftertaste. Yum!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber colour, with a thin head that dissipates into a thin lacing. Very weak but pleasant enough aroma with hints of caramel. Goes down very smoothly, sweet taste including lots of caramel and hazelnut.  Other than the weak aroma this is a great drop!

12oz bottle - pours amber with tan head.  Nose is caramel and toasty.  Flavor adds nuttiness and a little floral hop.  Aftertaste is a tad metallic and roasted.  (Balotelli just got a yellow card). Easy to drink.  A little sweet with a tiny bit bitter.  A good, but not great brew.
I really like this beer its smooth and very tasty its got a hint of nutty flavor but not to strong

dark reddish brown auburn pour... not much head or lacing... couldnt get much on the nose, maybe some nuttiness... def a lot of sweet syrupy hazelnut flavor... nice body, feels very syrupy as well, coats the tongue and lingers...

Bottle from Utobeer. Colour is clear reddish brown, off white head. Nose is cardboard, a swirl of hazelnut nuttiness, praline sweetness, ale fruity. Taste is flat nut brown ale, nutty, chewy, bit of cardboard, ale fruity, chocolate praline, caramel crystal malt, and in the finish theres a bit of tingly hop bitterness. Interesting brown ale but not to my taste.
12oz bottle from Corner Market.  Smell is very nutty.  Taste is a earthy.  I figured it would be sweeter than it is.  Thin mouthfeel.  Hazelnut was faint.  Bitter aftertaste.

(draught 0,3l @ Netopýr (Brno))
Some nuts, but quite unpleasant aroma. Brown color. Medium brown head. Light sweet, biscuits, light nuts, but again something unpleasant. Light-medium body. Light dry finish. Interesting, but not my cup of beer.

1L squealer, pours cola brown with a very small head but an amazing creamy hazelnut aroma. Very nice flavour to this beer which is very complex. Lots of biscut, chocolate and a nice hop backing which is all mingled in which the amazing hazelnut hit.
Semi smoky malty aroma.  medium sweety taste.  Smoky sweet finish.  Ok bit still lacking something.

Smells and tastes like those odd popcorn-flavored jellybeans you can get at specialty candy stores. Alright. Its fizzy and doesnt seem to breathe much depth in terms of complexity. Still, its a brown ale so what more are you trying to expect? Unusually sweet but certainly not cloying. A worthy party beer.

Copper-amber pour into thick, beige head that slowly dissipates into sticky lacing which melts into a lingering pool of bubbly foam. Aroma of toasty buttery biscuit with honey, lightly roasted hazelnut and malty caramel. Initial flavor of sweet chocolate, caramel, and spiced hazelnut bread that fades into a creamy finish.

Might have just gotten a bad bottle... but this was terrible. It smells like Stella Artois. The flavor was sweet up front with a lot of artificial tasting hazelnut flavor and finishing with a stinky, almost sour-esque flavor at the end. Just tasted like bad, cheap beer.
650ml Bottle. A great hazelnut aroma, with a lovely sweet, nutty malt characteristics with a smooth malty finish. Very Yummy.

Dark reddish amber with no head.  Nose is lots of hazelnut, brown sugar, flaky Cadbury chocolate.  Flavor is sweet, cadbury chocolate, hazelnut, a little sweet for my tastes.  Kinda thin mouthfeel.  Its interesting to rate this after all these years.  I probably had this for the first time about 7 years ago and I wish I had a rating for how I felt then.  Im sure it would be very different.
Appearance is small brown head with deep brown. Aroma is a sweet chocolate. Taste is a sweet chocolate. Taste is a sweet hazelnut and chocolate. Overall very good.
Heavy hazelnut taste and aroma. Good beer, not for your average drinker. Good desert beer.
Pours a clear and dark brown beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, caramel, rye and nut. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is dry with sweetness. Overall a strange but average beer.
Probably hands down my favorite beer. Amazing taste, aroma, and smooth finish. I love this beer.
Pours dark copper with a beige head. Aroma is malt, nuts, wet dog and rye. Flavour is malt, pale chocolate and rye. Dry.
From the tap came a dark amber brew with a creamy light brown head. Aromas and flavors of biscuity, hazel nutty malt. Medium bodied. Pretty good but not great.

Tap. I cant remember the last time I had a nut brown, probably about ten years ago. This wasnt too bad- I like hazelnut. Red brown color with creamy cream head and decent lacing. Smells like hazelnut and good spice bread. Tastes very hazelnutty. Moderate carbonation and a touch watery.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Overall a solid brown ale, syrup, sweet, hazel, very rich and nutty overall. Impressed.

Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is mellow malts & candied hazelnuts. Taste is carob and smooth malts up front transforming into a creamy, earthy hazelnut flavor in the finish. A good beer for a cold night in a log cabin.

Originally reviewed: 8/30/09. Had this on tap at the local Mellow Mushroom the other night. Came out a dark tawny brown with no head on it at all. No lacing present either. Smells of nuts, brown sugar, molasses, and some vanilla. 

The mouth is crisp, yet smooth. This is crisp, but it goes down mellow. You can definitely pull the hazelnut out of this beer. Very nutty at the start, but finishes very sweet. Tons of vanilla, syrup, and toasted sugar all over this beer. I like my browns to have a subtle sweetness, but this was a bit over the top. A decent dessert beer, but not my everyday brown.

Tap 20 pour into mug. No head.mahogany color (guy next to me asks if it?s a red) .nose overwhelmed by popcorn in the air. Very light carbonation not a lot of good.somewhat weak malt background with definite nut flavor hint of chocolate. Not likely to want more than a 12 oz of this. kind of one dimensional.
extremely smooth. im not a huge fan of hazelnut, but this definitely works well. highly recommended.
A bit sour, mild carbonation - goes flat and tasteless very fast; delicate hazelnut flavor, superb hazelnut aftertaste. Not a session beer.

Bottle.  Porus an odd brown that at first seemed light and amber, then seemed reddish and now seems just kind of a muddy brown.  Head was pretty massive at first, but after a sip or two of sticking to my mustache seems to be behaving a little better and is nothing but lacing and a thin film of tan bubbles.  Aroma is definitely heavy with the nutty and earthy aromas.  I guess I would go so far as to say "hazelnut," but it seems to be a little more of a generic nuttiness, with a decent amount of brown sugar sweetness peeking in on the party.  Flavor is a good mix of brown sugar sweetness, a little bit of grainy maltiness and that earthy and nutty edge.  Palate is a little odd... sometimes it seems full bodied and lovely, but then the next sip will seem a little thin and watery.  Its a common complaint of mine against Rogue, though, and Im wondering if it is the result of their house yeast strain or what.  Normally Im not a huge fan of brown ales, but this one is pretty decent.  Then again, maybe its just coz Im sitting here having a beer in the afternoon while Im not at work.  Nah... this is good stuff.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 650mL bottle.  Pours clear medium brown with a small diminishing off-white head.  Aroma of roasted hazelnuts, caramel, wood and some grass.  Less flavour than expected for the ABV, medium sweetness, low bitterness, mildly nutty and malty, a little fruit.  Light bodied, fairly thin, average carbonation and a drying finish.

Pours brown with aromas of candied malts, caramel, nuts, vanilla. Very smooth body with low carbonation. Flavours of hazelnuts, caramel, roasted malts with a touch of sweetness. Finish is nice with notes of bitterness and sweetness and a touch of yeast. Enjoyable.

Nice smooth brown. Reddish brown pour with a generous tan head. Warming aroma gives nice malty aroma and the roasted nuttiness. Taste is sweeter than expected for the brown. I dont get knocked over the head with hazelnut flavor but I do get some. Light-bodied for easy drinking.

12oz bottle. dark amber, full tan head. sweet chocolate and hazelnut aroam. the hazelnut especially jumps right out. continues with the first taste, filled with a nice nutty taste. malts, bit of caramel. very nice tasting beer
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Light hazelnut and sweet flavor tones, smooth vanilla finish. Aroma is light sweet malt with a touch of vanilla.
Excellent brown ale. Nutty smell medium dark pour. Good malt and hazelnut flavors. Great beer. $8.99 650ml

Big bottle.  Brown color, medium full head.  Sensational hazelnut aromas with caramel malt.  Light sweetness and light bitter.  Med light body, ave carbonation.  Nice mouthfeel.  Ive bought a case of this before and was always a fan.  Once again, this does not disappoint.  10 aroma.

dark brown color, aroma of hazel nut, roasted malt, vanilla, flavors of stong hazel nut, roasted malt, vanilla, slight pine hops, toast, chocolate, light to med body, slightly dry, very good and highly drinkable

Draught. Beautiful brown color. Lovely smell of Malta and nuts. Fantastic nutty flavor that is nearly over the top. Mouthwatering beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The hazelnut really comes through in the taste and smell. Its got a slightly sweet taste, but is not at all overpowering. Coffee notes come through, also. A nice drink.
Plenty of toasted characters to go along with a dose of toffee and vanilla.  Nice touch of hazelnut. Medium body and very enjoyable and so easy to drink.
22oz bottle pours brown with a tan head.  Aroma is of roasted malts and a hint of nuts.  Taste of malts with a little bitter hops

Ar: Nutty roasted chocolate, deep warm hazelnut, some maple syrup.
Ap: Deep amber-red, clear - small light tan head with medium-low retention and a very slight ring of lacing.
T: Lots of hazelnut, medium caramel - a touch of vanilla and floral hops mid-palate - finish is toasted bread, cocoa, vanilla, and some butterscotch, with a medium lingering bitterness.
P: Medium body with medium carbonation - finish is dry.
O: The depth of hazelnut flavor is really wonderful in this beer - it mingles well with the cocoa, butterscotch, and caramel flavors - nice!

Bomber into tulip. Nose is light hazelnut and some caramel. Body is, well, brown. A rich light tan head. Good bubbly lacing. Taste is caramel and some hazelnut, resembling buttered popcorn. Malty and grainy. Dry palate with a nice medium bodied consistency. Good overall.

22oz bottle.  Light aroma, but really nice.  Color is as true of a brown as Ive ever seen.  Smallish head, a little bubbly lacing fades fast.  I like that the hazelnut taste is subdued, not too strong, but present.  Average carbonation, Im glad that this beer is a brown ale instead of a porter or something.  My wife loves it, highly recommend.  A little bit of a sour taste is present in the aftertaste, great!
Dark brown, with a medium-sized light brown head. Very tangy and delicious. Both fruity and nutty, with mild bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2012 Excellent, easy drinking brown ale.  Subtle notes of hazelnut in the aroma and flavor but definitely not overwhelming by any means (bottle was approx 5 months old).  Overall a good beer, and Id purchase again without hesitation.

Poured into an English pint from a 650ml bottle with no date.

A: Hazy brown body with a slightly thin tan rocky head with fair retention.

S: Semi-sweet creamy mocha, slight hazelnut.
