Oh this was very good. Nut brown color with little head. Strong nutty aroma. Sweet and nutty flavor. Smooth on the palate.
as the name describes ... a very sweet brown and nutty flavor/aroma.  the hazelnut extract really stands out.  good lacing all the way down, one of the nicest looking brown ales ive seen.  bueno!
pours beautiful reddish brown with tan head. rich hazelnut toffee smell that i absolutely love. Tastes rich in hazelnut with toffee and malty finish. Easily my favorite brown! Sweet but well balanced

This is a very unique beer. MUCH better as it warms. Not much of a head, but decent lacing. Nutty aroma almost jumps out of the glass at you. Wonderfully complex, rich taste of molasses and hazelnut. Hoppy, but not overdone. Tastes THICK. Definitely a beer to remember and try again.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2009 old rating:
7/4/8/4/17 - 4.0 ( 8/7/2007 )
7/3/8/4/16 - 3.8 ( 7/3/2008 )

pours a hazy brown with a thin khaki head, and some lacing.

smells of malt, caramel, nuts, some spice, chocolate, a bit of coffee, and a roastiness.

taste is creamy and smooth, burnt toffee, brown sugar, nuts, some cocoa, and a little spice, ends tangy, and slightly bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2008 bottle:  Thanks to Lord Beamish for sharing this one.  The best brown ale I have had by far.  Sometimes the nut flavour can be overwhelming in a brown ale, but not this one.  I couldnt get over how cloudy this beer was.  I love quality malts & when I read the allstar lineup brought in for this beer, it doesnt suprise me.  This is going to make it tough to drink just any sub par brown ale from now on.

bottle: Wow! This is quite possibly the best brown ale I have ever had. Pours a deep dark brown with tan head. A comforting nutty aroma leads the way into a taste sensation. Extremely flavourful. The nuttiness is balanced out with some superior malts which prevent this ale from finishing bitter. My only dissapointment is that I only bought one bottle while in Michigan. An excellent beer!

I was not a big fan of this one this time around.  Almost tasted like hazelnut syrup like the one they would put in your coffee at starbux.  Nice color and nice creamy consistency otherwise but I couldnt get past the sweetness of this one.

(bottle, thanks Philsner) Pours an amber brown with an off-white head.  Aroma is of toasted hazelnut, and also a strong smell of fresh-baked cornbread with honey butter spread over it.  Taste is very much filled with the hazelnut, with a nice sweet finish and just a faint touch of hops.  Medium body.  Pretty good.

[Bottle, thanks Philsner] Pours reddish brown with a light tan head.  Aroma is strongly of hazelnut with notes of something sweet--maybe honey.  Taste is roughly the same with the sweetness a little more pronounced and faint hops.  Fairly high carbonation.  Medium-light body.  Decent finish.  A good brown ale.

1.6 pint bottle, $5.89.  Aroma is moderately nutty with notes of vanilla malt.  Average off-white foamy head that mostly diminished and  left little lace.  Dark brown normal hue.  Flavor is lightly sweet and not very bitter.  Palate is light-med watery texture with soft carbo.    Nice brew, mild and sweet nutty smell/flavor left me satisfied.

Bomber.  Pours a cloudy brown color with a small diminishing beige head.  The aroma is roasted malts, hazelnut, and dough.  The flavor definetly has hazelnut, but not at the exclusion of other tastes.  I also get vanilla, chocolate, and some bread.  This is mildly sweet with mild bitterness so it ends up being pretty well balanced.  Medium bodied.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2008 Nice, unique flavor and the hazelnut really sets it apart.  Will be drinking again...

22oz - Aroma is cardboard, toasted malts, pecans and hazelnut.  Pours transparent brown with a nice fluffy head and good lacing.  Flavor matches aroma with the nuttiness lingering.  Palate is creamy and smooth.  A pretty good brown but I like mine with a bit more hops.  Maybe this one was at the store a while.
Dont have my notes from this one, just my rating. I do recall the hazelnut taste getting cloying near the end of my glass. Good for one, but not more.

Wow!!  This beer is very unique.  Aroma is great, it smells nuts, vanilla and toffee.  Very carbonate on the tongue and finished very smooth with a strong taste of hazelnut.  Would drink it again and again.
Very good beer, I wish you could rate it along with price though, big bottle but a little high priced at $11.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2007 Bottle Dark amber pour with small head. Hazelnut and somewhat bready aroma and flavor. Smooth. Malty finish. Good brew.
Re-rate on draught very disappointing flavor, really nothing to it :(

Draft at the Downtown Broadway Brewhouse. Pours opaque brown with a small beige head. Aroma of hazelnut, malt, and cookie dough. Medium bodied with a light but subtle earthy texture. Initial flavor of vanilla, and hazelnut that transitions to more of a creme  and chocolate middle, with a hint of nuts. Not overly sweet, but enough to accent the flavors. Mild amount of bitterness  to bring it into balance on the finish. Nice beer.

650ml bottle, slight hazy brown hue, with a beige head, but falls quickly, sweet toasted maltiness nose, with an intense caramelized hazelnut nuttiness accent, with a buttery chestnut note, a cookie dough, with a faint nutmeg spicy aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice creamy buttery hazelnut character, with a smooth chestnut nutty accent, some sweet toasted malts, with a caramelized toffeeish note, with a mild chocolatey hazelnut nutella flavor, leading towards a nutty, malty finish.

I really had high hopes for this beer as it scored so highly in everything I have read about it.  Unfortunately this was a huge disappointment. 

When I saw it looked like root beer in the glass I should have stopped there.  The nose is nutty with a strong malt component.  Feels thin and over carbonated in the mouth.  The flavor coats your tongue in nuttiness and finishes strongly with a *blech* factor.

I will admit that I am a hop-head, and I was hard-pressed to find anything nice to say about this beer.  This one is definitely NOT for the hop lover.

Pours dark brown (surprise) with a rich beige head.  Aromas of caramel and banana nut bread with a bit of a floral hop bouquet.  This beer needs to be consumed a bit warmer than most, I think. Good nutty honey-like flavor; hops really make themselves known in the flavor.  Less body than I expected, but not a problem.  Finishes smooth.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2007 Pours a clear brown with a tan head.  Aroma is an enticing mix of hazelnut and vanilla.  However, this beer completely falls apart upon tasting.  It has the consistency of seltzer water, and the taste, which is a nice hazelnut in the beginning, goes absolutely nowhere afterward.  A total disappointment; I felt like I was drinking nutty soda.

Not a great brown ale; why did this score so high? Pour was a nice deep brown with a little one finger off white head. Aroma of malt and not much else. Flavor was caramel and some nuts...roasted malt mostly, though. Caramel in the afftertaste. Medium carbonation.Average.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Very nutty aroma, with roasty malt and chocolate.  Flavor is a bit more mild, mostly malt and a bit of caramel, but tons of hazelnut in the finish.  Good medium body and carbonation, slightly oily.
first beer i had of the night.  i was very impressed with this compared to the others i had.

Pours oily-textured clear dark brown into the glass with a pillowy off white head.  The smell is fantastic, with a variety of choclatey malts.  Hazelnut is promenent (no surprise) but there were an array of lightly toasted malts, chocolate, almond, even peanut butter.  The flavor features hazelnut up front, but evolves toasted almond, chocolate flavors and finishes with a dry twinge which has echoes of mocha coffe and smoke.  The malts are well balanced by omnipotent hoppy kicks throughout the taste.  This is a good brown ale.

simpaticissima brown ale con un fondo di nocciola non aggressivo, sapore avvolgente, una goduria vera e propria.
Comprata da Ciobì (10), ma già assaggiata dal bicchiere altrui al Pub del Duca.

Finaly get to try this other than a 4oz sample. Very good pour. Dark amber into a nice light tan head. Smell is nutty and malts. Tase is great, IMO. Very up front hazelnut. Very rich in flavor. Smooth, sweet finish with even more hazel nut aftertaste.

dark amber brown with a tan head. aroma.....uhhh frangelico 
light??? smells way too fake. flavor bittersweet nutty malty hazelnut with some light spice. light spicy frangelico finish. medium body. slightly fizzy carbonation. bleh......hazelnut nectar........what the hell is that!?!?! keep it out of my beer!
xxx i wouldnt say this is a great brew, but it is definitely drinkable and worthwhile.

This is different.  It is good beer, but you have to be open-minded.  Traditionalists and beeer snobs wouldnt like this one.  
I havent had a bad beer from Rogue yet, and this stays true to form.
Really is hard to pinpoint...somewhat creamy.  It is nutty.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2008 A nice dark brown/black pour, smells of caramel, chocolate, sweet honey and of course hazelnut.  The Hazelnut flavor isn

pours a dark brown cocacola like in appearance, quickly disappearing head, smells of candy, sweet, honey, caramel, chocolate, nice hazelnut flavor not too strong, this is a great brew from rogue, very much enjoyed it.

22 oz bottle.  Pour is a clear brown with red and a medium sized off white head.  Aroma is a caramel, chocolate and nut malt.  Taste is more of the caramel and chocolate and a nice roastiness to it.  Of course it has the "Rogue" taste in there too.  Really nice smoothness and a great, long finish.
You expect amber and you get it, color wise.  Flavor is thick with a nutty finish.  Halfway through the 22 youre probably a little bored.

bomber. color is deep amber the beer pours with a tall pillowy head. aroma is cereal malt   caramel and hazelnuts. taste is rich with notes of bread and toast with a firm malt backbone and just a touch of hazelnuts. the finish is long with nice caramel sweetness.
Very nice rich brown pour, very nice rich taste. This is a great beer. Very distinct taste. Would definitely recommend.

Pours a nice brown color.  Smell is sweet with some hazelnut and faint chocolate.  Taste is much the same, the sweetness is unique, almost does taste like a nectar as opposed to a sugar, as the name would suggest.  Nice brown ale, more interesting than most.  Nothing to blow your mind, but worth a try.
Much better than the other morimoto, but (so vector says) not as good as the regular hazelnut.  Almost no aroma, very light sweet nutty flavor.  Not bad, but not outstanding.

Nutty brown body, thick creamy head. Restrained nutty aroma, ditto for the taste. This is my second time trying this, and I have to say, I have a really tough time getting excited about this. Granted, Ive never been a big fan of havelnut anything, and this doesnt do much to change that. Just so nondescript...
Although the hazelnut is very present in the taste and aroma of this beer it is not overpowering.  Great beer to savor as you drink it!

Kinda gimmicky but very nice nonetheless. Smells of hazelnut and chocolate, both of which going well with a pleasant maltiness. Pours dark brown with medium tan head. Hazelnut is more present in the flavour than I expected but is still in balance. Hoppiness is mild. Creamy texture, not too much carbonation. Definitely a beer Id love in the Autumn.

This is a fun brown ale.  It pours deep  brown and shows the nutty notes of hazelnut pretty lighly on the nose and then a bit deeper on the mouthfeel.   The balnce of hops and malt make this a fine example of how to use flavors.

Oh My goodness, I have found a brew from Rogue that I will Buy often, Had this on tap at Tequila hoppers, in Upland,Cal. Hazelnut right off the bat, Some roasted malts,sweetness. Easy drinking, some caramel, very slight bitterness on the ending, a great beer, and nice to find a Hazelnut brew.. Nutella in a glass!!!

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2007 Appearance: Straight up solid brown in color with a fizzy khaki-colored head that quickly settles to a ring of bubbles and further settles leaving the beer to look like a glass of Nestea.

Smell: The scent isnt overly abundent, but its there. Its there and its hazlenut, baby! Theres also cream soda, toast with honey, and a little bit of chocolate to be found. 

Taste: Its delish! Malty sweet, with flavors of hazlenut, vanilla, and even coffee. The soft, floral hops are delicate and help to balance out the sweetness, though they remain light (and especially light for Rogue). Lastly, both chocolate and honey close out things. Finish is clean.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Creamy. Carbonation remains low.

Drinkability: Excellent and unique! Very easy to drink. Sweet, but not too sweet. A very tasty brown ale!
Bottle at KØ07. Clear dark brown colour. The flavour is oxidized, slightly roasted with a caramelly hint and low bitterness.

One of my top 5 favorite beers.  Good aroma but it is the flavor that gets me.  The hazelnut taste is definitely apparent with some mild coffee undertones  The aftertaste isnt overpowering but hangs in there long enough to provide some lasting memory of the last sip.  Overall this is a very smooth beer with a great flavor.  Im glad that it isnt a limited release!!!  This definitely is not for everyone but it is worth trying.

Deep, clear brown with a thin white head. Big malty, nutty aroma. Flavor is very sweet, dominated by a frosting of hazlenut over a rich malty body with a light hop finish. Great beer ...unless, of course, you dont like hazlenuts.

dk magenta with med thick lasting tan head. med syrupy body w/ good carbonation citrus dk fruit and cinnamon aroma w/some nutty grain. tastes of honey nut biscuit with cinnamon light raisin and orange, sweet but good bitterness. well rounded and what you would expect of rogue

Deep chestnut brown with little head.  Flavor has little hoppiness and is extremely sweet, with a distinct nuttiness.  For me, the overly sweet character is off-putting.  I guess if you like hazelnuts this is equivalent to drinking them.

22 oz. bomber and on draft yesterday.  Poured a deep dark brown.  Mouthfeel was medium bodied with a hint of hazel nut and bittering hops.  Not all that complex or intriguing.  Nice balanced brown ale.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Pours a reddish amber brown color with a nice creamy green yellow head. Tastes very thick and sticky with a pretty potent taste of hazelnuts and chocolate. Nose is nutty and of chocolate, cream, and brown sugar. Taste is coffee like and nutty with a bit of an awkward aftertaste. Nice silk and thick mouthfeel. Not bad but it is much better on tap than in the bottle.
Great nutty taste. Vanila and hazelnut flavors. Great brown ale. Dark brown in color.
Bomber, nice warm aroma, sweet medium malts, Pours a very nice dark brown color with a thin tan head. Nice rich brown woody taste, good light hops, Very sturdy. Very nice.
Hazy brown color, short brown head. Aroma of soft hazelnut, caramel malt, chocolat. Sweet taste, caramel, toffee, hazelnut, some milk chocolat. Only bit bitter.

Pint glass, chilled...great flavor rich with hazelnut but a bit low on carbonation which may have more due to the draught than the beer,,,nice brown color, little head; the bartender mixed some of this with Guinness later in the evening and it really brought out the nut & cocoa flavors, interestingly.
I thought this beer was very tasty. 650ml bottle bought at Tiffanys Kalamazoo. Drank out of frosty mug. Really love the smooth roasted nut flavor. I reccomend this for sure.

(draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma is very sweet and nutty with tons of hazelnut flavor. Rich and roasty. Flavor itself is very sweet and nutty at the beginning with a very sweet and hazelnut flavor in the middle and a sweet and roasted malt finish. Very smooth and tasty.
Dark brown color.  Hazelnut really is apparent.  Lots of caramel and sweet malt too.  Really unique for the nutty flavor.  One of the better brown ales I have tried.
A 22oz picked up randomly at a local corner market. Certainly surprised. I loved it. A strong recommendation for any brown ale fan. Go find out on your own why this one is so great.

Beautiful rich deep red-brown beer. The hazelnut tones are not overwhelming, but subtle and linger in the palate after the beer is down. Small lasting head, moderate carbonation. The palate is complex, a rich nutty flavor with a coffee base and a little sting in the back of the throat. Long lasting nutty palate with a lingering aroma of hazelnut.
Bottle. Dark brownish colour. Bit sweet mildly toasted malt, caramel and nuts in the aroma. Sweet, malty, chocolate nutty flavour. Malty and nutty finish. Tasty brew!

bottle.  small, fizzy, off-white head.  clear (when held up to light) brown body.  Light aromas of chocolate, toasted malts, hazlenuts (increase with time) were all present.  flavor is lightly bitter-sweet that increases in the finish.  Dry texture.  Since I am not a big fan of browns I cannot give that high a rating, but still very easy drinking and damn good.

One of the best browns Ive had. Definiteley  has the smoothest finish of and brown ale. However, it is not quite as tasty as my favorite brown: Tommyknockers Maple Nut Brown Ale. But it is probably 2nd on my list of browns.

Definitely in my top ten all time.  Amazingly smooth, full flavoured, with an intense sweet aroma right out of the fridge that improves as it warms up.  Aroma reminds me of my moms caramel flan; wonderful sweet creamy caramel.  Flavour is more of the same with a strong hazelnut notes.  Mouthfeel is very light and smooth with a clean finish.  I wish I had a limitless supply of this stuff.  Cheers!
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2008 Reddish-brown and fairly carbonated.  Notes of nuts and honey in the aroma.  Nuts, honey, mild roast, chocolate, and barley flavour.  Smooth and refreshing.

Nutty aroma. Could be hazelnut. Deep reddish amber color with a beige head that hung around. Full mouthfeel. It really does taste like hazelnuts. Then some chocolate and dark toasted malt aspects appear. Hard to say that there is much hop to balance the malt, but its a dry finish, and its interesting.
LOVE THIS BEER.  Dark brown in color with a hazelnut/toffee aroma.  Smooth drinking with a malty, carmel taste and a mild hazelnut finish.
CBF07 sample from bottle 22 oz. Pours amber to dark brown. Aroma of malt and alcohol. Flavour is soft malty and of nuts, very balanced and soft. Finish is dry and distinct nutty.
Yeasty, roasty, nutty aroma.  Smooth sweet taste with the hazelnut flavor really showing through in the finish.  Yum.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2009 Poured a dark brown color with a thick tan colored head with a little lacing.  The aroma was of roasted malts, hazelnut, and cocoa.  The taste is sweet with the hazelnuts and nutty chocolate coming through.  Has a somewhat of a dark fruit after taste with a little sugar and some hops.  It is medium bodied with a smooth finish.  Very different for a brown ale.

Normally brown ales dont excite me too much, but this was something different.  Nice roasty, nutty, vanilla, caramel aroma.  Taste is way more than i expected, tastes like toffee/chocolate candy, and the nuttiness is present as expected.  Mouthfeel  is rich and satisfying. Loved this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2007 Yummy!  One of my top five brown ales for sure.  I had this in a bottle.  Unfiltered brown in color, with medium body.   Didnt seem to have much head retention and small lacing in the glass.  Sweet aroma, like sugar,  caramel and plum too.  similar taste, with nutty character.  Some hops present in the finish; a little bit of a bite.
I have had better.  I got a 22 oz. of this.  Silly price.  A case of them is even sillier $60.  Do not purchase.  Very sub-par.  Get Bells Brown ale...thats aaa-niiice.

poured a medium brown hue with a tan head which had great retention.   A baking cocoa mixed with a sweet nutty aroma.  Flavor was a mix of mildly bitter cocoa and a nutty presence.  Hops  were light in the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2008 Re-rate: After seeing this beer sit in my top 10 for over a year, I felt compelled to re-rate it. Given that my original score came during my first few weeks of rating, I felt fairly confident (after 800 other beers) that my original rating wouldnt hold up. I was right... It pours a clear mahogany with a creamy head which reduces to a thin cap. The nose is a roasted, slightly musty malty hazelnut. Light-bodied and creamy with a toasty finish. Sweet, toasted malt, hazelnut and toffee. This is not the amazing brew that I remember experiencing, but it is still a damned fine brown.
Original Rating from 5/6/07: Pours a dark murky brown with a medium, frothy, tan head. Aroma is of hazelnuts, toffee and raisins. It has a creamy, medium bodied and lively palate very satisfying. The taste is out of this world. Its like a warm hazelnut blanket for your tongue ending in a light hoppy finish. Lingering aftertaste is all malt. Im fairly confident that this isnt typical of the average brown ale, but if youre a fan of hazelnuts, who cares. This is, by far, one of my favorite beers. 7/4/10/5/19

Nice deep brown pour, with a medium sized med sized bubbly head that fades fast.  Aroma has a nice nutty character to the malt.  The flavor is exactly what the aroma leads you to expect.  It is nice and hadelnutty, with some good malt.  A very good Nut Brown.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2007 Pours chocolate brown with a tan medium-sized head that lasts, leaving some crusty lace. Aroma is delicious dark fruit cake, brown sugar and slight chocolate. Oh man, the flavor is the same (but not too sweet) and balanced with some just-right bittering hop on the end. Great brown-sugary nasal aftertaste like a Rochefort 10 or Chimay Blue, but the slight sugar on the tongue is balanced out well and even ends on a dry and slight sour note. Palate is medium, dry and tingly.  I dont know (or care) if this really fits the "style", but it is unlike any brown I have had, and is more similar to some strong Belgians. Awesome beer.

Bomber a while back, been trying to get around to rating all the Rogues ive had. This one wasnt bad, pours brown like stained oak or mohogany, with a small head. Sweet sugary aroma with some hops. Flavor is def. nutty with a bitter end and a nice malty mouthfeel. Nice.
Smooth, nutty, chocolately with a dark chocolately body and shallow beige head. Vague suggestion of caramel, lighter body than I expected but easy to drink in a pleasant way.
22 oz. bottle.  Poured a dark brownish-red with a small, quickly receding head.  Aroma of coffee, caramel, and hazelnuts.  Really smooth and nutty flavor, though a bit carbonated.  Good beer.
Draft-Memphis. Sensed some cinnamon in the nose but the flavor was nothing like anything I have ever tasted in a beer: Fermented Graham Cracker.
Bottle.  Wow, they said nutty and they were right.  Pours dark brown w/medium head, lots of coffee and nuts. Pretty good.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2008 650ml bottle. Clear, dark reddish body with a short lasting beige head. Aroma is roasted and slightly smoked malt and candy sugar. Flavor is sweet, roasted malt and some bitter hops in the finish. A nice and very easy to drink ale.  
Re-rated as Saturday Market Weekend Ale. Dont know if it was the environment or the fact that this was served fresh from tap, but my score increase a bit.

Aroma is roasty, nutty, and maple syrupy sweet. Pours a dark dark brown. Flavor is smooth mocha, nuttiness, and that maple syrup. WIth all that is going on in this beer, it still has that Rogue flavor. Those of you who have had quite a few Rogue Ales might be able to testify that no matter what style you are drinking, there is a similar flavor among all of their beers. This is a pretty filling brew as well, but it is incredibly smooth on the palate. Probably one of the smoothest. Overall, a very fine brown ale.
This beer is one of my all time favorite brews. The hazelnut is sweet though not overpowering and the after taste is perfectly dry.
Bottle.1 Pint 6 FL. OZ. Dark brown color with little head.  Nutty, malty aroma with hints of dried fruit.  Nice amount of carbonation.  Flavor is sweet with a dry finish.  Pretty average.
From Bottle, pours with a large frothy light brown head and dark brown body.  Sweet and nutty malt flavor with a long lasting finish.
22 oz bottle. Nutty, sweet malt profile. Sweet from start to finish. Very nice malt flavor but lacking in hops by my tastes. Not enough hop profile to balance with the malt sweetness

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2012 From a 22 oz bottle poured a deep and very clear red with a tan head that left almost no lacing.  Rich nose of hazelnuts, and malts. Some whiffs of fruit.  Mouthfeel is a a bit cloying.  Flavors are fairly complex, and after you get past the hazelnuts, which tends to dominate, you can detect chocolate, coffee, fruits, molasses, and the tiniest bit of hops.  Finish is a bit sweet.  Not your ordinary brown, and hard to rate in the category, but without concern for its type, it is an interesting brew, particularly if you like hazelnuts.

This is a re-rate after having this on Draft at the Local Beer Bar in Eureka, CA.  There is nothing like fresh draft to move a beer to the head of the class. This was really crisp and flavorful, with not of the cloying aspects that bothered me five years ago from the bottle. Really tasty.

Bottle. 43 days past bet before. Pours a deep ruby/brown with a light brown head. Sweetish malty aroma with fruity notes. Sweetish, fruity and malty flavour with coffee and licorice notes. Finish is dry and medium bitter with coffee notes at first. As it warms, notes of apple, fruity notes and faint hints of vanilla are revealed. Becomes a bit cloying in the long run. Too much carbonation. 13-04-07.
The hazlenut of this beer gets you at the finish, which is smooth and pleasant.  Beautiful color and head.
This is a delicious beer.  The aroma is pure sweet hazelnuttiness as is the flavor.  Very understated hops.  Just a hint of rootbeer on the finish.
This brown ale poured a dark brown with a thin head. It has a nutty smell with a smooth molasses taste. Sweet easy, good finish.
The smell is fantastic, but the sweetness of the hazlenut is a bit too strong; which Ive found is typical with rogue.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2008 Nice deep brown head that left sight quite quickly.  Deep hazelnut smell, sweet, nutty, molasses, tootsy roll.  Bold and smooth in taste.  Exactly what youd expect.  Minor metallic but very unique for a brown style ale.

This was an excellent brown ale.  Poured a deep brown color with a tan head.  I tasted nuts, chocolate, and malts.  Very nutty finish with a small alchol taste.  This was easy drinking and a sweet nut brown ale.  Well done.

Huge, rocky, somewhat quickly dissipating head, amber brown colour. Complex flavour: I detected variously Tootsie Roll, cotton candy, licorice, chocolate milt, molasses (thanks Em). Nuts! Bit of a mildly sour finish and some metallic notes, especially in the smell. Surprisingly mild for a Rogue product, but it really boosts the profile of the dreaded "Brown Ale." Very enjoyable.
On draft, poured a dark red color with small head. A small taste of honey flavor along with a heavy caramal taste. I thought this was a really enjoyed and very drinkable beer.

A dark orange color with what started to be a massive foamy head that slowly faded to a small tan head. Sweet molasses, nutty vanilla. Reminds me of one of those "International Delight" flavored coffees. Sweet, similar to one of those unusual fillings in the Whitman or Sees candy gift boxes. Something fluffy, nougat (what is nougat anyways?) sweet but odd. Not my favorite, drop the hazelnut and kick up the ABV to 9% and I might like it much better.
Clear ruby/brown with a small tan head. The aroma is caramel, toffee and nuts. The flavor is hazel nuts, cola, toffee, pacman yeast (chalk) and light grassy hops. Medium body with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Brown color with a average fizzy fair lacing off-white to light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty and hoppy, vanila, nutty. flavor is heavy sweet  and light to moderate bitter with a long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finsih feel is light alcoholic. :o)

Bottle. Nose is caramel, hazelnut, chocolate, and maybe a hint of raspberry. Pours a beautiful brown-amber with a quickly settling head, but heavy and intense carbonation. Flavor is intense, dark chocolate and hazelnut. Sweet but well balanced. Palate is smooth with a nice crisp finish.

Too thin for me. I wish this were a bit thicker. I wasnt as impressed with this beer, as I have been with some of Rogues beers. This aroma really doesnt com out until you let the beer a warm a bit. After that, you can smell nuts. The color is a dark brown, that looks really nice, and serves a Hazelnut beer right. I could taste the nutty flavor. It opens up in your mouth like crazy. This was the same experience I had with the chocolate stout. The flavor is impressive. I wouldnt say it is too sweet. I mean come on were talking about Hazelnut Ale here. The palate did not impress me. Rogue has the opportunity to make better beers that are full of flavor, yet I am constantly disappointed by the thin consistency of their beers. I must say though that Rogue often impresses me with their willingness to experiment with new flavors. O.K. beer, but nothing to go wet your pants over.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2010 re-rate. Pours brown with small white head. Sweet aroma. Thin mouthfeel with moderate carbo. Very sweet flavor and not much left on the palet, used to like this beer.

A beer I have drank many times, but somehow have not rated. Well, heres to changing that: Bottle, pours dark brown with a tight medium sized tan head. The aroma is sweet malts, hazelnuts, and a hop presence that is nicely placed. Flavor is again sweet caramel malts, chocolate, the hazelnut factor, and a nice Euro hop tinge finishes it out. This could be one of the best beers to introduce newbies into the world of craft brewing.
Nice dark brown appearance.  Moderate nutty taste little bit of coffee flavor.  Creamy lasting head. Overall very enjoyable.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2007 Bottle.Dark brown.tan head.Sweet,nutty aroma.Caramel,brown sugar flavors apparent.Very enjoyable,not to sweet.Well done.

Im always leary of flavors that arent the norm, but this one held out nicely.  I do love hazelnuts, and hazelnut coffee, but beer?  I had my reservations.  However the aroma and flavor were definitive yet not overwhelming, the nutty malty flavor a nice compliment.  Dark brown, solid firm head, nutty malty flavor.  Excellent beer.
As you would hope, the hazelnut is apparent in the smell.  The ale is dark brown and after pouring it, I was drawn to the color.  Delicious flavors, incredible taste, this is what beer is about.

Pours a fantastic dark brown color.  Aroma is indeed hazelnut----smells much like amaretto, very nice.  Flavor is choc., nut, caramel-----just unbelievable.  Nice and strong brew.  Will drink this one again soon.

The hazelnut aroma is the perfect complement to the delightful chocolate/carmel/cofee flavors. Great full body with a lingering malty finish.This beer is an experience that you owe yourself. Hands down my favorite beer at the moment.
Pours a deep dark brown wit a tan foamy head. Aroma of malt, coffee. Tastes of carmel, chocolate, coffee, a roasty flavor, sweet, very smooth and creamy. A real solid Ale!

Pour is a fairly dark reddish brown with a light tan head.  Aroma of nutty malt, hazelnut, chocolate, and a little vanilla.  Nice flavor of coffee, roast malt, nuts, and chocolate.  A very nice brown ale.

22oz. Bomber
$4.99
Health Mart

Rogues Hazelnut Nectar poured really attractive looking dark brown. Clear with rusty highlights when held to the light. Two finger creamy tan head. Light carbonation coming up from spots all over the glass.

Smells of dough, sweet malts and a touch of hazelnut. The more I take in the more I get chocolate and some vanilla even. Smells Good. Almost like a dessert. 

The taste really stands out. Theres a wonderful doughy quality followed by the hazelnut. There is an incredible smoothness with this beer. Really tastes good.

The mouthfeel, in my opinion, is perfect. Its a nice medium body. A little chewy and super smooth. Its like velvet in my mouth.

Drinkability is way up there on this one too. It would be extremely easy to sit back and enjoy a few of these with no problem at all.

Hazelnut Nectar is The best brown ale Ive ever had. Another great tasting exciting beer from Rogue.

Sampled 10/7/06
A lot of these brown ales, esp. w/ a flavor, are too much.  The flavor hits too hard and has no subltety.  This one gets it right.  Give it a try
Nice hazelnut in aroma and flavor.  Sweet with some chocolate aroma.  Nice and lite on the hops, making it one of my favorite rogues.

Pours out a typical brown color forming little/no foam.  Aroma of malt, chocolates, woods, ocean, wet forrest and hops!  Flavor full of hazelnuts!  A lovely browne ale, malt and hops perfectly balance out the beer, bringing a full bodied ale that can be appreciated.   Once again Rogue puts out ANOTHER great beer, damn those guys up there in the majestic NW can make some beer dammit!
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: An fruity aroma is full of hops spices and currants. Pour is dark brown and settles into a nice thick beer. Has a nice mouthfeel and goes down smoothly with a little bit of aftertaste. Flavor is excellent and has a nice hoppy hint. A great beer, better than newcastle.
one of my favorite Brown Ales. Its pretty.....pretty.....pretty....pretty..... delicious.
Sweet, smooth brown ale with more than a hint of hazelnut.  Good stuff.  (Could use a tad more carbonation to spice it up and offset the sweetness.)
This does have a lot of hazelnut in the flavor and aroma.  A sweet beer, nutty flavor.  some butter.   Not really thick enough to be called a nectar.

Deep red to leather brown body with a thin tan head. A little lacing. Aroma is malty, nutty and with noticable hops present and hints of coffee and chocolate. Flavor has hazelnuts, oakleaves, glue and salt. Fairly thin, even a bit watery texture. Fishy, caramelly aftertaste. Good, but not entirely convincing.

Tap. Deep beautiful hazelnut color, duh. The head is very milky coffee colored that slips from the surface, but clings to the edge. The nose is mostly of smoke, surprisingly light. Tastes smokey cedar with light accents of pine with a nice nutty blend. Leaves you feeling refreshed and thirsty for more.

Pours a deep nutty brown color with a dusty brown head. Very aromatic beer with molasses,coffee,pine,nuts,and a lot of hazelnut notes. Flavors of caramel, milk, chocolate, maple, and honey. Very well rounded and robust with a touch of hops. Truly a nectar of the gods

22 oz bomber bottle.  Pours nearly black and thick from the bottle.  First sniff - Chocolate in a glass.  Nice roastiness, with hops well in background.  Rich and malty, almost chewy.  Chocolate extract is well balanced with the hazelnut extract.  This drinks smooth.  Another of my all time favorites.

Smells good, looks nice, possibly the worst beer Ive had in recent memory. I love Rogue Brewing but this stuff is not good - sickly sweet, one dimensional. Rests on your palate all wrong. Like whipped butter and hazelnuts. Unfortunate.
Dark brown.  Pungent sweet hazelnut aroma.  Pungent sweet hazelnut taste.  One dimensional, extrememly malty brown ale.

Mahogany with a red hue and an incredibly delicious and creamy head. The aroma is full and nutty with notes of sweet coffee. The flavour is fantastic and very well balanced and incredibly smooth, full-bodied and practically without any bitterness. It has notes of nuts, chocolate, sweet coffee, Red Caledonian pipe tobacco and a very long finish. A work of art in bottle - and every mouthful makes me go: AHHH....
Pours a dark brown with a short-lived brown head. Malty hazelnut flavor with caramel also predominant. Smooth feel - very drinkable.
Dark ruby with an off-white head. Intense aroma of molasses, malt and caramel. Sweet flavour with nuts and caramel, going into a dry finish. Too sweet and simple for me.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2007 Bottle.  Very dark red with a medium sized head that disappears quick.  Smells like hazelnut. Nice, sweet taste of nuts and carmel.  A very nice brown ale.

Poured from bottle...Beautiful reddish brown color, large beige head that stayed a while...This was a very unique tasting beer...Sweet, creamy,LOTS of malt flavors, some coffee and chocolate...Didnt taste the hazlenut right away, it came in a little later for me. I agree with the other raters, this would be a great after dinner beer...
Had on tap at the flying saucer in houston.  Beautiful color with a nice creaminess.  not to sweet just the right amount of nuttiness.  would be a nice beer for dessert.

Takes browns to a place seldom though of and rarely visited, one that I Really like. At least the first pint of it. 

Hazy brown, strong hazelnut flavor that following their chocolate would be a great dessert.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2008 Loads of hazelnut, and sweet malt, a touch of hops. pours a drk brown, brownish white head. 
flavour hits you in a big way! lots of hazelnut! wow! very sweet, almost a desert beer. nice stuff..

22oz bomber, no date.  Pours a slightly hazy brown with ruby highlights and a slowly fading beige head.  Aroma has quite a bit of hazelnuts, some bready malts, a bit of yeast and grassy hops.  Flavor is much the same with some roasty malts coming through as well.  There was some slight acidity toward the finish.  Some sweetness noted.  Medium bodied with low carbonation, smooth body.  The only other hazelnut beer Ive had was the Berghoff, and this is better--much better.  Was impressed with this.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: This is a great Oregon beer, excellent longevity of flavors, has been hard to find in Chicago. I would suggest stopping by the Rogue brewery if one had the chance.

Hazy deep red/brown with a medium head. No lacing. Aroma is hazelnuts and roasted malts, chocolate malts and a little vanilla. Im really surprised that more brewers arent using hazelnuts, because this tastes terrific. Rich and creamy.  But its very sweet. Probably not a session beer.
I liked this one. Has a good hazelnut flavor along with some chocolate notes. Nice sweet but not too sweet beer.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2009 Bottle: 650 ml. Dark brown (reddish) 
Fine creamy head. An amazing malty beer with a flavor and taste of caramel, nougat, white chocholate and hazel nuts (of course). Some may criticize it for lacking bitterness and hoppy character, but I think its perfect as a sweet not bitter brown ale.

I must have not been drinking the same brew as everybody else.  Draught.  Dark brown, no head.  Pleasant nutty aroma.  Flavor is sweet and pungent with an offensive quality I cant discribe.  Syrupy mouthfeel.  I took three drinks of this and decided I couldnt drink it any more.  My friend drank the rest and loved it but I must say I was dissapointed.

Dark brown ale with a golden tan head that dissolves quickly. Taste of dark chocolate, almond, and obviously hazelnut. This beer definitely reminds me of an iced hazelnut coffee, maybe even a little mocha. I like the uniqueness of the taste, but cant decide if Im a fan or if it is just something different

Bottled. Another good beer by rogue. Ruby color with brown thin head. Chocolate / nut and roasted aromas were detected. A little thin in the body but a smooth nutty taste with a hint of sweetness.

Good brew.
nice brown colour, some head. nutty nose light carbonation found it slightly bland. one of my least favourite rogue beers. at joes

22 oz. bottle.  As soon as I took my first taste of this one, I knew it was unique among the brown ales Ive tried.  Poured a nice dark brown with a good portion of tan head.  The aroma seemed somewhat subdued, with slight nuttiness in the nose.  But the taste!  After letting it sit on my tongue for a second or two, I was hit with an enormous sweet hazelnut flavor; it was unreal.  Definitely the strongest flavor Ive experienced in a beer.  After the initial hazelnut punch, some coffee made an appearance on the back of my tongue.  The finish was smooth and malty.  Though Rogue suggests serving this beer with pork or beef, I must disagree.  I think this beer is too sweet to mesh well with dinner.  Id personally prefer it with dessert.  I just wish the aroma was more assertive.

Well my high score definately reflects personal opinion on this one.  The hazelnut and sweet spices come thorugh nicely.  It reminds me of eatig cinnamon toast as a kid.  The mouthfeel is lightand the finish is clean and doesnt linger for too long.  Its not hopped very much as the bitterness is not very noticable, but honestly I like that in this particlar beer.
Bottle. Nice head with ok duration. Color is darkbrown. Aroma is mainly chocolate. Taste is chocolate with some toffee.

smells like karo syrup.  dark amber appearance with a big tan head.  watery karo syrup taste.  im told that this is the benchmark for the style.  to be honest, im not impressed.  i guess im too  damn hard to please

Bottled under the Morimoto alias.  A beautiful beer that goes from amber to a deep red.  Aromas of nuts and malt that is hearty and fantastic.  This beer is simple sublime with its coffee and nut flavors that give way to a smooth nut aftertaste after a light initial bite.  A hoppy aftertaste also ties this back to beer instead of hazelnut coffee.  A perfect beer.

Bottle into mug - Another disappointment from Rogue iMo. How many of us out there like Hazelnut Coffee Mate in our coffee? and how many of us appreciate a good brown ale? I sure do...so I was thinking this was gonna be a personal fave of mine. But noooo. Like I said in another Rogue rating of mine...I will finally try their Shakespeare Stout...and if it doesnt deliver..well..its gonna be curtains.

Bottled. Deep brown color with creamy tan head. Sweetish, nutty and chocolatey aroma with soft roastedness. Very pleasant aroma. Sweet, chocolatey, nutty and very soft flavor. Slightly fruity, little bitterness. Very long hazelnut finish. A bit too sweet.
I like this beer alot, but its a little too sweet for me. I think that this beer is very good for its style though and I do pick one up occasionally. Rogue does good work.
Very good looking. But too sweet. Could be more hoppy and "strong" in its character. For me, its an okay beer for the style.

Pours dark copper brown with minimal off-white head. Aromais lightly sweet malts and a little nutty. Flavor is basically the same as the aroma. Palate is clean, but a little thin. Pretty standard Rogue, enjoyable, but still a little tame.
On tap @ coles. Buffalo, NY. Dark brown in color with white head. Nutty aroma, hence the name I suppose. Nice smooth body with balance & smooth finish

Dark brown with fine white head. Roasted malts. Nuts, caramel & chocolate. Sweetness. Very hoppy for a brown ale (Like that a lot) Smooth texture. Very fine balanced. Nothing abstract but Very pleasant. Great Brown Ale!
Dark brown with a offwhite head. Chocolate, nutty, bourbon and slight spice. Nice smooth mouthfeel.
I liked this a lot (especially when it warmed).  raisiny malt sweetness, a little roast, hazelnut nuttiness.  very tasty

22oz. bottle - pours a deep brown with red highlights throughout and a very minimal, quickly dissipating head on top. Lots of nutty, hazelnut in the aroma along with some sweet roasted malt. Light chocolate. Flavour is an immediate big hit of hazelnut, almost like drinking a jar of nutella, but then becomes more complex with some deeper chocolate, malt, and a faint hoppiness which contributes just the right amount of bitterness to the finish. A very fine beer, like a desert, with a sweetness that is never cloying. Quite sessionable actually; I could drink a lot of this. In retrospect, it may be my favourite Rogue Ale...or maybe it was just exactly what I wanted on this occasion.

22 oz bottle:  Almost a coca-cola like pour with a cloudy brown pour with a very minimal head that is gone rather quickly.  Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, definite hazelnut scent, and maybe some light chocolate notes.  Taste is upfront theres a definite hazelnut overtone, and a nice caramel note, malts, and the hops is very slightly subdued but very nice as well.  Palate is carbonated almost like soda.  Overall,  This would be a magnificent session beer because I could drink this like soda-pop.  Nice Nut Brown!!
Hazelnut aroma, pleasant nutty taste with hints of caramel.  Great palate and exceedingly smooth and drinkable. Nothing mindblowing but very enjoyable nonetheless.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2007 Flavor:  complex; hazelnut brown nectar describe it perfectly; sweet and malty.  Aroma:  somewhat similar to Samuel Smiths Oatmeal Stout (if memory serves); smells of hazelnuts and a little bit of honey.  Appearance:  nice tan head that dissipates rather quickly, thin lacing, a darker caramel in color; a lot of carbonation.  If you dont like heavy ales, this is the beer for you.  I thoroughly enjoyed it, and I recommend it.

Pours dark brown with thick tan head that fades quickly. Aroma is sweet with candied hazelnuts, toffee, and fruity malts. Flavor is nutty with caramel and sweet malts. The middle of the tongue detects a spicey malt profile and floral and fruity hops. The finish is sweet and nutty, but with a distinct (though mild) taste of hops. The mouthfeel is at first watery but feels full, though slightly under-carbonated, on the middle and back of the tongue. A well-balanced beer and quite drinkable.

Faint smell of hazelnuts. VERY drinkable. A rich nutty ale. Ruby brown color. Light tan head. I really like this, slightly less than Goose Island Hexnut brown though. Good stuff.

I would however agree that this beer IS in fact un-complex. That, however, is not a bad thing.  This beer may get boring after a while, but you can drink another beer for a while and come back to it later. I dont think simple is bad unless it tastes bad. This stuff is good.

Bottle.   Pours a relatively clear dark brown with a small tan head that doesnt last.   Aroma is nuts, choclate, malt.   Taste is rich hazelnut, caramel, coffee, chocolate, malt.   Palate is smooth and slightly less than medium with not a ton of carbonation.   This is very good, would have probably rated higher but palate let me down a bit.
This shit is the bomb!  I love this beer, nice hazlenut taste.  Screw all you "Beer Snobs" that say its "uncomplex" get a life this shit is great!
user_location: New York City, New York, USA

text: Nice darker beer with hints of nuts, muted hops, and molasses like sweetness.  Unique beer that is not too heavy.
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2006 Bueno.  Brown color (surprised).  Tastes nutty and bitter the way the style should be.  Head fades and its somewhat lighter than I expected, but very nice anyway.

Pours deep amber into a shaker.  Tan micro head recedes at a medium pace with no lacing.  Butterscotch, hazelnut and malt aromas.  Creamy sweet hazelnut which turns sour and then into a bitter lasting chocolate finish.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with a quickly disappearing head.  Aroma of nuts and grainy malts.  Flavor is of hazelnut, nutmeg, chocolate malt, light molasses, and a hint of sweet fruit.  Light to medium bodied palate that makes it easy to drink and full of flavor.  Alcohol comes out in the finish but is very light.  A great brew, Id recommend.
I dont get it. Not much of an aroma or palette. The flavor is subtle hazelnut, but not a lot else. Uncomplex.
22 oz. bottle (as Morimoto).  Dark brown, small off-white head.  Hazel Nut aromas, with a great flavor of chocolates, hazelnut, and nutmeg. Nice sweet flavor barely tastes like alcohol at all.

On tap at the Broadway Brewhouse & Mojo Grille (Downtown), Nashville, Tennessee. Pours dark brown with a thin, off-white head. Nutmeg, malt, and chocolate notes in flavor, with a soft mouthfeel and dry finish.

Bomber bottle, poured dark brown and some amber, few bubbles,
nose of chocolate, hint of nuts, malt sweet, and semi-sweet chocolate,
taste of dark malts, coffee, hint of cherry, little sweet malt flavor, 
some bitterness on the tongue, nice drink.

Pours a dark brown with red tendencies; head is fairly small and off-white with little lasting ability.  Fruitiness in the nose is noticible right away, with notes of hazlenut (obviously), toffee, choclate, and some dates and fig, as if from a Belgian dark.  Flavor is not quite the same, but chocloate dominates with toffee, hazlenut, date, and an earthy, root flavor; bitterness is low.  Palate is medium with moderate carbonation and a watery, slick feel.  Finishes earthy and chocolatey with dryness.  One of a kind brown ale with some intiguing qualities, especially the nose, nut the finish and lack of balance really kills it for me.  Plenty of charcter and better than most browns.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2009 Sampled from tap on 11/09/2006 at Dilly Deli... 

Color is brown and clear with a nice, off-white head.  Aroma is hazelnut with hints of chocolate.  Flavor is a very nice, nutty hazelnut with a bit of sweetness and chocolate to it.  Very enjoyable and quite smooth and easy to drink!

16 fl oz draught, $4.00 at Dilly Deli.

. . . . . . . . . .
6/21/2008:  Rogue Hazelnut Brown has a sweet hazelnut aroma and tastes nutty and a lot like Nutella.  It is balanced overall and has a dry coffee-like finish.  It is medium-bodied, clear, deep golden-caramel in color, and has a khaki head.  Always good!

22 fl. oz. bottle (14° Plato, 33 IBU, 73.6 AA, 36° L) enjoyed during the Grand Banquet at the 2009 American Homebrewers Association Conference in Cincinnati, Ohio.
Light, raisin, a little christmas feelingt, watery, smell almost like an dark sweet belgium beer, no special hazelnut here
Pours dark bown with beige head. Stunning aroma with caramel, some coffee and a little flowery tones. Taste is very full, complex with caramel and coffee.
The carbonation is overdone, and ruins the beer. A letdown considering I orderd it online and waiting a while to get it. Other than that though, it was a very nice brown ale.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Hazelnut aroma and flavor. Flavor was somewhat simple, and too much carbonation. Didnt think much of it.
Sampled at an American Beer Tasting Event but unfortunately I forgot my notes. The added hazelnut oil is clear in both aroma and flavour - in a good way. However, not too interesting...
650ml - Brown liguid with cream clored head, nutty and woody nose.  Pronounced hazelnut and chocolate on palate fading to a creamy finish.  Funky but good.

Honestly, Im not a fan of browns.  Its just a really boring style to me.  This beer, however... this beer, is not boring.  Pours a ruby/brown body with a tan head.  Nose is sweet and mellow.  Great fragrance.  Flavor is sweet.  Chocolates, hazelnuts... Nutella?  Very Earthy at the same time.  Finishes dry.  The bitterness is negligible.  Very agreeable.  The flavor suffers a bit in that it isnt as complex as it could or maybe should be.  It tastes clean, almost sterilized.  Will I buy this again?  Oh yeah.  Tasty treat.

Bomber. Astonishingly good for a brown. Pours deep mahogany with a SuperFund-size billowing tan head. Sweet, chocolatey, lightly filbert-y (the northwest name for "hazelnuts") nose. Fairly light body, medium carb. Sweet, gentle, almost neutral attack that gives way quickly to sweet malts on the mid palate. This is really, really flavorful for a brown, but no matter how many dull browns youve had, it still tastes like one. Oddly enough. Clean, neutral finish. Good stuff.

Bottle:  Roasted hazelnut aroma with moderate vanilla,  chocoalte, and caramel.    Pours a transparent reddish-brown with a small beige head.  Flavor starts with roasty hazelnut and moderate vanilla.  Hints of chocolate and caramel in the background.  Finishes with a real light grassy bitterness.   Definitely one of the better brown ales out there.

I just moved into Portland so Im having my fair mix of Rogue brews.  The only other Rogue I have had before moving was their Dead Guy Ale... I am thoroughly impressed with both of them.  This beer had a dark amber/brown color, slightly transparent.  The guy right next to me was smoking at the bar I couldnt get a good sniff because my nose was all crazy. Head was a little thin but a bright contrast white compared to the beer. Taste of course had hazelnut but there was another sweetness in there, almost like cramel or toffee.  Very sweet! Extremely smooth and nothing but joy as I drank the beer.

As my wife stated the rating before, this poured a brown-amber color and it had a pretty minimal off-white head that dissipated pretty quickly.  The flavor was pretty smooth, slightly sweet, with a hazelnut aftertaste.  Medium character, not too complex.

With a nice hazelnut aroma, this poured a brown-amber color and had minimal white head. The flavor was sweet, nutty and malty. Smooth, slightly carbonated palate, and nicely balanced all around. Very drinkable and quite enjoyable on a fall evening.
Good but I didnt like it as well as the Lost Coast Downtown Brown.  It had a stronger after taste.

Bomber courtesy of ford9719.  Pours brown, with an amber tint, with a finger of tan head.  Chocolate, nutty notes.  Smooth with chocolate accents. Malts are wells balanced.  Very clean brown, a fine beer.

1 finger head. the chocolate aroma and taste is very present. Very dark but not to thick. A beer that i could drink every day and also I think that this would be a beer that you could buy and let age for a year and then that it will be better.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2008 Great aroma a sweet, brown-sugar scent. Color is a brown-red. Taste is quite nutty with a molasses finish. Light hop flavor on the tail end  very drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2007 22 oz "Morimoto" Bomber.  Dark brown pour with light head.  Rich, toasted-malty aroma.  Pleasant body/mouthfeel/finish thats pretty good for the style.  Flavor is deep, rich, & malty.  Brown ales are typically pretty bland, but this one stacks up nicely.
Poured with a quickly dissipating tan head.  Smell and flavor was nice...the hazelnut was there, but not overpowering, as one might think.  Nice and creamy...

Good stuff!  On draught from the brewer at the Floyd Fandango.  A deep walnut-cherry pour with a slightly offwhite head that retains 1/8" lace all the way down the glass.  LOTS of fresh-roasted hazelnuts to the nose.  The flavor is slightly nutty, with pale malts and a dry-hopped hazelnut mid-palate.  Hazelnut really pours on the effervescence at the end of the pull.  There are some slight nut aftereffects, as well.  Its not cloying in any way, with a comforting personality, medium-body and a nice offering of uniqueness to a very broad style.  Makes for a nice session brew.

650ml brown bottle. Deep red brown colour, head was small and thin, dark beige in colour. Malty aroma, hint of chocolate and toffee and hazelnuts. Flavour is similar with chocolate and toffeeish malts, some sweetness. Toasty and nutty dry finish, slightly woody. Softly carbonated, medium body.
It had a thick tan head when I poured it.  Roasted nut aroma and taste.  Very malty.  Overall, a pretty nice brown ale.

Medium brown with carmel coloring, pours with a thick tan head that quickly thins out.  Mild nutty flavor with light hints of coffee and a roasted malt finish.  A touch sweet (but not too much), very smooth and enjoyable; a nice brown ale.

Pours to a dark brown color with ruby tint, and a thick off-white head that lingers for most of the glass and leads to good lacing. Nice, sweet, malty aroma of roasted nuts and hints of chocolate. Flavor is more of the malty sweet roasted-nut flavor. Some alcohol blended in nicely at mid-glass, all which contributed to a good long finish. Im normally not a fan of brown ales, but I really enjoyed this one.

Bomber. Certainly on the sweeter side, not belgian sweet but in that direction. easy to taste alot of overtones, coffee, hazelnut, toffee, caramel. Its smooth and easy drinking. Would probably go really nice in winter when its chilly and dark beers are welcome.
Pours reddish brown with a tan head.  Aroma is sweet.  Flavor is sweet, hazelnut, some roasts, toffee and some nuttiness. Very creamy.  Very interesting.
A very enjoyable brew.  Wonderful aroma of Hazlenut and malts.  Brown color, smooth finish
Bottle at RBESG-06,GTN. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is hazelnut, roasted, caramel, malt. Flavour is sweet, hazelnut, caramel, hop, roasted, malt.

Draft. Dark brown with nice size tan head. Smells mildly of roasted malts. The taste is creamy, nutty, and buttery. How does rogue get that buttery flavor in some of their beers? Nice body and smooth finish.

Not impressive.  Too many nutty things going on here.  Aroma of slight nuts and dirt which morphs slightly over the palate to a generally bland taste.  Once you start this, dont change your palate with another offering... its all or nothing.

Poured a dark brown with a thin fizzy head from the Morimoto Hazelnut bomber.  Smells slightly nutty, roasted, fruity, no hops.  Chocolate flavor, you can definitely taste the hazelnuts.  Creamy texture, despite the watery appearance.  Clean and smooth on the palate.  Very nice beer, nutty but different than other roasted nutty beers.

Bottled at RBESG-06, GTN. Hazy, brown beer with an orange hue and a beige head. Mellow roasted aroma with caramel and sugar. Roasted and caramelly flavor as well, with spces and notes of dried fruits. I could use some more body. The finish is roasted and bitter in a pleasant way. (060826)

Bottled.
Dark muddy brown color, very small off-white head. Nutty, roasted aroma. Sweet hazelnut flavor. Medium-bodied. Very long nutty, hazelnut aftertaste.

(Bottle) Pours brown with a good-looking beige head. Sweet malts dominate the flavor, but it is by no means cloying. Relatively high level of carbonation. Rich mouthfeel and pretty smooth as well. Definitely a great beer!
Bottle. The best brown ale I have tasted in my brief career.  Hands down more body, flavor, taste and aroma than other browns.  Very sweet, very nutty, very malty.  Delicious - a must try!

I really enjoyed this beer.  On the pour, creamy with a small head.  Very dark and translucent.  Aroma of carmel, coffee, nutty, and toffee. Initial tastes are slightly sweet, a complex mix of carmel, toffee, little bit of chocolate, maybe some fruit in there. Slightly bitter on the palate, but very refreshing.  The flavor is incredibly balanced, and delicate.  I dont agree with  the posts that say this beer is overpowering or unbalanced, because its not.  This may be a drink that youre average beer drinker wouldnt like, but I think its great, and well deserving of the 95% it received.

It was dark brown and cloudy with a quickly disappearing head. The malt flavor seemed stronger than a classic brown and the hops were about what I expected in brown. The overall effect was unbalanced, perhaps influenced by the uncompensated nut sweetness

22 oz. bottle from THE beer store in Jacksonville: Total Wine.  Pours a nice dark brown with a light tan head.  Aroma is sweet, with a hint of hops.  Flavor is KICK ASS.  Nice taste of chocolate and hazelnut.  Finish is nice.  Without a doubt, THE best brown ale out there.  They should put this in a six pack.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a nice tan head on top. Aroma is malts, hazelnut, brown sugar, and hints of hops. Flavor is nutty, hazelnuts, cappucino, sweet malts, and hints of hops to bitter out just a bit. Definitely enjoy the twist with the hazelnut in there. Defniitely gives the beer great taste. By far the best brown ale out there in my opinion.

Brew-Ha-Ha 2006 from a bottle.  I like brown ales and I like Hazelnut, so this was a nice tasting beer for me.  Im surprised Id never tried this one before now.  malty rich flavor with chocolate and hazelnut.  nicely done.

Poured a dark brown with a pronounced reddish hue. The head was tan and short lived and left no lacing. The aroma was fantastic, notes of floral hops and complex malt. Tasted lightly of hazelnut, light hops, and sweet malts. As close to a perfect balance as one can get. The palate was a tad thin, but nothing major. The finish was perfect too, a fantastic balance of finishing hops and malts. A fantastic beer.

Pours a nice dark, and mostly clear brown, with a large tan head, leaving a good lacing as it fades.  Aroma is hazelnutty, of course, with some other cappucino-esque scents coming through.  Taste becomes more malty, and the feel is a lot creamier than I would expect with any brown ale.  A subtle sweetness coats the mouth as well, providing some caramel and toffee flavors.  With all the differen malts going into this beer, the variety of malty tastes is not surprising, but its still impressive.  The hazelnut flavors became apparanty as soon as I swallowed, making for a real nice dessert-like finish.  No real hops noticed, any bitterness seemed only to accentuate the malts.  This beer is much better than I remember from my beer-tasting infancy.  Kudos to Rogue for doing something real nice and smooth, and keeping the IBUs away from where they dont belong!
Reddish brown in colour. Maple syrup /brown sugar aroma. Sweet flavour with notes of brown sugar , vanilla, and a mild bitter finish.

On tap poured brown in color with a huge tan head with great lacing on the glass. The aroma had some chocolate and roast dominated by sweet hazelnut. The taste was mainly nutty with some small caramel tones and no noticeable hops. Overall a good tasting beer that is smooth and surprisingly not overpowering.
On tap. This beer was a very good night cap, rich with good amount of sweetness but crisp finish
Hazelnut brown, hazelnut & chocolate in aroma. Slight malty. Really nutty with notes of chocolate. Good bitterness in finish.

Pours to dark mahogany with a meringue-ish head.  Hazelnut aroma with plum and vanilla.  Flavor is more hazelnut, some red grape skins, nutella, some woodsy scotch tones.  Winey mouthfeel, heavy but smooth.  Long chocolate malt finish.  Quite complex and very good brown ale.
Cold on tap at Redbones:  Pours a dark opaque brown color with a small amount of off-white bubbles around the edges.  Aroma and taste are of hazelnut and roasted malts. A very rich dark ale.

Bottled. Brownish amber colour, mediumsized beige head. Aroma of caramel, candy sugar, toffee and alcohol. Flavour is plum, grass, alcohol, caramel, some flowery hops and sugar. Quite much in it, and also very wellbalanced.

Another personal favourite. I reckon it is not everyones cup of tea, but I do so fancy the slight sweetness and clear Nutella overtones in the taste. Some malt, as well, and so very smooth. I could session this ale for a fornight.

22oz bottle.  Very dark brown in color.  Medium aroma of hazelnuts.  Rich flavor with a filberty finish.  Malty and sweet with a very nice balanced hoppier finsih, still sweet.  Great beer fro converting Younglings.
Dark brown color with a small offwhite head.Lots of hazelnut and caramel notes. Medium body with a lot of malt sweetness. Some bitterness in the end.

The pinnacle of the brown ale world...draft at The Usual Suspects in Asheville, NC many times during my college career...intense caramel and hazelnut flavor, every brown ale should aspire to this masterpiece.

Wow this is one of the more original tasting beers Ive had!  Earthy aroma with some cherries.  Reddish brown with a nice real head.  Malty taste and can really taste the chocolate malt.  Nutty taste towards the end along with a tiny bit of grain and hops.  A tiny bit thin of a beer but still very worthwhile.

I didnt know what to expect from this beer, the last time I had hazlenut flavor was in my coffee. Poured a brown/red with an off white head. Aroma of a mellow hazlenut, caramel and malts was quite intoxicating in itself. The flavor was nutty, earthy and malty with a slight bitterness in the end, leaving a hazlenut aftertaste. I thought it would make a nice dessert beer, but I doubt I would drink more than one at a sitting

bottle.  cranberry/brown pour with thin bubbled tan head.  caramel, hazelnut, malts, sugar, oak and hop aroma.  creamy taste with hazelnut, sugar and malts.  lingering aftertaste.  Reminds me of flavored coffee.

I used to really like this. Maybe it was because one version of it has Iron Chefs Miromoto on the bottle. Image is everything!
Otherwise, a decent brown.
Bottle. Hazelnut ooh yes, another nice beer, but not the best from Rogue. it is a bit thin in the body.

Another nice beer from Rogue.  This could be a bigger beer.  Its a lovely dark brown but a little short on flavor and nose.  It finishes better than it starts.  The taste starts off very mild.  The hazlenut comes on next, followed by a malty ale taste.  The finish is a little bitter

750mL bomber. Poured a dark reddish brown with a fairly decent coffee and cream head. Scents are powerful mocha, hazelnut (obviously), some malty sweetness and some yeast. Taste is great, like a coffee beer. Nice warm mouthfeel with a slight biting dryness towards the end. Finishes smooth and delcious.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2006 Bottle, purchased at The Still in Irvine, CA and consumed on 8/14/06.  Ive had this beer many times and I think it is one of my favorite browns.  Pours light brown with a large but thin head.    This is a delicious light tasting beer that has a sweet hazelnut feeling.  It is drinkable and great.

22 oz bottle. Large beige bubbly head. Dark hazy brown beer with a red tint. Mild aroma of hazelnut and caramel. Taste is a very fizzy cola-like with some caramel and hazlenut notes.. Light-bodied. Aftertaste is a light nutty bittersweet hoppiness that is fleeting.  If it was fuller bodied and a bit more malty it would be better. As is, it is a nice above average brew.
Pours chestnut brown with no head. Filling, malty aroma. Flavour of burnt caramel and hazelnut with a very viscous mouthfeel. Slightly OTT but good.

(Sampled from bottle, thanks Marsiblursi) Clear red-brown color. Tan to brown head. Sweet chocolate, a bit raissin scent. Salty and yet sweet taste. Hazelnut flavored coffee dominates the aftertaste. Mineral water and melted chocolate ice-cream with nuts body and taste. Rather dry finish. Medium low bitterness, normal mouthfeel.

(Bottle) Pours dark clear red/brown, beautiful. Small sandy shaded, fast decreasing, head. Smells milk chocolate and some nuts. Sweet liqourice and rum. Salt. Taste: chocolate icecream, mineralwater. Sweet and salty. Well balanced with medium body. Milky. Some raisins.
twas a delicious and truely exquisite beer.  A perfect beer for the celebration of swell memories of superb taste.  And..... Aniss sucks.

65 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom Dark brown colour with a weak head. Aroma of nuts, caramel and toffee. Very much caramel flavour with notes of hazelnuts and with a little noteable touch of hops and sweetness at the ends.

22 oz bottle.  Ugly pour, cola coloured with a head that disappears just as quickly.  Aroma is malty, toasted nuts, brown sugar, light toffee and some sweetish chocolate.  Flavour is similar, chocolate malt, hazelnuts, toffee, bread and toast.  Thin bodies, leafy hops through the finish wiht a moderate bitterness.  Okay, but not great.

22 oz bottle into a Dimpled Mug glass.  Pours a very dark brown that isnt see through.  The head is quite creamy and quickly dissapates to the sides of the glass.  The aroma is very roasty amd malty with overtones of carmalized malt and nuts.  The flavor is actually more roasted than I was expected.  It starts off with a tiny bit of a coffee hint that moves into a sweet nutty and roasted malty finish.  A hop note kicks in towards the end of the finish.  A very solid and very drinkable brew.

Very good beer.  Pours with an amazing color and very creamy head.  It smelled of caramel, hazelnuts and malt.   Very good hazelnut taste with roasted coffee and malt.  A little sweet, but a very drinkable beer.
The nut flavor is nicley pronounced. Very smooth. Quite flavorful yet too mild and sweet for my tastes. I prefer the bolder Big Sky Moose Drool Brown Ale Ive tried.

22 oz bomber.  Pours a dark sandy brown color with a creamy thick beige brown head.  Aroma is of sweet hazelnut cream, malt, fresh caramel and a hint of sweet butter.  Taste is very smooth with hints of sweet hazelnut,some malts, chewy caramel and a slight hint of hazelnut roasted coffee beans.  Quite enjoyable, but I couldnt drink more than one of these in a sitting.

Pours dark rich brown with a dark tan head.  Aroma is rich and sweet malt with a bit of nuttiness ~ velvety aroma.  Medium / thich mouthfeel.  Very smooth with lightly fizzy carbonation.  Starts with sweet nutty malt goodness with some roasted hints and bits of chocolate.  Finish adds a spicy hoppy bite.  Very smooth beer, probably the best brown beer Ive had.

On tap @ Mellow Mushroom. Clear brown color with red hues shining thru with white head. Full rich aroma of caramel candy. Amazing aroma. Like being in a caramel candy shop. Full caramel flavor like no other beer Ive tasted. Nice nuttiness too. The beer ends smooth with lingering nut flavor.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Sweet aroma primarily of caramel with butterscotch and hazelnut, plus bits of chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla, and some general roastiness.  Flavor is along the same lines but a bit more subdued---less sweet, but a little more hazelnutty and almost slightly spicy in the relatively short finish.  Pretty good.

22 oz Bomber-trade w/after4ever-Pours a dark brown color w/a small brown head. Roasted nutty aroma. Sweet, roasted, hazelnut, vanilla & chocolate flavor-if thats possible! Some caramel & coffee. Very good, complex. Long sweet finish.

Pour was very nice dark brown color. The aroma was great a hint of brown sugar and nuts with a wee bit of coffee. Head was around 3/4 inch but with little lace. Has a huge hazelnut flavor and caramel like malt, very enjoyable. Finish was a bit shorter than I had hoped for but still good. Very flavorfull and a must have for those that like brown ales.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Brunlig øl uden skum.

Duften er af karamel og et streif af hasselnød.

Smagen er ligeså, dog en anelse røget og bitter-sur. Virker som opvaskevand med smag...

Megen lidt kulsyre.

Bottle:  Aroma of malt and nuts, brown sugar, choclate, and a little roast.  Poured dark brown in color with a litte ruby too.  Nice to look at.  Almost opaque but you can see through when held up to a light.  Small, rocky, light brown head that diminished quickly.  No lacing.  Complex flavor with malty hints of hazelnut, nut, roast, choclate, cream, vanilla and oreo cookies.  Heavily sweet but neither bitter not sour.  Medium body.  Lively carbonation.  Finish is sweet and short.  Overall, nice flavor but too sweet and no hops.

Had it many times before, but never bothered to rate it. Pours out a nice dark brown color with a sweet aroma balanced by some chocolate. The taste is very complex, but smooth. Flavors are nice with notes of hazelnut, coffee, choclate. Flavors all complimented one another perfectly. Nice brew

This had a small head.I like head,but not too much,as it takes away from the main pleasure.The color was very dark brown.Not much in the aroma dept,probably due to the lack of head.It tasted as promised with a hazelnut tinge.This is the best brown ale I have had.I love hazelnuts with chocolate,so I guess you need to drink this with your chocolate cake or candy bar.It has a sticky,hazelnut finish.Nice!!I guess I will have to see what OMHPER rated as being better than this,since he was so down on American beers-I hope it wasnt Newcastle.Do I smell a snob??He rated this higher than Newcastle,but its Brittish.

22 oz bomber. Pours a dark brown with a rich, full light brown head. Aroma of hazelnuts, coffee, and chocolate.  Great malty flavor which is matched perfectly with the hazelnut. I enjoyed this beer very much.

Smells sweet, malty, and nutty.  Dark brown body that light can only be seen through slightly.  Head is about an inch thick give or take, and dissipates slowly.  Tastes sweet with malt and nut dominating.  Not really my kind of thing (Im not that big on brown ales), but definitely a decent beer.  The hazelnut extract makes the beer - it is a nice touch.  Well-made and well-done.

pours a dark brown with ruby highlights, small tan head, medium carbonation.  Aroma is coffee and hazelnut, obviously.  Some malt in the aroma also.  Taste is nutty, sweet malt, with a good amount of hazelnut throughout the taste.  my favorite hazelnut beer, thus far.

Bomber. Pours a clear brown with a rocky tan head. Aroma of hazelnuts and vanilla. Medium body an carbonation. The taste is lightly sweet with hazelnuts, toffee, hazelnuts, vanilla, hazelnuts, chocolate and maybe a dash of smoke. The finish hazel-nutty, malty and lightly spicy. Is it one dimensional? Kinda, but the nuttiness though pervasive really isnt overbearing. A nice change of pace beer.

Brownish red with big beige head (sounds a bit like an s.t.d.). Chocolate, raisins, figs in aroma. Chocolate and roasted nuts (again: s.t.d.) with a lot of malt flavour. Nice one (not an s.t.d.-remark you hear very often).

Pours dark brown, light brown head. It has a decent scent of nutty and chocolatey malts. Head dicepates to a film. This beer is all malt. A nutty bite, with slight cocoa aspects and a long lasting flavor. This beer is pleasant and smooth, but its thin and one-dimensional. Its missing something that I cant quite figure out, however, its close to being a good one.

Pours a new "castle brown ale" color with a nose of fresh honey, hazelnut, white chocolate and caramel, and even vanilla ice cream. The taste is superb, the color is nice, but the smell is a bit odd. This is something worth trying at least once, if not more. I could see this becoming a monthly purchase. This is among the better brown ales I have had.  I guess the only thing I would change if I could is the use of less chocolate malt and more focus on the hazelnut extract. Then again, this is a fine beer.

bomber.  Aroma:  Bready, caramel, slight spiciness, and hazelnuts.  Appearance:  Clear and a dark reddish brown in color.  Small light tan head disappeared immediately.  Lacing was negligeable.  Flavor:  Maltiness, caramel, vanilla, hazelnut, and a hint of chocolate.  I like the hopping on this one.  Enough to do the job and bring some pleasant flavors and bitterness, not to much that it overwhelms the hazelnut and malt flavors.  Palate:  Medium bodied.  Carbonation seemed a little high.  Finish was a bit watery.  Overall:  A pleasant beer, and very drinkable, but mouthfeel and flavors seemed a bit flat to me.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2006 Thoroughly enjoyed this as it paired with a delicious Teriyaki steak off the grill.  Very sweet, yet nice and full bodied on the palate.   Flavors were of vanilla and hazelnut, primarily, with malty undertones.  Aroma was similar to the taste and simply mouthwatering.  This beer can be the perfect pairing with dinner or the perfect desert.

On tap at the yardhouse (san diego) Nice aroma of nuts and pecans with brown sugar. Pours a nut brown color with minimal head. Flavors of hazelnut, honey and hops. A tad sweet but not overlydone. Nicely balanced flavors and a smooth aftertaste of toffe candy.

Ive been looking forward to trying this for a good bit now.  Lovely espresso colour with ruby glints, just the way I like it.  Poured a medium-large light brown head that smelt like sour milk.  After I let it warm in my hand a bit, and the head died off, the nuttiness made itself clear.  Sweet malt aroma with plenty of hazelnut.  Great mouthfeel, thick in the right places.  Fabulous hazelnut chocolate flavour with plenty of toasted toffee, malt and hops.  Really is balanced quite nicely.
Excellent nutty/malty flavor. Weak aroma does not translate to the flavor that this beer has. Going on my favorites list.

Bottle.  Deep brown, with a tan head.  Aroma is a bit off, somewhat sweet smelling.  Might be the extract.  Body is heavy, with a sweet fizzy taste and feel. Almost soft drink in character.  The alcohol is well hidden with all of the malt action going on.  Quite drinkable.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: WOW soild beer.  Poured a nice brown color with small head and not much lacing.  Aroma was of strong strong hazelnuts, with some chocolate.  Flavor was of hazelnuts nice malty base to it.  By far the best nutty beer i have had.

Not as good as I had hoped this beer would be. I have waited a long time to drink this, and had really high expectations. I wanted to like this beer--because Im a big fan of Rogue--but I just couldnt do it. The pour is brown with a good head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is of weak malt and thats about it--just not much to speak of really. The taste is the same, just underwhelming me with blandness. Mouthfeel is alright, but I just kept wanting more. "

Tried this while visiting Grand Rapids MI.  Pours a beautiful brown with a rich, nutty bouquet.  Nicely hopped with malty burnt chocolate hazelnut flavours... Sort of like Nutella!  Loved it.  (650ml bottle)

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2007 Nice coffee hue- tan head that dissipates fast- heavy malt, hazelnuts, chocolate nose- flavors toffee, caramel, maple, grains, sweet and silky-  medium/heavy smooth body-  aftertaste is short, toffee with slight bitterness

(04.30.06) One pint, 6 oz brown bottle from DiCarlos, Mundelein, IL. 14P. 33 IBU. Clear dark amber with small off-white head. Soft carbonation.  Caramel aroma. Medium bodied brown ale that starts with light malt sweetness. Burnt caramel and biscuit flavors from toasted malt. Finished with light malt fade and light bitterness.  Smooth. Though no hazelnut aroma or flavor was detected, this is an excellent brown ale.
22oz bottle: Pours a black/dark brown.  Nearly no head, tan.  Chocolate, nutty aroma, slight coffee.  Taste of chocolate, nuts, coffee.  Coffee afertaste.  Kind of watery.  Reminds me of a porter.

From bomber.  Poured a murky brown with dissipating tan head.  Nose is sweet nuts.  Flavor is more sweet, roasted nuttiness.  Palate is a little thin.  One of the better browns Ive had, but still not that exciting.

Rogue is an interesting brewery, one that from my standpoint has always lurked in the shadow of brewers like Stone. For the first time, myself and my drinking partner GarrettB decided to tackle this uncharted territory, starting with the Brown Ale. The pour produced a dusty cola brown body that foams up and quickly reduces to a simple beige cap. Wonderful scents of my childhood are subtly laced together, sweet aromas of Nutella and nougat de Montélimar meld into a caramel cappuccino explosion. The combination is truly enticing and nostalgic to my nose. The flavor, however, is a bit disappointing: the caustic sensation of burnt toast dominates initially and merges with thin notes of caramel, honey, coffee and implied chocolate. The rich fragrances resign to a lucid, two-dimensional palate that lacks the depth it requires to support such substantial flavors.
