Maltiness went well with the slight but evident hazelnut taste.

In the bomber bottle. Morimoto version. Reddish brown in color. Hazelnut aroma strong. I first had this on tap long ago and was not a fan of the fake hazelnut flavor extract which was mostly chemical tasting. This newer incantation is way more natural tasting. Good balance to the flavor with enough of a malt profile to encapsulate the hazelnut.

A nice dark brown with a frothy head that reduces to a nice lacing. A sweet hazelnut aroma and a complex nutty flavour dominate this wonderfully full bodied beer. A very sweet hazelnut aftertaste. Smooth and delicious.

Mild roasty chocolatey nose with a mild citrus hop notes and relatively no aromas of hazelnuts.  Mildly hazy amber color with a yellowish tan head that dissipates pretty quickly.  Roasty star with some mild hints of sweet hazelnuts in the middle.  Finishes chocolatey and roasty.  This is very well balanced and very nicely done!  Need more aroma, though.
Poured brown with a tan head.  Sweet malt aroma with some nut character.  Taste is nutty but also very malty like a bock.  Very drinkable, and hands down the best brown ale Ive had.

Bottle. Clear, dark red/brown color with a small tan head. Nutty, toasted malt aroma. Slightly sweet malt flavor initially that dries considerably on the finish. Hints of nuts, butter and hops on the finish. Very drinkable, but not a style Im
crazy about.

Deep ruby-brown colour with a good sized mocha head. Aroma is nutty and roasty, very appetizing. Body is a little thin for the style, but not bad. Flavour is wonderful - hazelnut, toffee & roasted malt. Nice bitterness in the finish. Quite good stuff.
Easily one of the top browns Ive had, along with Naughty GOose. Deep brown with a head that lasts. A little bit of fruit in with the nutty character. Nice long dry finish.
on tap. 12/28/2004.  fat jacks in bloomington, illinois.  2.75 for a pint of anything on tap on tuesday nights.  this was nice.  nutty.  a really good brown that i should have again at some point.

Wow is that hazelnut. Very strong in the nose and taste, lots of malts. Overall quite good, check this out if you can. Had it on tap at the blind pig in champaign illinois. My wife liked this a lot more than I did.

Bottled.
Redbrown.
Nutty and fruity aroma and fruity and sweet flavour.

Poured a dark copper brown with highlights of dark ruby when held up to light.Decent tight bubbly head.Got to the bottom of the glass with no signs of lace.The smell had a malt dominant nose,with caramel,celery?,and some roastedness.
The taste starts out with caramel, malty tones in the center,and a slight roastedness in the finish.This beer seems well balanced, and has a good clean finish.Medium body and amply carbonated.Will buy again.

Take this review with a grain of salt because I do not care for overpowering hazel nut flavor (which I find this beer has)  The first few sips of this are great, and then I just find I want to flush the rest.  

The nose on this beer is of hazelnutt. It tastes first of hazelnut then of coffe.

Pour is a deep brown with a tan head.  Aroma is wonderful...nuts and hops with a roastey goodness.  Flavor is nuts, rasions with some roasted malts in there, in the end you get some hop bitternes.   Another good one from Rogue!

Chestnut brown pour with lively beading supporting a medium khaki head and good lacing.  Very pleasant nutty aroma with roasted malts and a touch of toffee.  Smooth and silky mouthfeel and a well balanced flavor of hazelnuts, vanilla and spice.  Admittadly, the hazelnut tones occasionaly felt "forced" but I kept coming back the fact that this beer just tasted great.  Complimentory and long lasting nutty finish.  Heading out today to pick up a few more bottles to share with friends over the holidays.

Bottled. Dark ruby, average head. Nutty aroma -very aromatic. Sweet and roasty with lots of vanilla and hazelnut as well as chocolate. Clean, somewhat hard mouthfeel. Pleasant, but one-dimensional, and suffering from the same syndrome that keeps many US microbrews to enter my list of top beers: simplistic, hard, clean malt character.

Draft at the Rogue Public House in Portland.  First off, the color is stunning: a cloudy red-amber (almost cider-colored) with a nice beige-ish head.  The flavor is truly like nectar, starting malty-sweet and rounding out into a symphony of spice, nuttiness, some fruit and something else I couldnt quite figure out.  The palate isnt distinct, but is pleasant and delicious as it lingers.  One of my new favorite beers.

Bottle.  Pours garnet brown with a moderate beige-tan head.  Aroma is sweet and biscuity - kind of like sugar cookies and spice.  Sweet malty flavor, molasses, maple syrup, nuttiness and light spice.  Medium body and nice creamy carbonation.  Nice holiday ale - flavorful and delicious.

This pours a dark red color, clear, with an off-white head. Aroma is hazelnut, brown sugar, vanilla, very sweet. Flavor starts sweet with chocolate and caramel, a hint of vanilla, tons of hazelnut and a touch of hops on the finish. I was afraid of a very chemical nutty taste, and was very happy to discover that wasnt the case. Nevertheless, the whole thing didnt really work for me: it doesnt mix very well and I feel like I had a simple, not very interesting beer with a strong unnatural nutty aftertaste.

This pours a red hued mahogany color with a one-finger off-white head.  The aroma  is rich and malty, fairly sweet.  Its got a creamy mouthfeel and tasted of caramel and chocolate.  The hazelnut really only comes through in the finish along with a dash of hop bittereness... a nice lingering way to remember a good drink.

Ive really liked this beer for a while, it has this nice hazelnut and malty smell to it and a smooth hazelnut flavor that lingers only long enough.  I have noticed that this beer does vary in taste from batch to batch, but generally its always good.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2005 First off, my wife likes this which is a definate plus!  Nice color, brown and ruby.  Aroma of charcole and nuts, lighty sweet.  The flavor is very nice (considering I usually dont like Brown ale) and has clear tasts of nuts, wood, sweet burn malts, and lite pine hops in the background.  Body is creamy and well balanced.  I like this and would recommend this to all who enjoy a brown ale!

Full bark brown with light brown head.  Some slight sweet nutty aroma.  Very nice looking beer.  Flavor is interesting mix of malt, vanilla and the extract.  Not as "fake" tasting as some others Ive tried.  Very easy drinking.

May, 2003: Big pint bottle. Newcastle Brown with some hazlenut syrup. Pleasant enough, but not a great beer. These Rogues have a reputation for being great beers - so far they have merely been acceptable. Im surprised that so many people I respect are giving this such praise. Obviously Im missing something. OK - attractive hazlenut colour, check. Slight raison and hazlenut aroma, check. Mouthfeel - light medium with small carbonation, check. Nothing special so far. Flavour dominated by a sort of hazlenut syrup with touches of vanilla and caramel, behind which - and not exactly well integrated - is a sort of nutty, rusty beer with some traces of hop bitterness that warms in the finish, but is marred by a metallic quality and a chemical hazlenut. Some chocolate late in the finish. A clumsy journey full of faults. Try as I might, I cant see this as even a good beer.

Draft.  Had this one at Rolands in the Strip in the Burgh.  Great large head (even with the slow old waitress) and a creamy off-white foam with excellent lacing.  I have a feeling that this will be a great one.  Cloudy and brown, with almost streaks going through it.  Nose of sweet toffee, vanilla - lots of vanilla and I guess some hazelnut as well.  Taste is like no other beer Ive ever had... nutty, honey, vanilla, semi sweet and great creamy fully body with a very light if any hop addition.  Being a hop-head, I am surprised at how much I love this brew.  It is simply a great beer.  I cant wait for another.
Very smooth brew. Simply an all around amazing beer. Aroma is of fine cut hazelnuts. A bit rich, but if you like it that way, then its perfect. Get out there and find this beer. You will enjoy.

Beerbistro Winterfest and Vintage Tasting. Mahogany colour with a thin and diminishing off-white head. Nutty, fruity, cherry, caramel, and molasses aroma. Chocolate, amaretto, nutty, coffee, and lightly fruity flavours. Light bodied and somewhat watery. Overall, less than the sum of its parts, mainly due to lacking mouthfeel.

Dark amber. Light beige-grayish foam. Sweet, malty, lightly roasty, hazelnut aroma--though not overly  pronounced. Medium-thin, highly carbonated. Surprisingly bland (for Rogue), sweet, malty, slightly artificial hazelnut flavour w/ some mineral notes. Also somewhat cloying.
bottle, nutty/hazelnut aroma, reddish brown (transparent) color, very smooth and soothing beer, tastes of hazelnut,chocolate, coffee.  very relaxing beer.

Bottle.  Nice nutty aroma.  Ruby brown color.  Decent head, color is off-white to tan.  Slight lacing.  Nice hazelnut flavor.   Coffee hints also.  A little thin would be the only fault here.  Very nicely done!

11.06.04  This just had such a smooth nice nutty flavor, that it just went perfectly with my enormous babel-esque stack of white chips while playing texas holdem with biznizness and a few other ratebeerians last night
Just a fantastic brew.  Deep, rich hazlenut flavor.  Nice and creamy and sweet.  This is beer candy.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2007 The first hazelnut beer I ever had was a Longshot Hazelnut Porter from the Longshot contest that was recommended by a bartender in Durango, CO.  I have been in love with the flavor ever since.  This is an exceptional brew, and if you are lucky enough to get it, then GET IT!!!  Tastes just as advertised- immediate rush of hazlenut but with a coffee-like finish.  Extremely well-balanced on all fronts.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Sweet beer, with a nice dark brown appearance and a tan bubbly head.  Smoooooth...  Has a lot of characteristics similar to their line of stouts but with a smotheringly fantastic aroma of hazelnut and brown sugar.  Malty, not too brutal on the saaz hops which is a fine balance.  A very popular choice from Rogue!
Delicious brown ale.  Nectar of Hazelnut.  Another fine beer from Rogue.  They are my heroes.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2005 Bottle.  Wonderful dark brown body.  Subtle nuttiness in malty aroma.  Medium tan head.  Mouthfeel is on the thin side, but silky as well - a beautiful blend of maltiness and nutty flavour.  Not much hop presence until the end.  And then after that, you really get the hazelnut after youve put your glass down and contemplated.  I really enjoyed this brown ale - a little more body and it would be perfect for the style.

Had this at the Rogue pub in San Franciso in November 05 and loved it even more - it seemed to have much more body and was bursting with flavour - easily the best brown ale I have ever had and even better than the 4.1 bottle I originally rated. Bumped up marks for aroma, flavour and overall by 1 each.
very nice sweet nutty smell.borwn/amber body with a small head.very nice taste!mild smooth body with a delicious nutty malt taste.id drink this one again for sure.

650 ml bottle.  as youd expect, a mild, malty, nutty aroma.  very interesting flavor: sweet and nutty, but bitter and wood-chippy, with what seems like honey.  this is a joy, a suprise winner from rogue.
Pours light mahogony with a big firm light brown head. Roasty butter, nutty, hop, aroma. Chocolate, nut, salt. Toasted bread crusty malts. Raisin. Clean.
Not what it says on the bottle but this is where I was directed to. Hazlenut brew that is very tastey! It has a tan look with a mild beige head. Taste is cinnamon and  nuts. Very yummy brew!

Fantastic.  Dark brown with creamy tan head that dissapate quickly (probably a dirty glass)  Very nice nutty and fruity start with a bang of hazelnut and cinnamon finish.  It was delicious and very drinkable.  Ill have another as soon as I find one.  It was great.

Poured a nice dark brown with an enormous tan head that unfortunately did not last near long enough.  The aroma was very malty with a very fruity note, and of course a nutty little bite.  The flavor was great.  It tasted like a well balanced brown ale with the essence of hazel nut poured into the bottle.  Great mouthfeel, just excellent.  This beer I feel is perfect for sitting back and drinking, it has the perfect flavor and is not so heavy that you can only drink a little before feeling opressed.  Thank you Rogue for this fine Brown Ale.

Dark Brown.  Fruit, coffee beans, hazelnut, chocolate and cream in the aroma.  Fantastic flavor.  The malts combined with the hazelnut provide a deep, rich flavor with notes of hazelnut, coffee, cream, nuts, chocolate, fruit and caramel.  The hops are spicy but overtaken by other flavors.  A unique brown ale.  Very tasty.
bottle from 23rd street, well its brown in color i guess dats good.tastes nutty n mlid, almost creamy.very drinkable and pleasing
Deep dark amber/brown, with cream frothy head. Smells of nuts and chocolate.  This has great flavor. Kind of nutty, smoky, and bitter, toffee and coffee. This is a great brown ale.

Bottled, Stockholm Beer Festival. 
Hazy dark brown colour. Nutty, cocoa nose. Light, smooth malty with a tang of nuts as well as a nice hop presence, making this a balanced and nice brew.

Nice dark brown colour with a fairly thin head that stuck around and left some decent lacing. This beer was very smooth and delicious. there was a hint of bitterness and I could decect the hazlenut (of course) and some chocolatly notes. Defintaly a decent beer for the winter months.

Hazy brown color. smells kinda sweet, not to much smell though.Initial taste is of hazelnut on the way down, not the kind in coffee though, little more woodsy.  medium sweetness with a light molasses hint. will buy again

morimoto bottle
UPDATED: APR 21, 2005 Great malty nose from milk, nuts and toffee. Pleasant mild flavor with milky and nutty notes. This was really good...

Rogue Morimoto HazelNut - Bottle pours a deep amber with a tan head and some lace.  The aroma is of hazelnut, but in a much more natural way than other hazelnut ales out there.  It does not smell artificial.  There are also good strong chocolate notes.  The flavor is like a chocolate and hazelnut sunday.  The palate is smooth and creamy.  Overall, this is the best beer Ive had with hazelnut extract.

Hazy brown colour, small head. Rich and strong hazelnut aroma, notes of burnt sugar, toffee, leaves and licorice. Full, nutty flavour. Toffee, anise, burnt sugar and hops. Clean and hard body with soft chewy malt. Delicious! The best brown ale I ever had to date.

A very smooth, sweetish brown ale.  More akin to Samuel Smiths brown ale than to other west coast browns.  I finally sampled this beer at the California Brewers Festival and it gets my nod for Best of Show, even though the judges piced Allagash Double.
on tap in newport. plenty of hazelnut in the aroma, just tastes like a standard brown ale with a shot of frangelico thrown in

From a MoriMoto bottle. Red brownish color, with a medium fluffy tan head. Malty, nutty aroma, choco, some hops and chewy toffee. Very nutty flavor, with some sweet ad nice undertones. Tastes like some kind of sweet dessert liquor. Very nice flavro and a very nice and balanced brew. Excellent!

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2007 Re-Rate. This bottle was far better than the first. Really big nutty flavor and a lot of it. Has a nice finish. Great brew to gnaw on for awhile. Only downside is the smell. It didnt taste anything like it smelled. I picked up prunes and maybe raisins. Two fruits which I absolutely HATE. Itll get high marks on the re-rate from me with the exception of the Aroma category.

Pours a dark brown with an amber hue and light brown head. Aroma is of light roastiness and hazelnut. Taste is nutty with notes of chocolate, maple syrup with a hint of smokiness, molasses and coffee. Pefectly sweet with a touch of bitterness. Pretty complex. Goes down very smooth. Mouthfeel is full and round but ends a little watery. Overall, a great brown ale.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2005 Warm leather brown hue and thin almond colored head that fizzed out rather quick.  Nose is a regular brown ale styled and has traces of sugar and caramel  malt.  Flavor is delisicously nutty and is made up of brown sugar, caramel and hazelnuts. Also has a sweet syrup and toasted malt taste. The best brown ale i know of.

Pour is a brown with a creamy tall head.
The aroma and taste are extraordinary.  Just plain outstanding.  A sipping beer to be sure, but totally delicious.

poured a very dark brown with no head.
sweet creamy nutty aroma with a tangy rich sweet chocolate tast.
I just dont like sweet beers and this is to sweet for me

bottle 22 oz. Field rate (paper cup). Morimoto was on the bottle. Mostly clear brown w tan head. Aroma is spicey malt w mild hops. Flavor is creamy malt w a cocoa and mildly spicey hazelnut tang. There was a sharpness (alkaline taste) and a touch of thin & watery to the mouthfeel. Perhaps it was an old bottle. Medium bodied. This didnt appeal to me. Brown ale isnt really my style anyway.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2005 I hate brown ales. I mean I really cant tell you how much I despize this style of beer. i also cant explain to you how much I loved this beer. Pours a deep dark brown, or really a deep dark maroon. Nice beige off white head. Nose is very figgy. Also notes of stewed plums, tobacco, brown sugar and hazelnuts. Hazelnuts are very prominent in the palate. Malts are exquisite. Nice and roasty. This is a great brew.
G-rat

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2006 Aroma is sweet creamy nuttiness. Dark brown with a light brown head. It made me say "Oh ho!" after my 1st sip. Man this stuff is GREAT! Has a good malt character with a strong sweet chocolate taste. This is complemented by a strong sweet hazlenut taste. Rich, malty, creamy, nutty, smooth, chocolatey. This is one of the best beers I have ever had the opportunity to enjoy. Unbelievable!
Very good tasting beer.  A dark tasting beer with hazlenut aftertaste.  Very good tasting beer.  With lots of potential would buy this again.

Tasted in Colorado.  Obtained from a beer store in Dillon.  Tasted in a shaker glass. Appearance is dark with mud like opaqueness.  Thin brown/tan coloured head.  Aroma has a sweet nuttiness with many layers of subtle complexity.   Flavour is of intense sweet hazelnut.  Very satisfying - an intense form of a standard nut brown ale.  I enjoy this one very much.
Bottle. Dark amber body with a loose one finger beige head. Coffee, nut, and malt flavors are dominant. Tastes like a mixture of 25% porter and 75% brown ale. Quite enjoyable.

Dark syrupy brown with a medium tan head...smells like hazelnuts...tastes like one too many pumps of hazelnut syrup in a SS Nut Brown...Rogue tries too hard to make unique beers and screws them up in the process...thick sweet malty finish...

A delicious brew all together. Slight metallic nose. Very light hops taste. Smooth, almost like a porter. Hazelnut flavor is a little lost in the rest of the flavors but still very good. Very drinkable and quite enjoyable.

How has this rating slipped through the cracks?!?! Certainly my all time favorite brown ale.  Brown body with thin off white head, sweet maple syrup flavor with hints of nuts and chocolate, on the brink of porter in general, very dark and rich compared to the commonly watered down browns produced by most breweries, Sams session brew and for good reason, I rate it high because no other brown can touch it.
On tap in Portland.  Redish amber color with a creamy off-white head.  Sweet nutty nose.  Artificial hazelnut syrup sweetness.  Not a really pleasant drink.
Not the worst or the best but quite drinkable.  I think Id prefer a little more hops.
one of my favorites,  also found it labeled as Morimoto Hazebut Brown.  Real smooth, rich nutty flavor, w/hints of caramel...mmm.  dark brown hue, w/an amazing aroma, you cant go wrong w/this beer.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2004 Another beer I loved! But I got it labeled as Morimoto Hazlenut Brown, so I figure this is the same brew. Flavor was caramel, nutty, and creamy, which I enjoy! This is definitley hitting the top of my list of favorite browns!
Morimoto on the bottle. Dark reddish brown, good head. Smells of malt and nuts. Nice malt flavor with obvious nuttiness. This was very easy to drink.

Had from bottle on July 24th, 2004Labeled as the Morimoto, this Hazelnut poured dark brown with a nice sized head and a nuttly aroma.  While the aroma was nothing new for a nutty beer, the taste was great with a smooth finish and a nice malty flavoring combined with the nuts and cream.  There was no lacing and the head dissipated quickly.  Good stuff.

The name of this brew alone was enough to induce salivation, and once I poured it and the first hint of its aroma reached my nose, I knew I would not be let down.  It poured a thick, earthy brown with a short-lived head, emitting luscious scents of hazelnut, caramel, and vanilla.  The taste was a cascade of malty richness combining nuttiness, sweetness, and a buttery-smooth texture.  Not much in the way of hops, but the sensational flavors left nothing to be desired.  Truly an amazing beer by my standards, and definitely one of my new favorites.
Clear amber brown w/fine head. Nose of malt, faint hops, orange and of course huge hazelnut aromas. Hazelnut, toast, cream, very nutty lingering finish with some marshmallow.  Amazingly fun beer...

Bottle, brown  almost black in color with a thin layer of a grey brown head. the expected aroma of hazelnut. flavor has more to it, stout like taste to this, and i like stouts.  flavors of grape nuts and caramel.slight bitternes on the finish with a herbal touch too.

22oz Morimoto  Looks woody brown, poured with a tan head that died leaving no trace of its former self.  Aroma of_SURPRISE!_hazlenut, which makes me think of capachinos, some carmelly malt, but well integrated.  Drinks light, almost too much so, and comes back in the finish.  Flavor has a kick(almost sour??) in the finish when the hazle comes out to play...really light bodied, but still retains some dark malt character.  This one sat in my fridge for months b/c I thought it would suck.  It is better than the Berghoff one Ive tried, though. Not so overwhelmingly "flavored."  I think this beers lightness is its blessing, but I cant see myself buying it again, unless things are bleak.  Maybe it could be made into an ice cream topping or something...somehow, it just seems like a beer that would be better if it werent a beer.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2004 22oz Bottle labeled as Morimoto Hazelnut Signature Ale.  Pours a dark redish carmel color with a fizzy tan head that dissapears in literally a few seconds.  No lacing.  Smell is a sweet dark roasted, nutty and maybe slight coffee.  The nutty flavor is very pronounced, and a bit sweet.  I can see whay its called nectar.  Dark almost burnt lingering flavor and a slow roasted finish.  Plenty of carbonation.  Interesting and quite bold flavor.

Dark brown color with a modest head and a fine chocolate and nutty aroma. Delicious malty flavor, chocolate, hazelnuts, vanilla with a buttery note, creamy and sweet. Sometimes these flavored beers can have an artificial taste to them but this one was just right-everything tasted like it belonged there. Smooth finish with just a faint bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2009 This beer is like dessert in my mouth.  It take me a while to drink an entire 22 of this beer, for it is very sweet, thick, and nutty.  It tastes sort of buttery and caramel like to me.  Sort of like a really rich dessert.  I loved this beer.

Deep roasted chocolate aroma but a little faint. Huge, light brown head. Dark ruby red in color. Body looks thick and oily like a barleywine. Great lace. 33 IBUs are masked by the malt. Doesnt taste like there are any hops at all. Very unique hazelnut flavor. Gets better as it warms. Drank this after a Bear Republic Racer 5 IPA, so it was pretty mellow by comparison.

This was the Morimoto label.A brown ale with hints of fruit inthe aroma.The taste now was different.I found it kinda woodsy like fruits and nuts.Very good brew from Rogue.I split this with other beer people and they all liked it.Very flavorful no harsh aftertaste

Pours with a one-finger head that fades quickly to a ring leaving no lace. Deep, clear amber color. Low carbonation. Nose is a light malt. Light bodied which is surprising for a brown. Starts malty and then the hazelnut kicks in - very nice. The ABV is 8.8%. $4.60 for a 22oz bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.
This is a rating for the Rogue Morimoto Hazelnut Signature  which is different from the Hazelnut Brown Nectar but the server software does not allow ratings under the Morimoto label.

Morimoto label: Pours brown with reddish hue. Creamy white head sits on top. Mild hop bitterness with roasted malt/nutty aroma. Hazel nut flavor with creamy texture. Seems to be a bit watery but still quite good. Cinnamon and chocolate flavors seem to be in there as well. Good dessert beer.
2004 NABA Festival: Golden brown pour. Tastes of hazelnut. Sweet and fruity. Refreshing beer.
Had this at Andys in Bogota NJ. Good flavor and surprisinglt satisfying mouth feel.Complexe under tones that reallt srface as the brew warms. On tap, great.

Drank it from the bottle so I dont know what it looked like but if it looked as good as it tasted it would have gotten a higher score from me.  As soon as the top popped I could smell a nutty malty aromoa.  The taste was very smooth with a hint of chocolate.  Another great Rogue beer.
Nut brown coloured. Strange aroma with notes of nuts and seaweed. The flavour is nutty with notes of chocolate.

Morimoto, Bright white head with a light golden color. Very pleasing nutty, soba? aroma. Dry, somewhat hoppy flavor, zesty. Has a grainy flavor with the malts thats somewhat appealling. Pairs very nice with chinese food, nice balance and texture.

On tap.  Nectar is an apt description for this flat dark brown brew.  The aroma is of sweet chocolate and chickory.  The flavor is as advertised.  There are buttery hints, chocolate malt hints, hazelnut syrup in some sips.  Although this was creamy thoughout (but not thick), the only complaint is with the complexity seeming to come with bad blending and disparate sips.  Maybe the viscocity of the extract has something to do with this.  Overall, an excellent sweet treat.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2004 morimoto label, dimpled mug: lots of ingredients, as the bottle lists... complex sweets and bittering, citrus and nutty. average appearance and palate: dark brown, but almost with a soda like head. fizzy, creamy palate. good brew, but nothing special. i agree that its almost porter-like, but it does scream brown ale. what struck me most is the wonderful aroma. it smells better than it tastes. all in all, i like it. next time i have this i want to try it like so: "hazelnut float with warm oatmeal raisin cookies" i saw it on a menu once, looks good. UPDATE 8/21/04: regular ol' label with the bearded guy... very clean tasting brew. nice and perky front collapses into a subtle smooth and tasty nutty chocolate sweetness. subtle indeed, a bit thin, watery... but it's easygoing and nice. downrated, actually. UPDATE 10/19/04: smooth, cremey, and delicious. hmm. not too thin, barely watery, and it's chocolately. it's just sweet enough. uprated.
Beautful nutty, light brown color. Very velvety and creay. Pleasant in the mouth. I cant really sense the hazelnut, but it is without doubt a beer with good quality. Could be more agressive.

A bottle that is older that 8 months.Nice malty,tootsie roll,West Coast,Sweet(sugar)aroma(w/a tease of hops).A very enjoyable Red,amber,Brown,decent lace,nice brown phat-head.Tastes WC malt,hops,huge hazelnut-some choco,teases of fake.This is good and holds up well.It is porter like but there are also some brown ale charateristics.Morimoto more expensive like Seahorse is more expensive than Yellow snow!?Rogue is still good though.Smores vibe.There are hops and some metallic.Id like to make pancakes w/ this s*it.

Pours dark brown, almost porter like.  Not much head.  Smells of sweet malts, tastes of sweet malts with hints of chocolate/other roasted grains.  Sweet but balanced with the roasted malts instead of hops.  Normal circumstances and I side with a hoppy, but this is great stuff.
Shared this one with the wife, we both loved this nut brown ale.  weve always have been Iron Chef fans and Rogue did Morimoto justice with this great beer!

on draft: poured murky brown with a small tan head.  your nose definately says hazelnuts when you inhale and malt....rock candy.  in the mouth its just about the same, dominant nut malt taste, cereal, with toffee flavors.  i had just had stones IPA and from that to this is a huge adjustment. my palate was way out of wack, hopefully i got this one right. compared to that no hops here. sweeet malt!
UPDATED: JUL 16, 2004 Wow! Hazelnut all over the place in this bad boy. Pours dark brown and even has a hazelnut scent to it. I had the Morimoto edition. This beer puts any other brown ale to shame.

22oz bomber poured into a pyrex measuring glass (morimoto): Creamy head! very caramely color. Chocolate nuttyness.  Smells of nuts and the sweetest, most succulent dark chocolate. so light and smooth.  mellow roasty nutty chocolate flavor.  a great beer, the BEST brown ale ive ever had.

An inviting rich, sweet aroma with a light cream colored head which disappears quicky.  I carbonation is low but adds to the amazing rich haxelnut taste, with hints of coffee and chocolate.  The first taste leaves you in awe with a quick jolt of incredible flovor and then a seamingly, but not actually fast disapearence, which make you want more.  A great beer for relaxing after a meal, on a saturday, or if your not a religion man, on Sunday too.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2004 Morimoto edition. Pours a nice dark brown with a small off-white head. Hazelnut aroma and maybe chocolate? Taste is amazing, sweet, rich, hazelnut and chocolate tastes and ends bitter. Very smooth.

Mmmm... what a nice beer!!

The hazelnut brown pours a nice dark, almost expresso brown with a thin, tan-colored head. Although the head was thin, it leaves a nice ring of lacing around the glass. 

The aroma was bursting with hazelnut and chocolatey malt. What a stimulation to my nose. 

The taste was definitely pleasurable to say the least! Its like drinking hazelnut pureed with dark chocolate. Carbonation was very light, which adds to the taste. I have a problem deciding which beer I like better, this or the chocolate stout. :-) 

I highly recommend this. A great dessert beer!
Tap.  Creamy beer, deep solid dark.  hazelnuts predominate.  has many good aspects, the creamyness being one, but the hazelnuts rule over every aspect of it.

Brownish red in color, thin creamy off white head. Havent tried this in years, used to be VERY hazlenut, but it appears they have toned it down.  I liked the hazlenut forward approach, but it still is a nice brew.  A bit on the creamy side, they changed it for sure, but is still a winner.

Chocolate, nutty aroma. Deep thick mahogany body with good clarity and thin tan head that recedes to cover. Chocolatey, nutty, cocoa-like flavour. Incredible mouthfeel and lasting cocoa aftertaste. A bit sweet at first sip but the flavour really grows. Mouthfeel is creamy smooth with lively carbonation on the tongue. Unfortunately, the carbonation dies fairly quickly (+/- 10 mins) and it becomes a bit sticky. Medium body. Bottle.

Bottled as Morimoto Hazelnut.  Clear mahogany, very dark, very red, small light tan head with minimal lacing.  Light aroma, caramel malts, chocolate, nuts; smells like a candy bar.  Chocolatey, nutty like hazelnut extract, lightly bitter finish of hazelnut flavor, light caramel malts throughout, fairly smoothe.  Lots of foamy-creamy carbonation leaving some in my mouth after the beer is gone, dry, lightish medium body.  Definitely a sweet brew, tons of milk chocolate in the aroma; I dont like the fact that I can taste hazelnut extract as preceisely what it is, but very unique brown and a Rogue beer for sure.

Bottle (Morimoto)5/3/04:  Pours with an average kaki colored head that quickly diminishes.  Aroma: nutty, malty, sweet maple/hazlenut, maybe even some toffee here.  Flavor: Wow, I havent tasted this before.  Hazelnut, carmel, butter, sweet, but also with a slight hop bitterness.  Nicely balanced.  Finishes malty with a toffee/hazelnut aftertaste.  Excellent beer.

Morimoto!!! -I love Iron Chef's! 
Rating # 465
 Baby pours me a deep brown, but mahogany body the head is kaki, tall and thick. I take a sniff. It smells like homemade waffles covered in maple syrup. The flavor is freaking identical!!! Damn, brings a rich Nutty Sweetness, a long sense of hazelnut hence the name of the beer, butter, oats and sweet but lightly smoky molasses. The body is a bit thinner than I would have liked.. its almost cola like, but the aroma and flavor are tremendous! One will find Toffee to Know End in this Brown Ale!
Tap at Andys. Real nice clear brownish red color with a tan head. Nutty,  malty aroma. Flavor of hazelnut carmel and rich malt. A little to the sweet side.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: UPDATED: OCT 23, 2005 Brown color with a smallish thin tan head. Aroma was light and sweet with hints of maple. Taste is a sweet hazelnut nectar with a mellow hop bite. Although sweet, its very good. Tastes a bit like a flat cola and anise.

Wow...a real treat and wonderful beer!  Pours dark with a medium tan head, good lacing.  Not much to the aroma, earthy-sweet.  Chocolate and toffee in the nose, malty sweet through and through with just the right balance of hops. Very smooth creamy mouthfeel with an unforgettable sweet nutty finish.  I'll be enjoying this one to the end!

Not an ale, or even a beer, but "nectar", eh? Only Rogue has the moxie to pull that off, and pull it off, they do!
Color is a perfect brown, reddish at the sides. Solid, thick, bubbly tannish head. Aroma is swimming in nuts, completely nutty, call the boys in white coats with the butterfly nets..this ale is totally nuts!! A touch of cocoa in the nose, also, but the hazelnut is king of the castle here.
On the palate: buzzing with hops, lush, full maltiness, medium to full body. This one rare brown ale that is brimming over with character! Persistently smooth and satisfying, with a late fruitiness that shows up in the finish.
Another winner from the reliable Rogue stable!
Smooth.  True, genuine palate with rich flavor.  Real ingredients in this baby. Not only my favorite brown ale, but my favorite of all beers.  TOP NOTCH!!
tap. brownish head, dark colour. smell of coffee beans. smoothe creamy aftertaste.
on tap @ hopyard:Aroma of chocolate and Hazelnuts.  Thick round mouthfeel. slightly watery at first, but ends with a very nutty and rich taste.  Slight bitterness and caramel.

Pours a dark brown with no head. Lots of hazelnut on the nose. Smells like something I'd get at Starbucks, but better! Mildly sweet and hoppy as well. Creamy mouthfeel. Caramel, coffee, and hazelnut on the tongue. Nice dry hop finish, with a aftertaste of coffee and hazelnut. This is an awesome beer! I tend to not like brown ales but this one is amazing!
Dark brown with a small tan head.  Aroma of hops, flavor is lots of malts and of course, sweet hazelnut.  Too sweet for me to drink more than the bomber, and not my thing, but a really solid beer.

I was very impressed with this one.  It pours deep brown, with a subdued head.  The first sip provided a blast of hazenut flavor, with a good sweetness.  Hints of caramel, toffee, almonds, and brown sugar presented themselves.  The finish was smooth and malty, with a nice hop kicker.  A wonderful brown ale.
Not being a big fan of hazelnuts, I can still appreciate the quality of this beer. Rich malty presence with hazelnuts at the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2004 While not the very best beer from this brewer, it ranks up there pretty highly.  Smooth, very smooth, with a silky quality to it that is unrivaled among the population of brown ales.  I really enjoy this one.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2011 This is a great beer. A favorite for both my wife and me and the Rogue beer we go for the most. +++  Sampled from a22 oz brown bottle this beer pours a very dark brown color with a small tan head. There is a sweet hazelnut and coffee aroma. The texture is smooth and creamy. The flavor is very nutty, moderately roasty and slightly bitter on the lingering aftertaste. Wonderful.

Fneh. Shouddah know'd. I steer clear of flavored coffees for a reason. Don't get me wrong, I like hazelnuts. Hell, I even like filberts. While some natural flavor or even malt may be utilized, I just don't care - not my kingd of beer. I mean I can taste a good beer under it all, but just can't get past what most others probably love. And to top it off, a phone call came right in the middle of sampling and I got up, knocked the damn glass to the floor. Have never had a glass shatter into so many bits. Beer and glass - gotta love it.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2004 Wonderful aroma. Nuts, brown maple syrup. very smooth at the end. If you let warm (too much) becomes somewhat sweet. But other then that great beer to have around all year long. Cling to glass rather boldly.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2005 Awesome aroma.  Im getting a great mix of nuts, vanilla, and white chocolate smelling malts.  This is one smooth tasting beer.  Strong vanilla/nut taste.  Dry finish that creates the taste and afterfeel of eating pecans.  Highly recommended.

Light tan head.  Frothy but not long lasting.  Color is brown, dark, dark brown with minimal carbonation.  Not a very strong or complex aroma with a hint of coffee and I guess nuts.  Also a dairy (cream) hint in the aroma.  Wow.  Very smooth flavor and very easy drinking.  Slightly chocolate and toasted grains.  Finish is dry and slightly bitter.  A very good beer that is very easy to drink.
22oz Bottle: Pours dark brown with a tan head. Had a bourbonesque aroma initially. Chocolatey, nutty flavor with a full mouthfeel. Very nice.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2004 Bottle from Only Fine Beer (Bottles). Deep brown, with a thinnish ring of froth, and not much lacing. Dry roasted nut aroma. Delicious dry taste - that's the first thing that struck me - a rich, nutty and roasted flavour. Some Nutella sweetness in and around the beginning, levelling out to a medium length finish. Well balanced crisp and light - I think this is my favourite Rogue so far.

I'm having this as the Morimoto Hazelnut.  It is a lovely looking beer.  Clear brown with red and even maroon hues.  The aroma is largely dominated by chocolate malt but a coffee and hazelnut aroma are also present.  The flavor provides a  solid taste.  Chocolate and coffee seem to stand out the most and along with a nutty flavor (ahhh... hazelnut) basically mask any presence of hop flavor.  I'm generally a bigger fan of hoppy beers, but the smoothness and balance of the malts really make this beer stand out.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2004 Another excellent Rogue beer. The head went away quickly. Very impressive with vanilla, butterscotch and orange in the aroma. There was also vanilla and malt in the flavor. Interesting.

Dark bronw color with small head and lace. Aroma is hazelnut and malty with vanilla tones. Rich malty flavor with strong tones of hazelnut and lighter tones of traditional nuttieness. Creamy mouthfeel, but perhaps a bit thin. Very light bitterness in the finish. A little too creamy and too sweet or it could be an exceptional beer, but still very good.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2004 Re-Rate-
Aroma is caramel, hazelnut, malt.  Hazelnut taste is still great, but the flavors seem more bland then
they used too.  Still very nice, just not 4.6 nice.  Lots of caramel and butterscotch flavors, this is
a great brown, and is to be slowly drank and warmed.

Wow, very sweet.  Right now I am in heaven, this is one fn awesome beer.  Way to go Rogue!  This is probably the best beer I have had thus far.  Slight coffee aroma, chocolate, hazelnut (well obviouslly).  This is a beer to drink slow and enjoy!
A very smooth beer that tasted a lot like cider to me.  Possibly a little too sweet for an ale, but good regardless.

I had the Morimoto Hazelnut, which is basically the same as this. Deep chestnut brown, with a hint of red if held in direct light.  Wonderful aromatic sweet smell of roasted hazelnuts.  Medium bodied, and very drinkable; quite possibly my favorite Rogue.  Good for dessert :)

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2004 From a Moromoto bottle.  Clear dark ruby/amber with a medium diminishing beige head.  Sweet aroma of caramel, hazelnut (big surprise), coffee, and toasted bread.  Medium watery body with a moderate amount of carbonation.  Mostly sweet flavor of hazelnut, coffee, vanilla, chocolate and roast.  Finishes slightly bittersweet with a pleasant nutty aftertaste.  Very nice, very drinkable.
Nice creamy, nutty flavor with hints of coffee, caramel and hops. This one was a real treat that I want more of.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2007 Really good.  Great ale taste- not too strong- with a nice hazelnut finish.  I enjoyed it thoroughly.

Morimoto HazelNut Ale.  Pours a deep walnut/reddish brown/dark amber as the glass empties; there is an ample head that is nice and creamy.  Aroma is definitely as subtle as you might expect from an actual hazelnut, coffee, slight alcohol presence in nose seems appropriate for a brown ale.  Taste is mildly roasty malt, coffee for sure...hazelnut coffee.  Some ripe fruit in the taste, but that's also very subtle.  Do I taste raw cookie dough and Bailey's?  This beer may be more complex than I can handle rating.  Wonderful!!  The finish is dry with only a slight back-of-the-tongue bitter.  Actually, the finish reminds me of room temperature coffee, too.  Great beer.  So much better than other brown ales I've had like Moose Drool and Newcastle (opposite ends of the brown ale spectrum).  The body is insanely creamy in the beginning, but as it warms it becomes slightly more watery or thinner feeling, but the increased alcohol presence is great.  Excellent beer!

Bottled as Morimoto HazelNut Ale.  Pours very dark brown with a medium tan head.  Aroma is malty and caramel.  Little nut aroma.  Flavor is verysweet malt.  Coffee, caramel and a little fruit.  Balanced not by bitter hops, but by an extreme dry nut finish and aftertaste.  Alcohol is not noticeable.  Good carbonation.  Nice body.  Very drinkable.  Maybe better without the nut, but very good.

Really good brew. Tastes like coffee. If you like Hazelnut coffee, you would like this. Really enjoyable. Malty, and roasty. Some caramel notes to it. Very drinakable. A gooddessert beer. A good session beer.. Had it on tap at Andy's Corner bar in bogota, nj.

Paid $3.99 for a 650ml bottle.

Slightly hazy dark brown... small, but frothy head.

Sweet hazelnut scent... smells like a hazelnut coffee candle. Very nice!!

A very nice hazelnut flavor as well. Slightly coffee, slightly caramel, lots of hazelnut, especially in the aftertaste. This one's tasty.

Very drinkable, but might get to be too much to be a session beer. However, if you have one of these a night as a starter, you're in a good spot!
Definitley one of the better brown ales I've tried.  Nice sweet brown ale taste.  Subtle notes of hazelnut, I'm glad hey didn't go too overboard on the flavoring.
Everything was greatuntil the aftertaste, which was all hazelnut. It was way too much.  I would not purchase this again, which is a disapointment, because I am a big fan of other rogue beers.

Wow, quite nummy. I have no idea what to use as a benchmark since I've never had a hazelenut brown before, let alone ever had hazelnuts. I'm just calling it by what I think of the taste and not by any style.

Pours a dark redish-brown, like a dark-stained mahogany color witha nice head, but not much lace.

Smells quite nutty and malty.

The taste is very good. Nutty, duh, and also malty and sweet, but without going overboard. It has a nice coffee aftertaste with some fruits in there as well. I'm detecting prunes almost. 

Mouthfeel is thicker than I was expecting and rather good with just the right amount of carbonation. Drinkability is good. This would be a perfect dessert beer.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2004 A dark brown with a frothy head that reduces to a nice lacing. A sweet hazelnut aroma and a complex nutty flavour dominate this wonderfully full bodied beer. A very sweet hazelnut aftertaste. Smooth and delicious.

Medium size tan head, ok retention. Pretty, clear , red/amber color. Nose of cola, malt and the hazelnut. Medium body. Some roasty flavors hazelnut and hints of chocolate. Finish is dry, thin with a slight nuttiness. One of Rogues lesser offerings i,d say.

A tasty enough ale with a deep brown head.  A sweet, aromatic aroma leads to a rather sweet, flavour almost balanced by hops.  Smells like some flavoured coffees I've had at the Second Cup.  A very good beer, if a tad on the gimmicky side.

22 oz Morimoto. Creamy brown head over deep ruby brown ale.  Even in snifter the aroma is hard to pin-point.  It is sweet though, very much like the taste, but in a complimenting way. I like the candy bar description used by radiomgb . The chocolate, toffee, caramel (sugar) blend is perfectly balanced by the hops. A very relaxing (though filling) beer!

Dark brown in colour.  Aroma was almost non-existent at first but as it warmed I noticed some sweetness, caramel and chocolate.  Flavour had loads of caramel and chocolate - like the galaxy caramel chocolate bar - very smooth, cream, and a fair amount of sweetness.  Finish is a very smooth creamy rich bitterness.  Fantastic.  Thanks beerhugger for sharing this bottle with me.

Couldn't get an aroma at first but as it warmed it was sweet with a touch of caramel. Couldn't find traces of hazelnut anywhere exept perhaps in the warm dark brown colour. Drank like mixing sweet caramel and chocolate in your mouth - absolutely fantastic flavour, with only one caveat or critique - perhaps this beer would be too sweet to enjoy very much of in a sitting.

This is a very flavorful brown ale that has a hazelnut finish to a rich nutty brown ale.  One or two are very pleasant, but I don't know if I'd want to drink several at once - maybe a little too much of a good thing.  Very good beer all the same.

I really didn't like this one.  Too thin and watery.  Hazlenuts came on too strong when warmed. Struggled to finish this.  Judging by the reviews here I must have got a bad bottle... I'll re-rate it if I pick it up again.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2008  Bottle 650 ml 
 Appearance:  slight haze in brown fill, dark amber hue. Medium light top. 3-  Nose:  Moderate sweetness, caramel with brown malts, oil with light dark chocolate and fresh bitter hops. Flavor/Palate : Medium light bodied , considering noted 14 Plato definitely light on substance. Chocolate brown malts sitting in centre, slight bitters on sides. Top carbonated almost frisky. Enjoyable brew but lacking extra element.
Nut brown color with little head.  Strong nutty aroma.  Sweet and nutty flavor.  Smooth on the palate.

(as Morimoto edition) Beautiful brown with nice head. Hint of hazelnut in the aroma. Initial flavors of very slightly sweet malt. I expected a nutty finish but BAM--it's like drinking ground up pecan shells. Blech. Maybe I just had a bad bottle.

The best brown I've had, I think.  POured a deep brown, nearly black, with red halo.  Nice thin little head rests on top.  Flavor is malty sweetness, nuttiness, a bit of grass, then a great hazlenut aftertaste.  Many times, I've often wondered if hazlenut syrup would work in beer, and if this is an indication, I would say it does indeed.

Probably my favorite Brown ale.  Nice deep brown color with a lasting head.  Silky smooth on the palate, with lots of nutty malt character.  Aroma is a perfect balance of hops and malt.  Very well done.

Clear medium brown. with a tan head that disappeared almost immediately. Thin body.  Very sweet nutty smell; hazelnuts, pecans, walnuts and caramel. The taste was initially chocolate and caramel, but the hazelnut flavors came on strongly mid-taste. Finish was surprisingly bitter.

I had the Morimoto version of this.  The guy on the label (not the tool pictured on the  pic up above) has this look on his face that seems to say "this is some good effin' stuff!"    This has a wicked huge malty taste and is an amazing beer.

Dark brown with ruby edges and a thick tan head. Chocolate, toffee and hazelnut aroma and flavors. All flavors get richer as it warms. Very nice balance of sweet malts and a slight hoppy finish. This is one tasty brew!

Pours transparent dark brown/ruby.  Large tan head lasts a while with nice lacing.  Aroma is chocolate, signature Rogue hops and malt, and some alcohol presence.  Flavor is same but with delicious roasted nutty flavor, but not too strong.  Some might find it watery but I like it.  Very smooth finish and easy to drink. Not too sweet for a brown ale -- very tasty.  Nothing offensive here. I would buy again.  Rogue continues to impress me.

Dark brown approaching walnut, soapy head, little aroma, not much to speak of in the mouth (some malt), but when you swallow. . .aftertaste kicks up the back of your throat and hits the roof of your mouth with a hammer. . .a Hazelnüss Sahne hammer.  Apart from that, it's pretty ordinary.  No astringency, no roastiness.  Good, but not great.
(Bottle)  Pours a brownish color with a medium sized head.  Delicious flavor of hazelnet, chocolate, and coffee.  A nice treat.

On tap at Summits Wayside Tavern
  Poured very dark impenetrable by light...HInts of nuttiness in the nose.. Flavor was  very sweet hints of coffee and candied hazlenuts...Ecellent brew

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2009 2009-01-22. Dark brown body with a modest tan head that fades. Mild malt aroma, muted nuts and malted milk. (6+) Flavour is sweet with very light roasty touches to the malt, fruit-nut character, very light bitter accents, slightly odd aftertaste. (6+) Average plus palate. Bottle make be getting a bit past its prime, its not as good as I remember. 6/3/6/3/13-14Bottle from LCBO Re-Rate Nov 3 2004 Nice caramel red-brown body, with a good sized beige head. Sweet malty aroma with a touch of nutty undertones. Aroma is muted somewhat. Sweetness of the malt is balance by a touch of bitterness and the nutty flavours which linger on in the aftertate. Ever so slight roast nuts. Hazelnut definitely shows up more prominently in the aftertaste. Palate is decent but thinner than seems fitting. Nice beer but not mind blowing. Thanks for the bottle Tupalev. 6/3/8/3/16

Original Rating Body is a nice dark colour, flavour is complex and nicely sweet a lingering nuttiness especially in the aftertaste. Deliciously creamy on the palate. 6/3/8/5/16
Nice brown colour with some nice malts aroma. Some nuttiness in mouth but after all the other great beers, this one doesnt come out as much (GBOA, 2003)

Large bottle with the Morimoto label. Dark brown with a head that instantly vanished. Strong aroma like a brown ale, though with hints of the hazelnut. Deep bitter flavor with coffee and hazelnut hints and a sweetness to it. Should not be served too cold.

Purchased under the Morimoto name.  Poured dark brown with a quickly disappearing toffee head.  Strong candied hazelnut aroma here; the flavor is woody and sweet with a tangy bitter finish.  The beer is a tad watery which detracts from the unique and yummy flavorings.

Deep mahogany brown color with a small but long lasting tan head. Aroma is malty and nutty, sweet but not over the top. Flavor is initially sweet and malty, followed up by hazelnut and caramel. Full bodied and very smooth. Best brown I ever had.

beautiful looking beer dark almost mahogany brown with a nice tan coloured head that shrinks yet persists to the end.
A great malty/nutty aroma greets my nose wonderful stuff.
Taste starts off with a nice malty sweetness followed by a mineral tatse in the middle then near the end the hazelnut shows through..some very faint hops and some nice alcohol warmth in the throat.
Very smooth and welcoming on the tongue.
An exceptionally drinkable beer..gets better as it warms.

Morimoto signiture. Flashes of red as light tries to enter through this dark brown nectar. Poured with some force and still only a thin ring of head on the outskirts of the glass...eerily headless. The aroma is at first nutty and a bit caremely, followed by a very mild alcohol aroma. Thick and smooth palate with tight carbonation. Hazelnut flavor dominates the finish. I really enjoy this ultra-smooth, nutty libation.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2008 Old rating: 7 3 6 3 13
Practically opaque red-brown color, quickly dissipating tan head.  Woody, grassy aroma.  Malty start, some of the hops in the middle, with the hazelnut flavor riding out the finish.  Sticky sweet residuals.  This beer is nicely smooth to drink, but it seems a bit one-dimensional, really only featuring the hazelnut extract.  I think I liked the aroma more than the flavor, actually.

Re-rate 3/11/2008.  Great aroma - lots of chewy crystal malt and nuttiness.  The flavor kicks in nut dryness and some green hops.  A solid nut brown.

Morimoto edition.  Has anyone ever had that Nutella stuff that Kobe Bryant endorsed before his little ordeal?  Well, it tastes kind of like Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar, and that's a good thing.  Aroma is of (gasp) hazelnut and the flavor is smooth, crisp, and not over the top.  Probably my second favorite Rogue (after the Chocolate Stout).

Brown beer, very clear.  Thin Tan head that does not last long.  Not over the top Hazelnut flavor, but it does kick in in the finish, a nice subtle note.  A bit of the Hazelnut note in the nose as well.  I like that the sweetness in this beer is very subtle, I hate when these beers are over-sweetened.  The front taste is malty, and I can't pull out any taste of the hops, which I was not really expecting to.

(65o ml bottle) This is truly a nice brown ale. Pale yellow, medium sized head and a deep red body. Nose and flavour of caramel, malt, oak and whiskey. Very delicious. Many thanks to MartinT for graciously picking this up for me on one of his roadtrips to the southland...

Now this is a good brown ale, a style that is usually not my favorite. Loved the way it looked in a plain pint glass with a dark nut brown and light brown head. The hazelut added an interesting angle, as that flavor seems implied in most of the browns anyway, but it actually seemed to give more malt flavor than the cider-type finish I seem to get with most browns. Liked it and will be getting more soon.
Pours a quite dark slightly reddish brown, small head, good lacing.  Sweet malt aroma, definitely some chocolate in the flavor.

Saw the Morimotos thinking they were different from the normal Rogues, but they aren't.  Regardless, I've not had the normal Hazelnut.  Pours a dark amber color with a small, thick head that sticks around for quite some time.  I could not find the hazelnut in the aroma, but I did find some chocolate hints along with some sweet malts.  The flavor really showed the hazelnut much better than the aroma.  Other flavors were chocolate and roasted malt.  The mouthfeel was a little thin and bitter, but a fairly decent beer overall.  There are other offerings from Rogue that I will probably try again before this one.

Very pleasant drinking experience.  This nice brown ale smells of sweet roasted malt.  Appearance is reddish brown with big off white head that is fully retained.  There is moderate lacing.  The drinking is where things get good.  This is a malty beer that is nice and smooth.  A very nice break from the BIG ABV beers I usually consume.

Sampled at From The Vine monthly beer tasting Oct 13th, 2003: Kudos to Rogue for not making a run-of-the-mill Brown Ale. Pours a dark brown color with a medium light tan head. Nice spidery lacing. Huge caramel aroma along with the telltale hazelnut. Somewhat rich with a nice mixture of malt, nuts, caramel and hops in the flavor. The finish is rich and nutty. I like this one.

Ths brew pours a deep, mahogony brown with a tan head of good retention.  The aroma is a combo of malted milk and caramel.  Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, all malt up front.  Sweet, hazelnut flavor is subtle but definitely present.  Finish is a balance of sweet malt and light hops. Delightful brew.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2003 Very deep brown body with a perfect 2 inch tan head, rocky, with small and regular bubbles, fine lacing and lasting. Sweet nose, chocolate mainly with hints of maple and coffee. The taste is pretty malty, sweet, surprisingly very fresh with loads of nice flavors among which none really stood out, but honey, chocolate, milk, nuts, toffee, caramel, coffee, maple, rich cookies. Soft, creamy and chewy palate. Tremendous malt/hops balance, more on the malt size, but hops is noticeable, especially toward the finish where I noticed a woody/herbal hops flavor and a roastiness that added to the complexity. Great bursting vanilla aftertaste. Lovely beer which I'm frightened I won't be able to get a crack at near often enough living up here:(
Two thumbs up to JoeT for this great desert.

Poured dark brown with a slight reddish tint.  Light tan, creamy head.  Nutty malty aroma.  Sweet nutty, roasted malt taste, slightly chocolate taste.  A very good friend to me once described this as tasting like a "chocolate stick".  I don't quite know what was meant by that, but it works for me.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2004 I remembered not liking it, but after a resample, this is pretty amazing stuff.  Definitely the best brown ale out there.

Roasted hop smell, slighly sweet. Flavor has definite smokey roasted quality...slightly bitter. Medium brown in color. Had this in a blind taste test with five other brown ales. This one was close to the top of the group.

clear brown, beige head.  hoppy and roasty malt aroma with nugat-ish and chocolate hints and a whiff of hazelnut.  very well balanced between tootise roll/mocha notes amd roasty bitterness.  the hazelnut is there, but very subtle, which is one thing that makes this beer so great.  one of the smoothest beers I've ever had.  delicious.
Had this at Iowa City Brew Fest.Tasted like a graham cracker, very tasty. Nice color and mouthfeel.  Very good
Unique red color and hop-driven aroma.  Tastes like melted coffee ice cream with a very smooth swallow.  Tougher to drink the warmer it gets.
Great color, but lack of head and lacing downgrade it.  Nice rich flavor, the hazelnut kinda sneaks up to you in the aftertaste.  It has a kick.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2005 Awesome beer.  Itd been a while since I had one, so I had to drink one to rate it.  I almost forgot how tasty this Rogue is!  This is the best brown ale there is.  Smooth, rich, delicious.  Go get one.  no wait, dont, leave them for me to drink!

On tap. I don't really know what hazelnut is supposed to taste like, but I like it.  The beer has a rich nuttiness in the front and a chocolatey flavor in the back.  The flavor definately improves when it is warmer.

nice deep brown color.. a light tan head that dissolves fairly fast..  A sweet nut and malt taste, with a slightly bitter finish.
The guy on the bottle looks like my old supervisor from work.  Maybe he got a new job posing for beer bottles :-)

Draft:  I gave the palate a little lower rating because, it was a bit to sweet for me.  However other than that it was very good with a wondeful hazelnut flavor.  And some chocolate notes were detected.

Morimoto bottling.  Deep chestnut brown color, nice head, but it faded away.  The initial taste was of a traditional, smooth brown ale.  As it warmed, some interesting cola flavors began coming through.  The end of the glass was very interesting, with hazelnut blending in beautifully with the malts and hops.  A fine brown ale.
An excellent brown ale. Nice malty flavors with the hazelnut coming through a bit subtle in both taste and aroma.

I've had this a few times and never bothered to rate it.  Brown, transluscent, with a moderate sized brown head.  Aroma is nutty, brown sugar, and prunes.  Sweetness is somewhat balanced with the hops bitterness.  Sweet finish.  Great Brew!
I found this beer had a great aroma but the flavor was a bit lacking.  I did however think that it had great mouthfeel and the head of the beer was nice.

9/1/03:  bottle.   dark red-brown body.  nutty nose which also contains whiffs of molasses, alcohol and some sourness.  toasted nuts to the taste.  malty with some hops and tea.  somewhat sweet and sour finish.  overall pretty clean.

Deep red to leather brown body with a thin tan head. A little lacing.
Nut and chocolate dominate the aroma. Big rich malt flavor burst. Hazelnut and the spicy Saaz make for a nice, sweet finish.
Medium bodied with a thick, somewhat oily mouthfeel. A finish that goes on and on.

Had this at the Bon Vivant Beer Lovers Club on 8-29-03. This was labeled as Morimoto HazelNut, and not as HazelNut Brown Nectar. This poured a nice shade of brown with a small fluffy tan head. The nose is a sweetened, malted nutty whiff mixed with light hops. Very pleasant. The taste is nutty and sweet also but with a little more hops coming through. Very good beer. We had 7 Rogue beers this evening but only 3 were new to me and this was the best of the 3.
No head whatsoever. Nice color though. Nice brown from the tap. Some hop/malt from the aroma and taste. Not the best Brown Ale I've had, but not bad. Not as much hops as I wanted, but overall OK.

Pours a dark brown, muddy color with little head. Caramel, malty aroma. Taste hazelnut (of course), malts, coffee, and an ever so slight bittersweet, then dry finish. The alcohol notes are more noticeable as it warms--it is after all over 6%. I think it is a tad bitter than normal for a brown ale, but as a hophead, that is not a bad thing. Not as thick as I would want, but the flavors in this beer are outstanding. Malty, rich and earthy. Almost tastes like a full-bodied Vienna. Brown ales are not my favorite style, but I can appreciate the quality of this brew. To all my hophead comrades, take a break from the hop once in a while and try this delicious malty wonder.

Bottle, both the design with the guy holding the massive stein and the morimoto, which confused me in the store thinking I was buying 2 different beers. Worked out good anyways, because this is a fantanstic beer. Pours a beautiful dark brown ruby color, with medium beige head. Aroma of nuts, coffee. The initial taste is incredible, sweet mocha hazelnut goodness, full malts and just the right hops. Wonderfully smooth, soft carbonation. Long finish has more of a sweet nutty flavor, some black tea, very little bitterness. Almost too sweet at times, but just right. I can't imagine a better brown ale. I like how the bottle lists all the ingredients as well....I think this might have sold me on Rogue beers. Outstanding in its style and all around.

A vigorous pour yielded only a thin yet creamy and condensed tan head atop a cloudy deep amber brown body. The head thinned out even more to but a slight film. Aroma is malty, nutty and with noticable hops present and hints of coffee and chocolate. Mouthfeel is very smooth with a creaminess to it. Flavor is reminding me of Sam Smiths nutbrown yet definately more bitter. Finishes a tad dry. Overall would be better if less bitter in my opinion.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: I am a bit diappointed with this one. The beer looks good, brownish-red in color, slightly hazy, Quickly diminishing light brown head. Nutty malt aromas with subtle hazelnut. The taste and mouth-feel were the big letdown for me. Very lively carbonation, a little too much so for me. Medium bodied. Hazelnut flavors are there but they are not too big. Nutty roasted malt flavors are predominate. The hops don't really kick in until the swallow, when you get a definite bitterness. Sort of like drinking cold carbonated hazelnut coffee.

Bottle. Brown color with a hint of orange. Hazelnut aroma, indeed, with caramel. Good lacing. Flavor has hazelnuts, oakleaves, glue and salt. In fact the smell of a fisherman's boat in Scheveningen harbor. Fairly thin, even a bit watery texture. Fishy, caramelly aftertaste. Good, but not entirely convincing.

Dark raspberry color with a fine cream head.  A decent nutty smell with some malt goodness also.  Flavor is nice and smooth, not too strong at all.  A definate drinking beer.  The mouthfeel is mildly oily so it goes down very easily, much like SJP's last prom date...but thats a whole different story.

Dark brown hue with good tan head and some lacing. Yep, there is hazelnut here but also detected coffee, chocolate, cherry, and cookie dough. Nice sweet and tart balance, some fresh hops show in the finish. Most of the aroma showed up on the palate, nice. A bit thin mouthfeel. A very nice brew indeed, shows all the characteristics I look for in a brown ale, plus a little bit more. The best brown I have ever tasted, edgeing out Samuel Smith and Bells. Highly recommended.

Excellent taste, but just a little watery.  I guess browns are like that.  I think this the best brown I've ever had.  The taste is hazelnut and chocolate.  My favorite from Rogue is the chocolate stout.  This one gives me teasingly memories of that.  Very drinkable.  I'm practically guzzling it.  It's that good.

Good dark brown color,small foamy tan head with a good amount of staying power.Malty aroma,mild bitterness as well as a very light hazelnut aroma.Malty taste at the beginning that later turns to a very nicely done hazelnut flavor,mild cocoa or chocolate in between the top two flavors with a nice bitter taste following up them all.The after taste was mostly chocolate with a hice hoppy presence and posiibly just a hint of hazelnut.The brew has a decent feel to it and also a slight gritty side as well.I'd have to say a very nice brew,and it's to bad this was the last bottle they had but the price was nice .99/bottle out of the clearance basket.

The aroma is not amazingly strong, though it definitely has the hazelnut character the brewer claims. The flavor is equally nutty, and quite complex and malty. Very smooth and drinkable, with a chocolatey aftertaste that fades quickly.

From the nice, tan head and dark, rich color of the beer, to the emptying of the glass, the appearance is excellent, whatever that's worth. I personally give far less thought to appearance than to taste, and this brown ale is a winner by every measure. One of my all-time favorites. I only wish I'd tried it sooner.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2005 Smells like the hazelnut coffee they make at Dunkin Donuts that fills the whole store.  Notes of berries and alcohol in the nose as well.  Smells remarkably like a fine Belgian.  Beautiful dark brown body with a brown head that lasts with beautiful lacing all around the glass.  Rich flavor with plenty of nuttiness, glorious malts and a nice, hoppy finish.  Aftertaste of fine dark chocolate.  This is quite simply the best beer I have ever had.  

Being a brown ale nut, I bumped this one up to a perfect score after its initial rating.  Corrected.

This seemed so promising.  The bottle even had a picture that looked remarkably like my friend John.  However, the flavor was dispersed and watery, with only a vague hazelnut aftertaste that I didn't notice until I was halfway through the 22oz bottle.
quite sweet, and what a list of ingredients!  actually when it warmed up a bit was very very elegant, and complex.  wish they came in smaller bottles.  recommended
Ruby brown, lasting beige head.Interesting hazelnut dry malt nose.Complex hazelnut malt flavor. Great body.
another wonderful beer by rogue- do these guys make bad brews?  dark in color, almost black, not much of a head out of the bottle.  nice thick hazelnut taste.  mmm give me more

Chocolate, caramel aroma, chestnut colour, with a large toffee head. Roasted, candied malt flavour, mild tootsie roll taste as well, nutty towards the end. Well balanced, light bodied, nice bitterness. Really good example.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2003 With its frothy head and amber-brown body this brew looks like root beer. Sweet aroma of nuts, molasses, and nutmeg. Also smells fragrant. Initial flavor is stunning. Deep, rich nuttiness plus a huge, complex malt character. Mild organic honey and molasses sweetness that builds and becomes a burnt sugar flavor after awhile. Aftertaste includes some delicate hop spice. This beer left me with a mixed impression, probably because I'm just not a big fan of Brown Ales. The artfulness of this beer is impressive but it left me with a mouth-coating staleness that I find in some Browns. If you're a big Brown fan, you'll probably love this beer.

Draft: Dark brown with minimal beige head.  Some nuttiness in the nose.  Malty flavor with quite a bit of nut.  Not bad, but not one of their best.  Based on other reviews I may need to retry, but as of now ...

Chocolate nutty aroma with a hoppy background. Dark brown pour with nice tan head. Flavor is very complex for a brown ale, almost like a porter with it's amount of chocolate malt. It's malty and acidic on the palate and one of the best brown ales ever, hazelnut is the way to go with these all the way.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2004 Nice solid hazelnut dark brown in color, how fitting, thin but firm creamy dark ivory head, faded fast to leave a skim always present and lace in thin sheets. Aroma is a light roasty chocolate and hazelnuts, with a hint of coffee, quite appetizing.
Taste is rockin' smooth of chocolate tones and hazelnuts, slightly roasty and a touch of quick sweetness. Nice airy nut-like dryness in the finish. Nice creamy medium body, way smooth, quite nice and easy, makes for excellent drinkin'. The only thing is that its over to fast, but man its good! Another top notcher by Rogue.
Morimoto version-
I couldn't tell much difference between this and the other hazelnut brew Rogue makes except it seems to have more extractness to it. Nice solid dark brown color with some dark orangey glowing edges, thin but firm creamy dark ivory head, faded off slowly, lace in small spots. Smell is light roasty chocolate and a big time hazelnut extractness to it, some wiffs have more hazelnut then others where others were nearly empty. Taste is about as smooth as the other hazelnut beer with some lightly favorable chocolate tones and hazelnuts, slightly roasty and a touch of quick sweetness. Nice airy nut-like dryness in the finish, yet stays sweet. Perhaps a bit too much in that regards. Again with some sips the extract is more evident then others. Seemingly off a bit comparingly to the original. Still, a nice creamy medium body encompasses it while it maintains an overall smoothness and drinkability. Good, but the extract stood out a bit too much then what the original portrays. However, it is quite nice and wouldn't turn it down for nothing and; albiet it's a bit one dimensional.
This beer lives up to the hype!  Deep reddish brown color, nutty aroma.  Flavors are nutty with also coffee and caramel. No harsh aftertaste. Impressive.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2007 Bottle, 2006-01-27, 6-3-7-3-14=33Brown color. Aroma of mature malt. Bitter taste, very original and well conceived, malt, hazelnuts, vanilla, roasted malt Like a brunch at Coffee HouseBottle, 2003-07-10, 6-4-6-3-12=31Brown color. Aroma of fresh backed cake, malt, light hop. Quite good body, stout-like, roasty, nutty. Maybe too weak in the end. Too much monotonous finish: caramel.
22 oz. One of my favorites. A deep, melancholy red color, with a smooth aroma and taste.

Bottled. Hazelnut colour alright, deep bone colour. Wonderfully different aroma, and the taste. Tastes like a malted milkshake. Wonderfully creamy, sweat and malty. Did feel a bit like 6% but there you go.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2005 Dark brown body with a diminishing head.  Nutty malt aroma, light hops (herbs?), and moderate yeastiness (dough).  Sweetness throughout with a moderately bitter finish.  Oily to creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation.  A little unbalanced to the sweet side.  Peppery saaz hops are detectable and do a good job of keeping the hazelnut sweetness under control.

Rerate 8/14/03.  Better than I originally gave it credit for (4.1).  Starting a little warmer (50 degrees F)than Im sure I had it last time, I noticed just how svelt this brew is.  Smooth, nutty, lightly tingling carbonation (maybe a little too much so), a good creamy mouthfeel, delicious chocolate malt, nice spicey Saaz kick without being overly hoppy.  The list goes on and on.  Using Saaz and Perle hops in this brew was absolutely genious, IMHO.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2004 A strange one. Tastes like a Vanilla Coke/Newcastle Brown shandy with some hazelnut syrup and a touch more malt. Very odd, and unevenly balanced. The flavours don't blend well at all, really bad, especially when i had such high hopes. Another good reason for me not to like brown ales. Odd. Re-rate: Having this about a year after my firts sample, my views have still not changed.

22 oz. Good dark amber appearance and creamy head.  Body is very weak and taste lacks the fullness of Bells' Best.  The hazelnut would have been good if it was bolstered by some roasted maltiness. I was disappointed but will allow for the fact that this may have been a bad bottle/too late in the season or it is just better on tap.

Have had both in the bottle and out of a keg. Definitely the quintessential Brown Ale. Lovely nose of sweet malt and hazelnuts, with a deep, brown color and  a full, light brown head. The mouth begins with rich maltiness which is suddenly chased by a mouth-filling nuttiness that coats the tongue and throat. The aftertaste lingers and seems to change as it lies in the back of the throat. One of the best beers made.

Bottled. Deep red brown, thin creamy beige head and good condition. Low chocolate and nut aromas, decidedly hazelnutty in the mouth, like liquid nutella, with a faintly tart edge and a dry bitterness developing in the aftertaste

Nice brown color, with a creamy white head, and a mildly nutty aroma.  I thought this tasted very nice, the hazelnut flavor well balanced with the malt and hops.  Smooth from front to back, definately worth a try.
Purists may be skeptical, but this is genius.  Nuts are one of the few non-traditional flavors welcome in beer.  No to jalapenos, no to cotton candy, yes to hazelnut.  This brew is brilliant!
Very good brew! Nice nutty tone with very good malts - chocolately taste compliments the nut perfectly!

Pours dark/medium brown.  Little to no head that goes quickly.  Nutty, coffee aroma.    Mocha, hazelnut taste.  Could be a little better for me if it had a bit more alcohol and a creamier consistency.  Otherwise, very well done.

Pours a medium tan head with fine-small bubbles. It had fair lacing on the sides of my mug. It had a brown body. It has a coffee flavor to it which I enjoyed. There was no bitterness to this brew. It had a slight sweet aftertaste to it that was not overwhelming to me.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2003 This brew pours a creamy small head of light brown bubbles and a semi transparent dark brown body. With a mild malt aroma, this brew has a taste of caramel and spice with just a hint of coffee flavoring. It goes down very smoothly yet leaves a slight dry lingering after taste of the coffee flavoring.

Another great Rogue product.  Pours nicely and looks like a brown ale/stout hybrid.  Tastes that way too - a teriffic combination. Feel and finish near perfect.  This IS nectar.    Why didn't I buy more bottles?
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Aroma was notibly nutty.  Body feature low carb with a dark brown cola color. Head was miniscule and rapidly faded.  Flavor was very roasty, slightly nutty, and hoppy.  I thought it could use a little bit more sweet maltiness and the texture should be a little creamier and less watery.  Finish was a bland burnt flavor.  Pretty good overall but not outstanding.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2003 Wonderful dark brown/ruby color with a large, thick tan head. The aroma definitely did not come out until the beer warmed quite a bit, then it was full of nutty, chocolate, caramel, bock-ish maltiness. The flavor was sweet...chocolate, hazelnuts, caramel, sarsparilla (whatever is in that stuff), and a nice roasted malt. This beer achieves greatness with its aftertaste...pure chocolate/rootbeer goodness. This is a magnificent brew...worthy of everything great said about it in these reviews.

Sweet, malty aroma like a doppelbock. Bit of chocolate with a nutty nose - like a brazil nut. Mocha and nice aromatic hops. Copper brown with slight haze. Light tan foamy lacing head. Light medium carb and silky watery body. A bit sweet up front. Deep, rich malts but not cloying. Finishes with a nice tang then smooth nutty chocolate after. Very smooth - no bitterness. A very good brown ale with great chocolate nutty taste, though the watery finish detracted a bit.

A very great and distinct nut flavor to this from the start to the end. The best thing at the otherwise joke yardhouse.  Nice woodsey malts with very crisp nut flavor. Great brown color and the usual amount of head. The taste is very nice, and very noticable, no guessing here.
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2003 Dark malty ale with a nice head. Hazelnut flavor clearly present. A solid brown ale that I would try.
A nice toasty ale, good malted flavor, definite nuttiness in there. Not really "sweet" despite the maltiness, a characteristic I liked. Had it on tap.

Dark dark amber thick large bubbled head sweet malty aroma. Mildly sweet nutty flavor with a bit of toasted bread pushing the hop envelope for a brown. A marvelous brown ale the best I have ever tried

UPDATED: APR 26, 2005 Yummy... I had this one on tap in the northwest.  At first taste, I wasnt sure if I liked it.  Half way through I decided this is the greatest brown ale.  I am rating it so high because of the novelty and the goodness
22 oz bomber-I think this is overated!!!  i didnt think much of this beer at all.  pretty bland and boring.
Had this on draft at the Grey Lodge in Phila. For once a brown with flavor, I tend to find Browns boring. Good malt flavor.
Had this at the brewery. If there was a desert beer, this would be it. Outstanding complex flavor.  Clearly taste the Hazelnut. This is a must have.
Nice evening with Esche and Pivo. Nutty, milk chocolate nose. Mahagony dark color with a hazelnutbrown head and a medium frothy head. Chocolate malty nutty taste. Medium lasting silky taste.
drinking too much means going nuts. Not too bad, but not very good either...

Darker brown colour, almost no head. Decent smell...not really nutty, but somewhat acidic. Not too strong of a taste, very mild and somewhat 'nutty'. Not a great beer. I don't like "nut brown" stylings much, and this is a good example of why. Better luck next time, I suppose!

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2004 Decent nose - complex mix of malt, chocolate and raisins. Dark brown with lathery head. Very tasty indeed: toffee, hazelnut and maybe chocolate. Little pronounce hop character but a good balance overall. Creamy mouth feel at first with a dry end. A full and flavorful beer consistent with Rogue's offerings.
